sense.definition: Teth, the ninth letter of the Alphabet.
sense.notes: It interchanges dialectically with צ, as טביא a. צבי, with ת, as חטף a. חתף; with ד, as דפף a. טפף.

sense.definition: , as a numeral, nine, v. א'.
sense.notes: —Maas. Sh. IV, 11, v. טי"ת.
, v. טַאטֵא

sense.definition: (= h. טוֹב) to be bright, good, well.
sense.notes: —ט' על, ט' ל־ to feel well, be happy. Dan. IV, 24.—Targ. I Sam. XVI, 23 (ed. Wil. טָב).
— Pl. טָאבֵי. Targ. Prov. XIV, 22 (ed. Wil. טָבֵי).
, Tosef. B. Kam. X, 2, v. טְוָי

sense.definition: (Palp. of טא, cmp. טהר) [ to brighten,] to sweep.
sense.notes: R. Hash. 26 b; Meg. 18 a שקולי טאטיתא וטַאטִי ביתא (Ms. M. 2 טאטיך וכ') take the (thy) broom and sweep the house (from which the Rabbis learned the meaning of Is. XIV, 23).
R. Hash. 26 b; Meg. 18 a, v. preced.
, v. טְאֵב
, v. טוּס ch.
, v. טוּף ch.
, read: טְיָארִין, v. טְיָיר
, Y. Sabb. VII, 9 a top מטאלין מילייא, read: מן אילין מ'; cmp. Bab. ib. 70 a
Targ. Num. XIII, 22. Targ. Y. Gen. XLI, 50 (h. text און). Targ. Y. Ex. I, 11 (h. text פתם); a. e.
, v. טוּס ch.
, v. טוּף ch.

sense.definition: , Midr. Till. to Ps. I (ed. Bub. איסקוטא), a gloss to תריס, (Ital. targa) buckler, v. Yalk. Ps. 833.

sense.notes: , Ex. R. s. 11 בט', read: קַטָּאדִיקִי.

sense.definition: (contr. of טאב) = h. טוֹב, to be good, well.
sense.notes: —טב ל־ to feel well, be satisfied, fare well. Targ. Deut. XV, 16; a. e.
Targ. Zech. XII, 4 לַאֲטָבָא (ed. Lag. לאיט'). V. טוּב, a. יְטַב.

Targ. Gen. II, 9.—Targ. II, Esth. I, 19 דטבא ed. Lag. (oth. ed. דטָבַת)—Targ. Jud. V, 26 (missing in ed. Lag.); a. v. fr.—Gen. R. s. 22; Lev. R. s. 22, v. בִּישׁ. Ber. 60 b כל מאי דעביד … לטב (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) whatever God does is for a good purpose. Tam. 32 a דידי טבא וכ' my advice is better than yours.—Lev. R. s. 33, beg. מינה ט' וכ' from it (the tongue) comes what is good &c.; a. v. fr.

Y. Keth. IV, end, 29 b חד בית בטב וכ' (ed. Krot. בדב, read: חד ביתא טב) a house worth &c. Ib. מכיון דלית ביתא טב וכ' as the house is not worth more than &c.—Y. Peah I, 15 d bot. מילא דט' דכוותה something of equal value; Gen. R. s. 35, end (corr. acc.); a. fr.

Y. Taan. IV, 68 d top טב קרתא an officer of the town.— Pl. טָבִין, טָבַיָּיא, טָבֵי; fem. טָבָתָא, טָבָאתָא, טָבָן. Targ. Mic. VII, 1. Targ. Ps. CXXV, 4; a. fr.—B. Mets. 44 b שלים לה ט' וכ' pay her in good and full-weight coin. Y. Snh. X, 28 b bot. כל טָבָן וכ', v. נֶחֶמְתָּא. Lam. R. to I, 1 רבתי (חד מאת' 1) טבאתא the good fruits; a. fr.
Targ. Prov. XVII, 10.—Gitt. 14 b טב טב רמו ליה Ar. (ed. only one טב) strike him more (or, it is right, v. Rashi a. l.)—Y. Shek. IV, 48 a top, v. טָבָאוּת.

sense.definition: , עֵין טַב pr. n. pl. En Tab, a place where the New Moon was proclaimed in the days of Rabbi (v. Neub. Géogr. p. 272).
sense.notes: R. Hash. 25 a; Y. ib. II, 58 a bot.; Y. Taan. II, 66 a bot. עייני טב; Pesik. R. s. 41 עֵינְטַב.
, v. טַב II
, v. טְבַע

sense.definition: tabag, name of a jewel in the Highpriest’s breastplate.
sense.notes: Targ. Cant. V, 14 (Fl., to Levy Targ. Dict. I, 426 2, suggests טבאז = topaz).

sense.definition:
(v. טַב a. טַבְוָא) ( in a) good manner, well, properly (h.
הֵיטֵב).
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Deut. IX, 21; a. e.—Y. Ber. V, 9 c top לא עבדין ט' do not do right. Cant. R. to I, 1 מאן דקרי ט' וכ' I will go to whosoever explains the Bible well etc.—Y. Shebu. VII, 38 a bot. אין אתא הא ט' if he appears, it is well. Y. Shek. IV, 48 a top וטבות כן Bab. ed. (Y. ed. וטבא) and so it is right. Y. Maas. Sh. I, 52 d top וטבבו כן (corr. acc.)—Hebr. form: טָּבִית. Meïl. 17 a ט' אמר he spoke well (he is right).
Ab. I, 8; a. fr.
Y. Ab. Zar. I, beg. 39 a חיזרנו … מקום ששמו ט' we searched the whole Bible and could not find a place by the name of Tobal.
, Y. Maas. Sh. I, 52 d top וטבבו, read: וטָבוּת.

sense.definition: , pl. טַבְהֲקֵי (Pers. tâbah, tâvah, tapak, Lag. Ges. Abh. p. 49) ( pieces of) roasted meat.
sense.notes: Erub. 29 b bot. (Ar. sing.; ed. Ven. ט' ט' pieces after pieces &c.).
טַבְוַת, טַבְוַות (טבי, sec. r. of טב) beneficence, good deed. Targ. Mic. VII, 20 (perh. pl.).— Pl. טַבְוָן, טַבְוָון, טַבְוָותָא. Ib. (ed. Lag. טָבָן). Targ. Gen. XXXII, 11; a. e.
, v. טַבָּאוּת

sense.definition: slaughtering and preparing the pilgrim’s offering.
sense.notes: Ḥag. II, 4 (17 a) יום ט' וכ' the slaughtering day is observed after the Sabbath. Y. ib. 78 a bot. יומה הוא טְבוֹחָהּ its day (the festive day itself) is its slaughtering day.

sense.definition: Taboa ḥ, name of a windstorm (demon).
sense.notes: Sabb. 129 b
, v. טִיבּ'
, Y. Sabb. VI, 7 d (P’né Mosh. סכוסה), read סְבָכָה or שְׂבָכָה, v. כָּבוּל; cmp. Bab. ib. 57 b
, v. טִיבּוּעִין
, v. טִיבּוּר
, v. טַבָּאוּת
Snh. 97 a, v. טַבְיוֹמִי; B. Mets. 49 a (Ms. Alf. טָאבוּת, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 6).
, v. טִיבוּ
, v. טַפְזָא

sense.definition: , (b. h.) to prepare a feast, esp. to slaughter and dress meat, to cook.
sense.notes: Keth. 4 a טִבְחוֹ טָבוּחַ his meat for the feast is ready (for cooking).—Bets. 25 a (expl. בית טביחה) מקום שטוֹבַחַת וכ' the place where the animal cooks (digests) its food.

Ber. 56 a טַבְחַת ולא אכלת thou shalt prepare and not eat. Sabb. 129 b הוה ט' להו וכ' it (the wind or demon טָבוֹחַ) would have feasted on them (the Israelites), on their flesh and their blood; a. e.—V. מַטְבְּחַיָּיא
same. Gen. R. s. 57, end טבח טַבְּחוֹן Tabahò (Gen. XXII, 24) means, ‘Slaughter them’ v. גַּחֲמוֹן
Keth. 4 a, v. טָבַח.
Gen. R. s. 83 (ref. to Is. XXXIV, 6) אעפ"כ ט' גדול וכ' nevertheless the main onslaught will be in the land of Edom (Rome); Pesik. R. s. 14, end; s. 15; Yalk. Num. 759.
Bets. 28 a ט' אומן a professional butcher; a. fr.— Pl. טַבָּחִים. Kidd. IV, 14; a. e.
Targ. Y. Lev. I, 5.—Targ. I Sam. IX, 23, sq.—Ḥull. 18 a; a. e.— Pl. fem. טַבָּחָן. Targ. I Sam. VIII, 13.

ch. = h. טֶבַח. Targ. Prov. VII, 22.—Gen. R. s. 65 לקבל תורא ט' according to the size of the ox is the feast (as you call Esau (Rome) great, so will his punishment be great, ref. to Is. XXXIV, 6); Pesik. Haḥod. p. 56 b; Pesik. R. s. 15 (read לפום for נפיל); Cant. R. to II, 15 טבחיא (corr. acc.).
, v. טְבַח

sense.definition: a slave. Ber. II, 7; a fr.—2) name of several Amoraim. R. Hash. 22 a.
sense.notes: Meg. 6 b; a. e.—3) T. Rishba ( the hunter, Rashi). Sabb. 17 b top.

sense.definition: , כְּפַר ט' pr. n. pl. K’far Tabi, near Lydda.
sense.notes: Bets. 5 a; R. Hash. 31 b. Tosef. Ohol. IV, 2 כ' טַבְיָא (Var. טמא).

Targ. Deut. XII, 15; a. fr.—Snh. 95 a. Ḥull. 59 b, v. קֶרֶשׁ II; a. e.—Ib. 59 a בר ט' a young deer.— Pl. טָבַיָּא, טַבְיֵי. Targ. II Sam. II, 18; a. e.—Keth. 103 b וצידנא טביא (Rashi: וצדיינא טביי) and I caught deer.—Fem. pl. טָבְיָן, טַבְיַן. Targ. I Kings V, 3. Targ. Y. Deut. XIV, 5.—Y. Snh. VII, end, 25 d.—[Y. Ter. IX, end, 48 b מה טבייה, v. טִיב I ch.]
Snh. 97 a רב טבות … וא"ל רב ט' his name was R. Tabuth, some say, R. Tabyomi. Kidd. 14 b. Men. 70 a ט' בר קיסנא (Ms. M. טובי, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note).—Gen. R. s. 4. Ex. R. s. 93, end.
Bets. III, 3 בית טְבִיחָתָחּ the place where it is cut (neck); ib. 25 a מאי לאו מבית ט' ממש וכ' does this not mean actually from the place etc.? No, ממקום שטובחת וכ' v. טָבַח.
Mekh. Bo, Pisḥa, s. 11 (ref. to Ex. XII, 2

sense.definition: על בל הגעה ט' you must dip the hyssop into the blood for each time you strike.
sense.notes: Sifra Vayikra, Ḥobah, ch. III, Par. 3.—Zeb. 93 b; a. fr.—2) immersion, purification. Yoma 88 a, a. fr. ט' בזמנה מצוה the immersion in due time is obligatory (must not be postponed). Kerith. 9 a; a. v. fr.— Pl. טְבִילוֹת. Men. 7 b שיעור ט' enough for all dippings.—Yoma l. c.; a. fr. חייבי ט' those bound to take an immersion. Nidd. 29 b ומטבילין אותה … ט' and we make her take immersions at intervals during ninety five days; a. fr.

Snh. 39 a ומי סלקא ט' בנורא is the law requiring immersion (for levitical purification) complied with by putting the object in fire? Ib. עיקר ט' וכ' the true purification is by fire (ref. to Num. XXXI, 23).
f. same. Nidd. 30 a ט' יתירתא (Rashi טבילה) an additional immersion.
Num. R. s. 14, beg. שהסרתי אותו מן הט' וכ' whom I saved from drowning through the intervention of &c. [Y. Ber. V, 9 b תשנו מטביעה, v. מַטְבֵּעַ.]
, v. next w.

sense.definition: (טָבַע II) impression; ט' עַיִן identification of an object from a general impression of its form without stating particular marks.
sense.notes: Sabb. 114 a שמחזירין … בט' העין to whom a lost object is restored on his identification etc. [Some ed. טְבִיעַת.]

ch., טְבִיעוּת עֵינָא same. Gitt. 27 b; B. Mets. 19 a אי סימנא … או ט'ע' וכ if you require a special mark, I have one on it, if you require identification on general impression, I have it (I recognize it). Ib. 23 b להדורי … מרבנן בט' ע' as to restoring it to a scholar on his identification &c., v. preced.—Ḥull. 96 a אית לן ט' ע' בגויה we know him by his general impression (not by special marks). Ib. ט' ע' דקלא identification by one’s voice; a. fr.
, v. sub טבר'.

sense.definition: (v. טָבִי I) Tabitha, name of a handmaid.
sense.notes: Y. Nidd. II, beg. 49 d
Zeb. 93 b, a. e. וט' ולא מספג, v. סָפַג.

definition.italic: to immerse, to bathe for purification.

sense.notes: Yoma VII, 4 ירד וט' went down to the bath and took an immersion. Ber. 2 b שהכהנים טוֹבְלִין וכ' when the priests (that have been unclean) bathe in order to be permitted to partake of their priestly share; a. v. fr.—Ib. 22 a טוֹבְלֵי שחרין those taking a bath in the morning (after emission of semen virile); Y. ib. III, 6 c top ט' שחרית.—Tosef. Yad. II, 20 טובלי שחרין (Var. טוֹבְלָנֵי) morning bathers (Essenes, v. Graetz Gesch. d. Jud. III 2, p. 468, a. for correct vers. R. S. to Yad. IV, 8).— Part. pass. טָבוּל.—טְבוּל יום (one who has bathed in day-time,) one who has bathed but must wait for sunset to be perfectly clean (Lev. XXII, 7). T’bul Yom I, 1; a. fr.—Nidd. 30 a טְבוּלַת יום ארוך a woman after bathing whose day is adjourned (having to wait a long time for perfect levitical purity).—טְבוּל יוֹם T’bul Yom, name of a treatise of Mishnah and Tosefta of the order of Tahãroth

sense.definition: to dip into vinegar, salt &c., to make tasty; esp. to take a luncheon, to take the first course of a meal consisting of relishes; to take the antepast.
sense.notes: Maasr. IV, 1 המְטַבֵּל בשדה he who makes a luncheon (of fruits) in the field. Pes. X, 3 מטבל בחזרת he takes lettuce as antepast. Tosef. ib. X, 9 לא טי' וכ' if he has eaten as antepast only &c. Pes. 107 b אבל מטבל וכ' Ms. M. a. comment. (ed. מטביל) but he may make a luncheon of &c. Ib. השמש מטבל בבני וכ' comment. (ed. מטביל; Tosef. ib. X, 5 מכביש, v. כָּבַשׁ); a. fr.
Part. pass. מְטוּבָּל. Y. Shek. III, 47 c top מבושל כמ' boiled (wine) is (in ritual law) like spiced wine; v. infra.

sense.definition: to immerse vessels for purification, to order immersion.
sense.notes: Ter. II, 3 המַטְבִּיל כלים וכ' he who immerses vessels on the Sabbath. Bets. II, 2 מַטְבִּילִין את הכל וכ' you must immerse whatever needs immersion (both persons and vessels) before &c.—Ib. 3 (17 b), v. גַּב.—Nidd. 29 b, v. טְבִילָה; a. fr.
Erub. 28 b מטבילין בו וכ' they used to season the roast with it (in place of pepper).

definition.italic: to be immersed, to be made clean.

sense.notes: Mikv. V, 6 לא הוּטְבָּלוּ are not considered as clean through immersion; Tosef. ib. IV, 10.

Targ. Lev. IX, 9; a. fr.— Part. pass. טְבִיל, f. טְבִילָא. Targ. Josh. III, 15 (טְבִילָן?).—Snh. 39 a במאי טביל wherewith did he purify himself (after contact with a corpse)?; בנורא טביל he did it by means of fire, v. טְבִילָה. Nidd. 30 a לִיטְבְּלָהּ let her bathe; a. fr.—
Nidd. l. c. אַטְבְּלִינָן לה we make her bathe. Bets. 19 a לאַטְבּוּלֵיה to immerse it; a. fr.
1, to take an antepast. Pes. 114 b למיהדר לאַטְבּוּלֵי must take the bitter herb a second time; a. e.

sense.definition: (denom. of טֶבֶל) to create Tebel, to make obligatory the setting aside of tithes &c.
sense.notes: Y. Maasr. IV, beg. 51 a אור טוֹבֵל fire (roasting) makes subject to sacred gifts; מלח טוֹבֶלֶת salting makes subject &c.; a. fr.— Part. part. טָבוּל that which is subject to sacred gifts, forbidden as Tebel. Ber. 47 b טבל ט' מדרבנן Tebel declared to be such by rabbinical enactment; a. e.— Pl. טְבוּלִים, טְבוּלִין. Y. Dem. VI, 25 c bot., opp. מתוקנים. Ib. VII, 26 b top פירות ט' fruits of which the sacred gifts have not been set aside.

sense.definition: to become, or to be declared Tebel.
sense.notes: Y. Maasr. I, end, 49 b טבל שנ' מדבריהן Tebel which is declared to be such by rabbinical law, v. supra. Ib. IV, beg. 51 a נִטְבְּלוּ the roasted ears became subject to tithes; a. fr.
Men. 70 a טַבְלָהּ לה (not טבלא) he made it subject to tithes. Bets. 13 a טַבְלָן ביומיה Ms. M. (ed. טבלא, corr. acc.) he made them Tebel on that day (by designating them for immediate use); a. e.

a. Hif.) fruits of which you are permitted to make a luncheon or improvised meal in the field without separating the priestly or levitical shares. Ber. 35 b איו הט' טתחייב וכ' the tebel is not subject to tithes, until it is brought home (for consumption or storage).—Esp. Tebel, produces in
that stage in which the separation of levitical and priestly shares respectively is required, before you may partake of them; eatables forbidden pending the separation of sacred gifts. Ter. X, 6 חבילי תלתן של ט' bundles of fenugrec subject to T’rumah; expl. Bets. 13 a ט' טבול של תרומה (Rashi: לתרומה) Tebel considered as such, because it is subject to T’rumah (Deut. XVIII, 4; Ms. M. של ת' גדולה to the general gifts of T’rumah and tithes); ט' טבול של תרומת מעשר Tebel (in the possession of a Levite who received it for tithes, and) considered Tebel, because it is subject to the T’rumah from tithes (Num. XVIII, 26). Ter. IX, 6 הט' גדוליו וכ' the growth of seeds that had been subject to sacred gifts the separation of which had been omitted &c. Ib. 7 אע"פ שפירותיו ט' although its growth is considered Tebel (because the seeds were not tithed) &c. Kidd. 58 b טִיבְלֹו של וכ' his neighbor’s Tebel; a. fr.—[Erub. 86 a יש לו ט', read: טַבְלָא I.].— Pl. טְבָלִים. Ib.—Ned. 20 a סיפך להאכילך ט' he will finally give thee to eat things from which the tithes have not been given. Ḥull. 132 b; a. e.

Nidd. 46 b ט' דאורייתא Tebel by Biblical law (lacking the separation of T’rumah). Bets. 13 a אסורייתא טובלא (some ed., corr. acc.), v. אֲסוּרְיָיתָא. Ib. התם לא ט' וכ' there (in the case of ears, ib.) it was not subject to T’rumah &c.; a. e.

טבלל to tie around, v. Ges. H. Dict. 10 s. v. טְבוּלִים; cmp. טבעת, טבור) a bell or collection of bells, an instrument especially used at public processions (in Arab. drum, Gr. ταβαλά; v. Sm. Ant. s. v. Tintinnabulum as to forms and uses of bells). Targ. Koh. VII, 5 קל ט' וכ' the music of the fools. Targ. Cant. I, 1.—Sot. 49 b (expl. אֵירוּס) ט' דחד פומא a tabla with one mouth (a single bell). Ber. 57 a תלאי ט' וכ' (I dreamt) I suspended a tabla and shouted into it (differ. in Rashi). Sabb. 110 a בט' to the sound of a tabla (at a wedding). M. Kat. 9 b (prov.) בת שיתין … לקל ט' רהטא a woman of sixty years, like one of six, runs at the sound of the tabla (to see the procession). Y. Erub. VIII, 25 a bot. אפי' ט' if even he has there a t. (which he dare not move on the Sabbath); Bab. ib. 86 a יש לו טבל.—In gen. musical instrument. Arakh. 10 b, v. גּוּרְגָּנָא.

sense.definition: (tabula, tabella, τάβλα) plank, board, tablet for writing; book of accounts, list; will.
sense.notes: Erub. IV, 8 (49 b) כטבלה מרובעת (Talm. ed. כטבלא) like a square tablet. R. Hash. II, 8 (24 a) על הט' בכותל Ms. M. (ed. בט' ובכותל, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) (drawings of the phases of the moon) on a tablet on the wall. Gitt. 20 a כתב שע"ג ט' ופינקס writing (of manumission) on a tablet or on a board (account book or will, v. Treat. ‘Ãbadim, ed. Kirchh. ch. III, Rev. des Etudes Juives 1883, p. 150). Y. Snh. I, 18 d bot. ט'של רפואות list of (superstitious) remedies (Pes. 56 a ספר וכ'); a. fr.—[Y. Bets. I, 60 c bot. טבלה ברייתא וכ' (read טַבְלָתָה pl.) the outside stone plates of the colonnade of Asi.]— Pl. טַבְלָאוֹת, טַבְלָיוֹת. Y. B. Bath. VI, 14 c bot. ט' של שיש וכ' polished marble plates for walls. Yalk. Ex. 426 ונראין ט' ט' וכ' and they appeared like marked off squares surrounding &c. Pes. 57 a ט' של זהב gold plates.—Chald. pl. טַבְלָתָה, v. supra.
Ḥull. 132 b Y. Gitt. IV, 46 a; a. e; v. next w.
Y. Erub. V, 25 a bot.; (Sabb. 101 a טַבְלָא).—Y. Sabb. VI, 8 a bot.; a. e.
, v. טַבְלָא II
, v. טַבְלַאי

— Pl. טַבְלָרִין. Pesik. R. s. 21 [read:] ט' שלו ושמו חקוק על לבם כהדין איספרגיס the angels are His couriers, and His name is engraven upon their hearts like a seal (v. Pesik. Baḥod, p. 108 b, note 16
Targ. Prov. XXIV, 34 (h. text איש מגן).
Gitt. 56 b לטוֹבְעוֹ to drown him (sink his ship). Ib. טְבָעוֹ He drowned him; a. fr.
Ber. 16 b טָבְעָה ספינתו וכ' if his ship went down &c. Meg. 10 b; Snh. 39 b מעשה ידי טוֹבְעִין וכ' my creatures (Egyptians) are perishing in the sea, and you want to sing?; a. e.

Yalk. Gen. 120 ה' האבן He made the stone sink down to the depth &c.; (Pirké d’R. El. ch. XXXV, וטָבְעָה האבן; Midr. Till. to Ps. XCI, end וטבע אותה). Yalk. Ex. 241 להַטְבִּיעַ את מצרים to drown the Egyptians; a. e.

Targ. Y. Gen. IV, 8.—Targ. I Sam. XVII, 49; a. e.—Pes. 40 b ארבא … דטָבְעָא וכ' a ship with wheat sank &c. Sabb. 108 b מעולם לא ט' וכ' never was yet a man drowned in the Lake of Sodom. B. Bath. 153 a אמרה לִיטְבַּע ארביה (Ms. H. אמרה ליה טבאי וכ', Ar. אמרה לו טבאי) said she, May his (thy) ship go under; a. e.—[Targ. Y. Deut. XXVIII, 29 טביעין some ed., read. תב', v. תְּבַע.]
B. Bath. 73 a גלא דמְטַבַּע וכ' the wave which threatens to sink the ship. Ḥull. 60 a אתא מיטרא טַבְּעֵיה בימא there came a rain and sank the provision into the sea.
Targ. O. Ex. XV, 4.

sense.definition: [ to round, shape, denom. טֶבַע, fr. which טָבַע]

sense.notes: Snh. IV, 5 (37 a) אדם טוֹבֵעַ כמה מטבעות וכ', v. חוֹתָם; Y. ib. VI, 22 b bot.; a. e.—Trnsf. to formulate. Gitt. 5 b, a. e. כל המשנה ממטבע שטָבְעוּ וכ' he who deviates from the formula of the deed of divorce which the scholars have fixed. Ber. 40 b כל המשנה … שט' … בברכות he who changes the formula of benedictions which &c.; a. fr.

Num. R. s. 20 (ref. to Deut. XXVII, 12, sq.) בברכות היה מזכירן … לא היה טוֹבְעָן in ordering blessings He mentioned them (the people) …, but in ordering curses He did not mention them explicitly; (Tanḥ. Balak 12 לא היה מזכירם; ed. Bub. 18 תובען, Yalk. Num. 766 תובעין, incorr.)
Targ. Prov. VIII, 25 נִטְבְּעוּן.

טִבְעוֹ של פ' יצא one’s coin passes, i.e. one’s authority is recognized. Shebu. 6 b זו רומי חייבת שטִיבְעָהּ וכ' Ms. M. (ed. פרס) that is wicked Rome whose government is recognized all over the world. Meg. 14 b לא יצא טִבְעֲךָ בעולם thou art not yet the legitimate king; cmp. מוֹנִיטָא. [Y. Ber. V, 9 b מטבעה של תפלה ed. Lehm., oth. ed. מטביעה, v. מַטְבֵּעַ.]

sense.definition: Teb ʿ a, a coin equal to half a Sela.
sense.notes: Y. Shek. II, 46 d top (the ten brothers) sold Rachel’s first-born for twenty silver pieces (denars) ונפל לכל א' וא' מהם ט' so that a Tebʿa came upon each (Bab. ed. טבעה, טיבעה, Ms. M. טובע).— Pl. טְבָעִים, טְבָעִין (טוֹבְעִין, fr. טוֹבַע). Shek. II, 4. Y. l. c. טו' פלגי סלעין (Bab. טבעין) tib ʿ in i.e. half-Shekels.

sense.definition: that which is to be shaped, substance, element.
sense.notes: — Pl. as ab. Num. R. s. 14 כנגד ארבעה ט' וכ' corresponding to the four elements of which the Lord created &c. [In later Hebr.: nature, character; Nature.]

Targ. Y. Gen. XXIV, 22 Levita (ed. דרכמונא; v. Y. Shek. II, 46 d top, quot. in preced.). Targ. Y. Ex. XXX, 13 (ed. Amst. טַבְעָא). Targ. II Esth. VI, 10 טִבְעִי וטִבְעָךְ אזיל וכ', v. preced.—B. Mets. 46 a דליכא עלייהו ט' which have no stamp. Ib. 44 b הוי ט' is considered as coin (money), opp. to פירא merchandise. Shebu. 6 b ט' דמאן וכ' the coin of which goes farther (whose power is greater)?—Nidd. 20 b ט' דבבל וכ' the Babylonian coin (which I could not understand) was the cause &c.; a. fr.— Pl. טִבְעֵי. B. Mets. 25 a ט' מכריז Ms. H. a. R. (ed. sing.). he publishes that he has found ‘coins’.
B. Bath. 153 a לא איפרק מט' (Ms. M. מעונשיה) did not escape the loss through shipwreck (which the woman had wished him.)

sense.definition: Tibon or Tibin (prob. Tubun, west of Sepphoris, Neub. Géogr. p. 196).
sense.notes: Makhsh. I, 3, v. חֲלִיקוּפְרִי.—Tosef. Meg. II, 5; Y. ib. IV, beg. 74 c בה"כ של טיבעין the synagogue of T.—Sifré Deut. 323 איש טיבעים; Yalk. Deut. 946 כפר טיבעין.—[Erub. 29 a bot. לטיבעין (Var. טביעים, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 6), missing in Tosef. ib. IX (VI), 4, v. עַרְדִּיסְקוֹס.]
— Pl. טִבְעוֹנִין, טִי'. Y. Ber. II, 4 d bot.; Meg. 24 b אנשי טבעונין (prob. to be read: טִבְעוֹן).
, v. טִבְעוֹן

Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. II, 1 ט' שהוא חוגר וכ' a ring which one puts around his loins; ט' של אצבע finger ring; Sabb. 52 b. Ib.; Kel. XII, 1 ט' אדם ornamental ring; ט' בהמה והכלים a ring used for beasts or for garments (for fastening); a. fr.—Esp. seal-ring. Sabb. 59 b. Deut. R. s. 2; a. fr.—הֲסָרַת ט' the authority given by transfer of the ring. Meg. 14 a; Lam. R. to IV, 22.— Pl. טַבָּעוֹת. Sabb. l. c.; a. fr.—Ab. d’R. N. ch. XVIII ט' ט', v. מַטְבֵּעַ.—Trnsf. (פי הט') anus, end of the rectum. B. Kam. 92 a. Sabb. 108 b bot.; a. fr.—Y. ib. VIII, end, 11 c לטבעות, read לטבעת, v. אַמְבְּטִיתָא.
, v. טבריטי

Targ. Y. I Num. XXXIV, 8, v. חֲמָת. Targ. Y. I Deut. III, 17 (?). Ib. XXXIII, 23.—Gen. R. s. 23, beg. ט' ע"ש טיביריאוס Tiberias is named after Tiberius; Yalk. Ps. 758 (corr. acc.). Gen. R. s. 31, v. בְּטִיטָא. Meg. 6 a; a. fr.—Y. Taan. IV, 69 b bot. טיברי (corr. acc.).—Denom. טִיבְרָנִי, f. טִיבְרָנִית. Y. Ḥall. II, 58 c bot. Y. Pes. X, 37 c bot. ט' ישנה old Tiberian measure.— Pl. טִיבְרָנִיּוֹת. Y. Keth. I, 25 b top סביריניות (corr. acc.), v. הָגַן.— Ch. טִיבַרְיָאָה, pl. טִיבַרְיָאֵי. Y. Taan. l. c. Y. Bets. II, 61 b top טיבראי (corr. acc.)
Yalk. Ps. 758 (not … ת); Gen. R. s. 23 טיביריאוס, טיבריאוס, v. preced.

sense.definition: , Pesik. Hashsh’mini, p. 191 b Ms. O. (ed. נוב בעי); Pesik. R., addit.
sense.notes: (ed. Fr., p. 201, v. Var. lect. notes a. l.),—a corruption, prob. to be read: טְיָיטְרוֹן or תִּיאַטְרוֹן (q. v.) theatre, spectators, opp. קנגיא (κυνήγιον) the participants in the fights of the arena; cmp. בלטוורא.

sense.definition: (denom. of טיבור) [ to measure the length from shoulder to belly, v. Macc. III, 13, a. Bart. a. l.; Tosef. ib.
sense.notes: V (IV), 15,] to lash a transgressor with a strap commensurate to his size (v. מַלְקוּת). Y. Yoma V, 42 c (expl. מצליף, Mish. V, 5) כמְטַבְרֵיר Ar. s. v. צלף (ed. כמטוורד, read כמְטַוְורֵר, cmp. טַוְורָא) like the movement of the lasher in court; (cmp. Bab. ib. 55 a top כמנגדנא).

sense.definition: (b. h.); Tebeth, the tenth month of the Hebrew calendar, containing twenty nine days, varying between the second of December and the twenty ninth of January.
sense.notes: Targ. Esth. II, 16. Targ. II Esth. III, 7. Ib. 8 מלקטין פשרי דט' store up the melting snows of Tebeth (in their cisterns).—Taan. 6 b טבא … דט' מנוולתא auspicious is the year whose Tebeth is ugly (muddy from heavy rains); דט' ארמלתא whose Tebeth is a widow (without rain, v. בַּעֲלָא).

sense.definition: (v. טָבָאוּת) ( in a) good condition, right.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 26 (ref. to טֹבֹת, Gen. VI, 2) טבת כתיב משהיו מטיבין וכ' you may read tabbath (that they were all right); when people had made the bride ready &c.
, v. טַב
, Sifré Deut. 234 quot. in Ar. (ed. יגא), v. טוֹגָא
, Pesik R. s. 43, v. טִיגֵּן, s. v. טִיגָּן.
טִיגֵּן, v. טִיגָּן.

sense.definition: (tigris, v. Sm. Ant. s. v.) tiger.
sense.notes: Ḥull. 59 b ט' אריה וכ' the tiger is the lion of Be-Ilai (the mountains of interior Asia), i.e. what the lion is in other regions.

sense.definition: Tadi, (שְׁעַר) ט', name of a northern gate of the Temple.
sense.notes: Midd. I, 3; 9; II, 3 (Var. טרי).

sense.definition: clean, pure; not subject to levitical uncleanness.
sense.notes: B. Mets. 86 a שגופך ט' … נשמתך בט' (Ms. בטהרה) thy body is pure, and thy soul expired with (the word) ‘pure’; Snh. 68 a.—Kidd. 70 b וסימניך טמא טמא ט' ט' and the sign (by which to remember which of the two families is of unblemished descent) is, that with the name of an unclean animal (raven) is unclean, that with the name of a clean animal (dove) is clean; B. Bath. 91 a. Kel. III, 7 ובחרסית ט' and the person that touches the clay is clean (not affected by levitical uncleanness). Ib. IV, 1 ט' is not subject to levitical uncleanness; a. v. fr.—דג ט', עוף; בהמה טהורה a fish, a bird, a domestic animal permitted to eat. Ḥull. XII, 2. Ib. IV, 3 בטהורה טהור if it occurs with an animal of the clean class, the person is levitically clean; a. v. fr.— Pl. טְהוֹרִים, טְהוֹרִין; טְהוֹרוֹת. Kel. II, 1 פשוטיהן ט' the flat-surfaced among them are not subject to uncleanness.—Ber. 2 b שהכהנים ט' וכ' Ms. M. (ed. מטוהרים) when the purified priests enter &c. B. Mets. 61 b; a. v. fr.

sense.definition: to be clean, pure, esp. to be levitically clean; to be unsusceptible of levitical uncleanness.
sense.notes: Neg. X, 8 שט' שעה אחת which has been declared clean once. Mikv. II, 2 עד שיודע שט' until it is ascertained that it has become clean. Ib. III, 2 ויִטְהֲרוּ העליונים מן וכ' so that the waters coming from above become cleansed from the impurity of the lower waters. Neg. VII, 4 ויִטְהַר ממנו and is declared clean from it (the last scall); a. fr.
Ber. 2 b, v. next w.

sense.definition: to purify, make ( levitically) clean; to absolve from sin.
sense.notes: Yoma VIII, 9 מי מְטַהֵר וכ' who is it that absolves you? Ib. (ref. to Jer. XVII, 13) מה מקוה מט' וכ' as the ritual bath (v. מִקְוֶה) cleanses the unclean, so does the Lord &c.; a. fr.

sense.definition: to keep clean, guard against contact with unclean things.
sense.notes: R. Hash. 16 b חייב … לטַהֵר את עצמו וכ' one is bound to keep one’s self clean for the festive days.

sense.definition: to declare טָהוֹר, to decide in favor of cleanness.
sense.notes: Snh. 17 a bot. מי שיודע לטַ' וכ' one who knows how to prove a creeping thing to be clean. Ib. אני אדון ואֲטַהֲרֶנוּ I will argue and prove it to be clean. Eduy. VIII, 7 לטמא ולטַ' to decide on unclean and clean; a. v. fr.— Part. pass. מְטוֹהָר, pl. מְטוֹהָרִים. Ber. 2 b, v. preced.
Snh. 94 b מיד ט' it becomes clean at once. Ḥull. 60 b טִיהֲרוּ; Gitt. 38 a טהרו, v. סִיחוֹן.
Tanḥ. Metsora 7 נִטְהֲרָה וכ' she became clean on the eighth day. Ib. ונִטְהֶרֶת and becomes clean; a. fr.

sense.definition: to be cleansed, to cleanse one’s self; to amend.
sense.notes: Yoma 38 b בא לִטָּהֵר מסייעים אותו (Ms. M. 2 להִטָּהֵר) if one is willing to do good, he will be assisted; Sabb. 104 a; Yalk. Prov. 935 לִיטָּהֵר; a. e.—Yoma VIII, 9 (85 b) לפני מי אתם מִיטַּהֲרִים Mish. a. Y. ed. (Bab. ed. מִטַּ') before whom do you cleanse yourselves (from sin)?; a. e.
Ber. 2 b וט' גברא, v. infra.

sense.definition: to be cleared away, be gone.
sense.notes: Ib. 2 a, sq. (ref. to Lev. XXII, 7 ובא השמש וטהר) ממאי דהאי … והאי וטהר ט' יומא דלמא … ט' גברא how do you know that this uba hash-shemesh means his sunset (the finished sunset of the seventh day, v. Ms. M. in Rabb. D. S. a. l.), and v’taher means, the day is gone; may be uba &c. means the approach of his evening (beginning sunset. Tosaf. a. l.; Rashi: the arrival of his (eighth) morning), and v’taher (referring to the man) means, the man becomes clean (by means of his sacrifice, Rashi).
Yoma 59 a, a. e., v. טִיהֲרָא a. next w.
B. Mets. 84 b טַהֲרִינְהוּ he declared them clean.

Yoma V, 6 על טָהֳרוֹ של מזבח (or טְהָרוֹ) immediately on the top of the golden altar (free from coals or ashes, v. גִּילּוּיָא). Men. 97 a על טהרו של שולחן (Ms. M. על השל') immediately on the golden table.

sense.definition: (cmp. חָזֶה) the centre of the front.
sense.notes: Yoma 59 a (one opinion explain. טהרו של מזבח, v. supra) פלגיה דמזבח the centre of the altar front, as people say, טהר טיהרא והוי פלגא דיומא ‘the noon-light shines’ meaning by tihara the middle of the day; ib. 15 a; Zeb. 38 b
v. sub. טִיה'.
; preced. wds.)

sense.definition: clearness of the sky after the rainy season.
sense.notes: Ber. 59 a הרואה רקיע בטָהֳרָתָהּ (or בטַהֲ') he who sees the sky in its restored brightness (Ms. F. בטיהרו, v. טִיהָר). Ib. נראית רקיע בטהרתה (Ms. M. נראו שמים בטהרה; Yalk. Is. 335 נראה שמים בטִהֲרוֹ, corr. acc.).

sense.definition: pureness, condition of levitical cleanness; purification.
sense.notes: Sabb. 152 b תנה לו כמו שנתנה לך מה הוא בט' אף אתה בט' Ms. M. (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) give her (the soul) to Him as He has given her to thee, as He (has given her) in pureness, so give thou &c. Snh. 68 a, v. טָהוֹר.—Ber. 16 a (ref. to Num. XXIV, 6) מה נחלים … מטומאה לט' וכ' as the rivers raise man from a condition of uncleanness to one of cleanness, so do the tents (schools) &c. Ab. Zar. 8 a עובדי ע"ז בט' encouraging idolatry, though from no impure motives. Yoma 72 b; Men. 110 a הלומד תורה בט' he who studies the Law in (sexual) purity.—Snh. l. c. וטַהֲרָתָן במה שהן and their purification (immersion) is performed in whatever condition they are (whole or torn); a. v. fr.—Esp. ט' or טַהֲרַת הקודש observance of levitical rules originally prescribed for the handling of sacred food; also (mostly in pl.) secular food so prepared or pretended to be so prepared; v. חָבֵר.—Gitt. 62 a אין עושין חלת ע"ה בט' you must not separate the priest’s share under levitical precautions for a non-observant (because it might mislead the priest); Tosef. Dem. III, 1. Sabb. 13 a עד היכן פרצה ט' וכ' how far the custom of observing the rules of levitical cleanness for secular food has spread &c. Ḥag. II, 7 היה אוכל על ט' הקודש used to eat his ordinary meals with the observance required for sacred food; a. fr.— Pl. טָהֳרוֹת, טַהֲרוֹת. Tosef. Dem. l. c. אין עושין ט' לע"ה one must not prepare food with observance of levitical precautions for &c., v. supra. Ber. 19 a; B. Mets. 59 b כל ט' שטיהר וכ' all objects which R. … had declared clean. Tosef. Dem. II, 20 אין משלחין ט' וכ' you must not send food levitically prepared through a non-observant; a. v. fr.— Toh ŏ roth, or Tahãroth, (euphem. for טומאות), name of the sixth order of the Mishnah and Tosefta (סדר ט'), and of one treatise of that order.
, v. טוי

sense.definition: (b. h.) to be good, fit, handsome, valuable.

sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 26, v. טַבָּת. Ib. s. 83 (play on מהיטבאל, Gen. XXXVI, 39) מְטִיבֵי אלוהות היו they were dressers of idols; שהיו מֵטִיבִין עצמן וכ' they adorned themselves in honor of the idols. Ib. מטיבי נשים וכ' they dressed women for their wedding; a. e.—Esp. (את הנרות) ה' to trim, cleanse the lamps. Yoma III, 4 ולהֵטֵיב. Ib. I, 2. Ib. 14 b יֵיטִיב; a. fr.—V. הֲטָבָה.

sense.definition: to turn a dream unto good (saying, ‘I have dreamt a good dream’).
sense.notes: Ber. 55 b יְטִיבֶנּוּ בפני וכ' he shall turn it in the presence of three persons, and say &c.

Ib. IX, 2 הטוב והמטיב who is good and beneficent. Taan. 31 a תקנו … הטוב והמ' they introduced in Jabneh the benediction ‘who is good &c.’ (in the grace after meal).—Kidd. I, 10 מטיבין לו good will be done to him; a. fr.— Part. Hof. מוּטָב, q. v.

sense.definition: to improve a field, to till oftener than usual.
sense.notes: Y. Shebi. IV, 35 b top טִיְּיבָהּ וכ' if, after he improved a field, he died &c.
Shebi. IV, 2; Tosef. ib. III, 10; a. e.—Denom. טִיּיוּב.

sense.definition: Pa. טַיֵּיב, Af. אָטֵיב to do good, to favor.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. I Ex. XXIII, 2 למְטַיְּיבָא; Y. II למֵיטְבָא. V. יְטַב.

Ber. 5 a (ref. to Ps. XXXIX, 3) אין ט' אלא וכ' under good the Torah is meant. Ib. 60 b זו מדה ט' this refers to a good dispensation; a. v. fr.—יום טוב (abbr. י"ט) festival. Bets. I, 1; a. fr.—כי טוב (ref. to Gen. I, 4) day-time. Pes. 2 a.—Ber. V, 3 (33 b) על טוב וכ' thy name be praised for the good (thou doest).—זכור לַטּוֹב, v. עין טובה—.זָכַר, v. עַיִן.— Pl. טוֹבְים, f. טוֹבוֹת. Ber. l. c. (34 a, omitt. in Mish.) האומר יברכוך ט' he who says in prayer, The good praise thee. Ib. IX, 2 בשורות ט', v. בְּשוֹרָה; a. v. fr.—V. טוֹבָה.
— Pl. טוֹבִים. Tosef. Shek. II, 16 בני ט' of noble descent; a. fr.—טוֹבֵי העיר representatives of the town. Meg. 27 a
Ber. 44 a לשבוע מטוּבָהּ to be satisfied out of its (the land’s) riches; a. e.

Targ. Is. I, 19. Targ. Ps. XXXIII, 22; a. fr.—2) (mostly in pl. constr. טוּבֵי) happines, used like אַשְׁרֵי, happy!, blessed! Targ. I Kings X, 8. Targ. II Kings V, 3 (h. text אחלי). With personal suffix טוּבוֹהִי, טוּבוֹי, טוּבֵיה. Targ. Prov. XXVIII, 14. Targ. Ps. I, 1; a. fr.—Snh. 7 a v. דּוּשׁ ch.—Y. Yoma IV, 41 d top טיבוי … טובוי, v. לְוָיְיתָא; a. fr.—3) much; many; very. Snh. 41 b ט' אמריתו בה you said much (had many reasons to offer). Ber. 30 b מרירת ליבא ט' very bitter at heart.—Ib. 18 b אבא ט' many by the name of Abba. Ib. 52 b ט' נהורי many lights (colors); a. fr.— Pl. fem. טוּבָן more. Y. Peah I, 15 c; Y. Kidd. I, 61 b top פריטין ט' a higher price.

Y. Shek. I, beg. 45 d לט' כל נדיב לב for a good purpose—every liberal-hearted &c. Sot. 47 b ופסקה ט' and blessing (plenty) has departed. Yeb. 47 a, sq. אינם … לא רוב ט' וכ' they cannot stand either too much prosperity or &c.; a. fr.— Pl. טוֹבוֹת. Kidd. 40 b ט' הרבה the effect of many good deeds; a. fr.

Sot. 47 b משרבו מקבלני טוֹבָתְךָ ומחזקני טוֹבוֹתֶיךָ (read: ומחזיקני) when those became numerous who say, ‘I accept thy favor’ and ‘I shall appreciate thy favors’ (in official life); Tosef. ib. XIV, 7 טוֹבֹתֶיךָ ומחזיקני טוֹבָתְךָ …; a. fr.—בַּטּ' as a favor, i.e. expected to be reciprocated, שלא בט' not expected &c. Shebi. IV, 1; 2; a. e.—טוֹבַת הֲנָאָה the benefit of a pleasure, i.e. the satisfaction which one feels in obliging somebody. Pes. 46 b, a. e. ט' ה' ממון the benefit of putting a person under obligation is equal to a consideration in money; a. fr.—4) inclination, good will. Gen. R. s. 86 בעל כרחה שלא בטוֹבָתָהּ by force, against her will; Tanh. Vayesh. 4. Y. Ab. Zar. I, 40 a bot הביט בה שלא בטובתו he looked at her involuntarily; a. fr.—טוֹבַת עַיִן (v. עַיִן) liberality. Ned. 38 a נהג בה ט' ע' וכ' was liberal with the Law (that had been given to him), and he gave it to Israel.

sense.definition: (v. next w.) pr. n. m. Tobi.
sense.notes: M. Kat. 16 a רב ט' בר מתנה.

sense.definition: (b. h.) pr. n. m. Tobijah, Tobias.
sense.notes: Kidd. 70 b בטי בר ט', a slave. Keth. 85 b שני ט' two by the name of T.—Pes. 113 b, a. e., v. זִיגָּד.—Lev. R. s. 1, beg.; Sot. 12 a (one of the names of Moses).
, v. טוֹבַנְיָא
Gitt. 26 b; Keth. 40 a; Kerith. 13 b ט' דחכימי happiest of all scholars.
, Bets. 13 a, read: טִבְלָא.
— Pl. טוֹבְלָנִים, constr. טוֹבְלָנֵי. Tosef. Yad. I, 20 Var., v. טָבל I.
Tosef. Shebi. VII, 14 Pes. 53 a; Erub. 28 b טובי'.
, v. טֶבֵע 2.
Targ. Y. Gen. VI, 17; a. fr. (O. טוֹפָנָ א).
Taan. 10 a ט' ולא יובשני better flooded land than rainless land.
= טִבְעוֹנִי.
Targ. Y. I Deut. XXXII, 50. [Targ. Jud. V, 26 some ed., read טַבְתָא.]

Sifré Deut. 234 פרט ליגא; Yalk. Deut. 933 ליגא; Treat. Tsitsith (ed. Kirchheim p. 22) הטריגון (corr. acc.).— Pl. טוֹגִיּוֹת. Sifré l. c. quot. in Ar., s. v. טג: טגיות אינן וֹכ' (read: טוג') togae are exempt from tsitsith
, v. טֹהַר
, v. טוי
, v. טַפְזָא (a. next w.)

sense.definition: (= טַב זִיג, v. זוֹגָא) merry company, picnic of young men.
sense.notes: Ab. Zar. 14 a בט' (Ms. M. בטווזא) ‘the son’s feast’ of which R. Judah speaks (Tosef. ib. I, 2

sense.definition: means a picnic (not a wedding). [Perles Et. St. p. 11 refers to Pers. ṭ ûz ͗ i.
sense.notes: ṭ uœi, Arab. תוזיע̇.]

sense.definition: (טוּחַ II) pressing the bow, shot, shooting distance.
sense.notes: — Pl. טְוָוחִים, טְיָחִ'. Gen. R. s. 53 (ref. to כמטחוי, Gen. XXI, 16) שני ט' בקשת מיל (‘Rashi’ a. l. טִיחוֹת) two shooting distances with the bow are a mile (מִיל); Yalk. Gen. 94.
, part. pass. of טָוָה.
, v. sub טוי'.

sense.definition: (טוּס; cmp. ταώς, Pers. tavus, v. Lydd.
sense.notes: Gr. Dict. s. v.) peacock. Gen. R. s. 7, end. Tosef. Kil. I, 8 תרנגול ט' וכ' Var. (ed. Zuck. טוות, corr. acc.) the cock, the peacock and the pheasant, although resembling each other, &c.; Y. ib. I, 27 a bot.; B. Kam. 55 a (Ms. H. טָאוָס); Y. ib. V, end, 5 a טַוֶּוסֶת(?).— Pl. טַוָּוסִים, טַוָּוסִין. Pesik. R. addit. s. 1 (ed. Fr. p. 193 b). Yalk. Esth. 104 b ט' של שן peacocks made of ivory.
Targ. II Esth. I, 2.—Y. Ab. Zar. III, 42 d top (expl. Adrammelech and Anammelech, II Kings XVII, 3

Sabb. 130 a רישא דט' וכ' Ms. M. (Ms. O. טָאוָסָא, ed. incorr. טוותא) the head of a peacock cooked in milk.— Pl. טַוָּוסִין, טַוְוסִין, טַוְסִ'. Targ. Ez. XXVII, 15 (h. text הובנים). Targ. I Kings X, 22 (h. text תכיים).
, v. טְיָפָא
, v. טיְּרָא
Targ. Y. Num. XXXIV, 7, sq. (O. הר טורא).—Targ. Y. ib. XX, 22; 25; Targ. Y. I Deut. XXXII, 50 (!) (Y. II a. O. הור טורא).

sense.definition: (stem טה, טו, cmp. טהר; cmp. Arab.
sense.notes: ṭ avi) [ clearness, emptiness,] (adv.) with an empty stomach, without meal, fasting. Dan. VI, 19.—Pes. 107 a, v. בִּית—Ber. 55 a כל חלום בלא ט' Ms. M. (ed. ולא) no dream is to be feared in which fasting plays no part; [Ar.: every dream has some reality, except that which one dreams while fasting].
, v. טַוָּוס, טַוָּוסָא.

sense.definition: to cover with a cohesive substance, to plaster.
sense.notes: Part. טָח. M. Kat. 7 a ואינו טָח בטיט but puts no clay on. Cant. R. to VIII, 6 טָחֵי גגות roof-plasterers. Neg. XIII, 1 וטח and plasters the spot over; a. fr.— Part. pass. טוּחַ coated, covered with viscid or glittering matter.—Midd. IV, 1 ט' בזהב coated with gold; (Num. R. s. 12 נִטּוֹחַ).—Nidd. 24 a בפניו טוּחוֹת (Rashi טָחוֹת) when the face of the embryo is covered over (no features distinguishable).

sense.definition: to be pasted on, to stick.
sense.notes: Y. Kil. VI, 30 c top והיא נִיטּוֹחָה and it (the fig) stuck (against the wall); Y. Sabb. XI, 13 a bot. והיה נ' (corr. acc.). Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. II, 17 לִיטּוֹחַ some ed. (ed. Zuck. ליטול, corr. acc.), v. infra.

Ḥull. 25 a … עתיד (לַהֲטִיחוֹ) להָטִיחַ וכ' (Tosef. Kel. l. c. ליטוח, v. supra) which wants polishing, v. אֲטוּנָס. Bets. 9 a להָטִיחַ גגו וכ' he needs the ladder for plastering his roof. [Tosef. Kel. B. Kam. IV, 19, sq. [read:] אם יכול הטיח, v. טִיחַ.]

sense.definition: to cast mud, trnsf. (with or without דברים) to speak rebelliously, to reproach (with נגד or כלפי).
sense.notes: Taan. 25 a; Meg. 22 b, a. e. לעולם אל יָטִיחַ וכ' one must, in his prayer, never reproach the Lord. Ber. 31 b, sq.—Gen. R. s. 53 (ref. to כמטחוי, Gen. XXI, 16) כמֵטַחַת וכ' as if thrusting reproaches against the Lord; Tanḥ. Vayetse 5. Ex. R. s. 3. B. Bath. 134 a ה' עלי וכ' Ben U. insulted me.
Pes. 30 a, v. טִיחְיָא.
Zeb. 95 b אַטְחוּ (Ms. R. 2 דטחו), v. טִיחְיָא.
Targ. Y. Gen. XV, 6.

Ḥull. 109 b טָחוֹ בכותל presses it against the wall (to make the milk flow out).— Part. pass. טוּחַ squeezed in. Num. R. s. 10 (ref. to Job XXXVIII, 36) אלו הכליות שהן טוּחוֹת וכ' that means the kidneys which are wedged into the body.

Ber. 34 b אלמלי ה' וכ' (Ms. M. הניח, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) if Ben. Z. (myself) had squeezed his head between his (the son’s) knees (praying for his recovery). Gen. R. s. 20 התחיל מֵטִיחַ וכ' he knocked his head against the wall; Yalk. ib. 30 להָטִיחַ. Ohol. XVII, 2 ה' בסלע struck (with the plough) against a rock. B. Kam. 28 b ה' צלוחיתו וכ' he struck (with) his bottle against the stone; Y. ib. III, 3 c top, v. הֲטָחָה.—Tanḥ. P’kudé 11 כיון שהֵטִיחוּ פניהם וכ' when they had squeezed their faces from all sides (had in vain tried in all directions).

sense.definition: to press the bow-string, to shoot; (euphem.) to emit semen virile.
sense.notes: Yeb. 54 a. Snh. 46 a ה' באשתו Ms. M. (ed. את אשתו).
— Pl. טוֹחֲנִים. Tanḥ. Mishp. 19 כגון חמורים של ט' like the mask over the faces of the millers’ asses.
M. Kat. 16 a ט' אסר וכ' a blow binds (proclaiming excommunication), and a blow unbinds.

sense.definition: (= טלטל'; טְלַל) branches of the vine, arbor.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Lev. XIX, 10; Targ. Y. II Deut. XXIV, 21 טוֹטְלָוַותְ'.
, v. טוֹטֶפְתָּא
, v. טֹטַפְרָ'

sense.definition: [ something glistening,] beads used as charms, ornament worn on the forehead, frontlet.
sense.notes: Sabb. VI, 1, expl. ib. 57 b, v. חוּמַרְתָּא a. אֲפוּזְיָינֵי; Y. ib. VI, 7 d דבר שהוא נותן במקום הט' (read נָתוּן) something which is put on by women in the place of the totafoth (by men, v. infra).— Pl. טוֹטָפוֹת. Tosef. ib. IV (V), 6.—Esp. pl. טוֹטָפוֹת phylacteries, (corresp. to אות, Deut. VI, 8, a. e.) slips of parchment containing inscriptions and put in the casings of the T’fillin (v. תְּפִלִּין). Mekh. Bo. s. 17 מה בראש ארבע ט' אף ביד ארבע ט' as the T’fillin on the head contain four inscriptions, so those on the hand. Snh. XI, 3 (88 b); a. e.

Targ. II Sam. I, 10 ט' דעל ידא bracelet (h. text אצעדה).— Pl. טוֹטְפָתָא, טוֹטְפָן phylacteries, v. preced. Targ. Esth. VIII, 15 (cmp. Men. 35 b). Targ. Ez. XXIV, 17; 23 (h. text פאר, cmp. M. Kat. 15 a; Keth. 6 b).
, v. טִיטְרַפְלִיּוֹת

sense.definition: (b. h.) [ to go to and back, cmp. זוּל, אֲזַל,] to spin.
sense.notes: Keth. VII, 6 טוֹוָה בשוק she spins in the street. Ib. 72 b, v. וֶרֶד II.—Tosef. Toh. IV, 11; Zeb. 79 b פשתן שטְוָואֲתוֹ וכ' linen which a menstruant spun.— Part. pass. טָווּי. Kil. IX, 8 ט' או ארוג spun or woven, v. שַׁעַטְנֵז. Sabb. 79 a; a. e.—V. טֳוִי.
Denom. מַטְוִויאֲתָא.

sense.definition: (v. preced. wds.) [ to turn,] to roast.
sense.notes: Targ. Is. XLIV, 16 (ed. Wil. טְוָה); a. fr.—Part. pass. טָוֵי, constr. טְוֵי. Targ. Ex. XII, 8, sq.—Gitt. 69 b נִיטַוְויֵיה וכ' let him roast it in a smithy; a. fr.
same. Bets. 4 a מהו לאַטְוִוינְהוּ וכ' is it permitted to roast them to-day &c.
Pes. 76 b דאִיטְּוָוא וכ' which was roasted together with meat. B. Kam. 19 b דמִטְּוֵוי (Ar. בטָוִוי) it means that it was roasted. Ber. 44 b משיתא מִטְּוָויָתָא than six (eggs) roasted.
Meg. 26 b; Snh. 48 a, v. אָרִיג. Tosef. B. Kam. X, 2 טאוי (read טְוָאי, Var. טְוָוי).
B. Kam. 19 a Ar. (v. טְוִי II).—Sabb. 109 a שריקא ט' a roast glaired, Rashi (differ. in Tosaf.) Y. Ter. X, 47 b top טַוְויָה.
Lev. R. s. 25 (expl. בטחות, Job XXXVIII, 36) בט' (Ar. בטיטויא; cmp. LXX Job. l. c.); v., however, בִּטְוַיָּא.
Sabb. 74 b. Ib. 79 a; a. fr.
, v. טַוְיָא
, v. טיוסין
, imperat. of נָטַל, נְטַל.
טִיֵּיל

sense.definition: to walk about, to be at leisure, to enjoy one’s self.
sense.notes: Snh. 102 a נְטַיֵּיל בג"ע we shall walk about in paradise. Succ. 28 b ומְטַיֵּיל בסוכה and enjoys himself &c. Tosef. Sabb. XVI (XVII), 18; Tosef. Bets. II, 10, v. טְרִיקְלִין. Tanḥ. Ki Thissa 3; a. fr.
Ib. טִיַּילְתַּנִי עמך thou madest me walk by thy side.
Targ. Jer. L, 11 (h. text צהל; cmp. Targ. ib. VIII, 16).
Targ. Y. Gen. XXIV, 61. Targ. Y. Num. XXII, 20. Targ. Ps. LXVIII, 8 טַיַּילְתָּא (ed. Wil. טְיַלְ'; h. text צעד); a. fr.

sense.definition: as preced. Pi.—Targ. Y. Gen. III, 8 (h. text מתהלך).
sense.notes: —Y. Ber. III, 6 a, a. fr. הוו מְטַיְּילִין וכ' were walking about &c. B. Bath. 91 b כד הוו מְטַיְּילָן וכ' when boys and girls used to play &c. Succ. 53 a הוה מט' קמיה וכ' (Ar. מטלל) was sporting before &c., v. טְלַל; a. fr.
Targ. Y. Deut. XXIV, 1; 3 (ed. pr. ישיל, corr. acc.).
Targ. Ps. LXXVIII, 52 Ms. (ed. אַטֵּיל).

Targ. Jud. IX, 36; a. fr.—Yoma 74 b תוב בט' sit in the shade.—Gitt. 17 a או בטוּלָּךְ וכ' either let us live in thy shadow (protection) or in the shadow of the son of Esau (Rome). Snh. 18 b בט' תאינה in the shade of a fig-tree; Y. R. Hash. II, 58 b top בטֻל תינתא; Y. Snh. I, 18 c bot. בטיל הינתא (corr. acc.); a. fr.— Pl. טוּלַּיָּא, טוּלֵּי. Targ. Jer. VI, 4; a. e.—Targ. Is. IX, 1 בארע טולי מותא ed. Lag (oth. ed. טוּלֵימוֹתָא in one word, h. text צלמית).—Pes. 111 b חמשה ט' וכ' there are five shades (where demons dwell); a. e.—V. טְלָלָא.

sense.definition: (cmp. טְלָאי) rag tied around the finger.
sense.notes: Meïl. 18 a עומד לט' Ar. (ed. לנוולה; v. R. S. to Kel. XXVII, 4) fit for tying &c.
, v. טוּלָּא

(טְלַם) טוּלְמת [ panis aqueus ac mollis, P. Sm. 1477] cake, loaf. Targ. Job. XXXI, 17 ט' דלחמי Ms. (ed. only טולמי); a. e.—Targ. Esth. III, 2 ט' דלחם ed. Lag.; Yalk. ib. 105 b ט' דנהמא.—[Y. Snh. II, 20 c bot. מנהם טלמא, v. טַלְמָיָא.]— Pl. טוּלְמִין, טוּלְמֵי. Targ. I Kings XIV, 3; a. e.—Meg. 15 b בטולמי דנהמא Ms. M. 2 (ed. only בטַלְמֵי) for loaves of bread. [Ar. s. v. זיף quotes, in Hebr. diction, (play on Josh. XV, 24) כל המוזיף טולמיין וכ' ed. Koh. (oth. ed. טולמין, טולמון) he who lends bread to the poor, will be raised.]
, v. next w.

Gen. R. s. 41, beg.; s. 52 (ref. to Gen. XII, 17) [read:] על דו ט' למקרב למסנא וכ' because he dared to come near the shoe of that matron; Y. Keth. VII, end, 31 d על דטלמסן למגע בסמה (corr. acc.); Yalk. Gen. 69.
, Yalk. Josh. 31, read פּוֹלָר.
— Pl. טוּלְשֵׁי. Ber. 40 b (expl. עוזרדין of Dem. I, 1).
B. Kam. 51 b טָם טפח if one filled up again one hand-breadth (of the depth of the pit).
Targ. II Kings III, 19, v. טְמַם.—B. Kam. 50 a עד דטָאִים ליה (Ms. M. אָטֵים Af., v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) until he fills it up.
Erub. 79 a למִיטַּיְּימֵיה קאי the intention is that it be filled up (with the pebbles).

sense.definition: uncleanness, esp. levitical uncleanness, v. טַהֲרָה.
sense.notes: Pes. 19 a טוּמְאַת ידים uncleanness of hands by touch. Eduy. II, 1, v. אָב. M. Kat. 5 a ט' קוראה וכ' the uncleanness (the unclean spot being marked) calls unto him warning &c.; a. v. fr.— Pl. טוּמְאוֹת Kel. I, 1; a. v. fr.
Targ. Ez. XXII, 10.— Pl. טוּמְאָתָא. Targ. Is. XXX, 22.
Tosef. B. Kam. IX, 31 בט' של וכ' with a roll of papers in his hand; Y. ib. VIII, beg. 6 b; Sifra Emor Par. 14, ch. XX טימסמירות, טימיסמ' (read: ט' של ניירות or שטרות); Yalk. Lev. 658; a. e.

Y. Hor. III, 48 a bot. ראש טי' at the head of the list; Lev. R. s. 5 בראש ט' Ar. (ed. only בראש). Gen. R. s. 25 beg. בתוך טִימוֹסָן וכ' in the record of the righteous; Yalk. ib. 42; Yalk. Chr. 1072 טִימוֹסִין pl.— Pl. טוֹמוֹסִין, טוֹמוֹסוֹת, טִי'. Pesik. Zakh. p. 27 a [read:] ונטל ט' וכ' (or טִימוֹסָן) he took the lists of the tribes &c.; Tanḥ. Ki Thetse 9. Y. Snh. X, 28 a top אף שמותיהם … טֹמְסוֹתֵיהֶם even their names disappeared from their books of records. Ex. R. s. 15 הוציא הנמוסין וכ' (corr. acc.; Tanḥ. Vaëra 5 דִּפְתְּרָא) he brought out the lists of the deities.
Lam. R. to II, 2 היה טימס … בעגלה their census had to be carried to Jerusalem on a wagon; [Y. Taan. IV, 69 a bot. קטמו' read הטומוס or קִינְסוֹס].

sense.definition: (redupl. of טָמַם) a person whose genitals are hidden, or undevelopped; one whose sex is unknown.
sense.notes: B. Bath. 126 b ט' שנקרע וכ' a tumtum who was operated upon and was found to be a male. Bicc. IV, 5 (Talm. ed.); a. e.—[Midr. Till. to Ps. I; Yalk. Prov. 953 ט' הוא העולם, v. אַבְטוֹמְטוֹס.]— Pl. טוּמְטוּמִין. Yeb. 64 a bot. (not טומטמין).

sense.definition: (טוּם; cmp. סָתַם, סָתַר) secret, hidden place.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. II Deut. XXVII, 15 (later ed. טוּמְרַיָּא).
, v. טוּרְמִיּוֹת
, v. טַמְיָקוֹן
. Targ. Job. XL, 13.
— Pl. טוּמְעַיָּא. Ib. III, 20.
Targ. Y. Deut. XIII, 9. Targ. Y. I, ib. XXVII, 15; a. fr.— Pl. טוּמְרַיָּא. Targ. Ps. X, 8; a. e.; v. טוּמַיָּא.
, v. טָנַן

Targ. Y. Gen. XLIV, 1, sq. (h. text אמתחת). Targ. Y. Ex. XXIII, 5; a. e.—Ber. 61 a דלא דרי ט' Ms. M. (ed. טידי) when he is not carrying a load. Sabb. 92 a דכל ט' דמידלי וכ' every load which is lifted on poles &c.; a. fr.
Zeb. 32 b מטוּנָךְ I borrow thine own argument; R. Hash. 4 a; Ḥull. 132 a top (Rashi derives fr. מְטֵי: ‘we have reached thee’).— Pl. טוּנִין. Targ. Y. Gen. XLIII, 23.
Ber. 56 b (v. vers. in Rabb. D. S. a. l. Ms. M. a. note).
, Y. Ber. IX, 14 b bot. ט' רופוס, v. טוּרְנוֹס
Sifré Deut. 320, v. בַּרְבַּרְיָא.—*Targ. Y. Ex. II, 3 תיבותא דט' (prob. meaning טָנֵיס; some ed. נַס …) a Tunesian box (h. text גמא).
Denom. טַוָּוס.

—Y. Taan. IV, 69 b לא נראה עיף טָס וכ' no bird has been seen flying in all Palestine; Lam. R. introd. end.—Deut. R. s. 6 קושט … וטס כעוף goes straight like an arrow, and swift like a bird. Midr. Till. to Ps. XC, 10 גזין חשין וטָסִין they pass, hasten and fly; a. fr.
same. Koh. R. to IX, 7 ט' וחזר וט' he flew to and back.

sense.definition: to cause to fly, to bring on by flight.
sense.notes: Ruth R. to IV, 1 הטִיסוֹ וכ' the Lord would have made him fly and brought him (to the place). Gen. R. s. 59, end. Cant. R. to I, 9 הֵטִיסָן; Ex. R. s. 23 end הסיטן (corr. acc.).—Lev. R. s. 16 הסיט', (read as) Yalk. Kings 232. Lev. R. s. 11, beg. הסיטן (corr. acc.) he winged them; a. fr.

Targ. Job V, 7 (Ms. טוּשׂ); a. fr.—Part. טָיֵיס, טָיֵס, טָאֵיס, טָאֵס. Ib. XXXIX, 18.—Targ. II Esth. I, 2 שונרין טייסין (read: נשרין).—Targ. Is. XVIII, 1 (ed. Lag. דטאס]; a. fr.—Y. Yeb. XVI, 15 c bot. נפשא טָיְיסָא וכ' the soul hovers over the body; Y. M. Kat. III, 82 b bot.; Lev. R. s. 18; (Gen. R. s. 100 תייבא).

sense.definition: same. Targ. II Esth. l. c. same.
sense.notes: Targ. II Esth. l. c. טַיְיסִית I flew.
Targ. Y. Deut. XXVIII, 49. [Ib. טַיֵּיס נישרא, read: טָיֵיס, v. supra.]
, v. sub טַוו'.
Targ. Prov. I, 32 (ed. Lag. טועיי, Var. טועי).
Sifra introd., v. טָעַן I.
Targ. O. Ex. XXIII, 5; a. fr.; v. טוּנָא I.—V. טְעוֹנָא.

sense.definition: [ to shine,] to come to the surface, float, bubble up.
sense.notes: Part. טָאֵיף, טָיֵיף. Targ. Y. Deut. XXI, 1. Targ. Y. Gen. XXVIII, 10; a. e.—Koh. R. to V, 8 (mixed diction) וטָפַת בארה של וכ' Miriam’s well came up.—Ab. II, 6; Succ. 53 a, v. infra.—Y. Shebi. IX, 38 d; Pesik. B’shall. p. 89 b הוה טָיֵיף the corpse came up to the surface. Gen. R. s. 81 (in Hebr. dict.) וטָפַת רוחי וכ' and my mind in me was swimming (I became proud, v. טָפַח); a. fr.

sense.definition: (denom. of טיף) to drip; to be inundated.
sense.notes: Targ. O. Gen. XLIX, 12; a. e.—Keth. 111 b חלבא טייף וכ' milk was dripping &c. Y. Taan. III, end, 67 a הוה עלמא ט' the world would have been flooded. Gen. R. s. 32; Yalk. ib. 57 דלא טף וכ' it (the mount Gerizim) was not flooded by the waters of the flood; a. e.—[Targ. Y. Deut. XXI, 23 תטופון, v. טְנַף a. נְטַף.]

sense.definition: to direct the overflow, to assign channels.
sense.notes: Targ. Job XXXVIII, 24, v. טְיָפָא.—Gitt. 69 b top ונִיטַּיְיפֵיה וכ' and let it (the milk) run over &c.

sense.definition: to cause to glisten, to turn in all directions.
sense.notes: Keth. 60 b מְטַיְּפֵי עינא Ar. (ed. מציצי, v. infra) with restless eyes.

sense.definition: to cause to float, v. infra.

sense.notes: Targ. Deut. XI, 4.—[Keth. l. c. מְטִיפֵי עינא Ar. s. v. טף I ‘with dripping eyes’, v. supra.]

Ab. II, 6 על דאֲטֵפְתְּ אֲטִיפוּךְ וסוף מְטִיפָיךְ יְטוּפוּן ed. Strack (oth. eds. אַטְפוּךְ; Strack reads מְטַיְפָיךְ Pa.; oth. pointed eds. מְטיְּפָיִךְ h. form) because thou (the person whose skull was seen to float) hast caused (a corpse) to float, they made thee float, and those who made thee float, shall also float.

sense.definition: to be glittering, to be turned in all directions.
sense.notes: B. Kam. 92 b; Meg. 14 b ועיניה מִטַּיְּיפֵי and its eyes look all around (for food).
, Koh. R. to V, 10 לית ט' דהדא. read: סוֹפָא.
, v. טָפוּס a. טוֹפֵס.

Peah V, 3 אין מגלגלין בט' (Y. ed. טוֹפֵיחַ) one must not irrigate (a field) with an irrigator (before the poor have collected their share; v. Tosef. ib. II, 20); Y. ib. V, 19 a top. [Maim. identifying our w. with next w. explains: you must not sow the tofa ḥ in conjunction with other seeds.]

sense.definition: (v. preced.) an aquatic plant like the Colocasia; bean, tofa ḥ ; [Maim.
sense.notes: קרטמאן Arab., defining it ‘a seed similar to barley.’] Kil. I, 1. T’bul Yom I, 2; Tosef. ib. I, 1, sq. טפיח (R. S. to T’bul Yom l. c. quotes טופח). Tosef. Makhsh. III, 6 טוֹפֵיחַ. Tosef. T’rum. VI, 11 טפיח ed. Zuck. (Var. טופח, טופיח). Peah VI, 7 אפי' היא של ט' even if the barley in the field have the size of tofa ḥ (R. S.; Maim.: “even if it be a field of the inferior kind of barley named t.”).—V. טְפִיחַ II.
, v. preced. wds.
B. Mets. 63 b ואשכח ביה ט' (Var. טפייתא, טפיתא, טפיאתא, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 9) and he (the borrower) finds in the bundle more money than the loan agreed upon. V. טִיפוּנָא a. טְפִיתָא.
, Pesik. R. s. 21, read: סוֹפִיסְטֵיס.
, Targ. Job XXVIII, 7 ed. Lag., v. טַרְפִיתָא
, v. טַפְלָא
Targ. O. Gen. VI, 17 (Y. טוֹבְעָנָא); a. fr.

sense.definition: (v. טָפַס; cmp. דָּפוּס, טָפוּס) frame; trnsf. (influenced by Greek τύπος) formula (to be filled out according to occasion).
sense.notes: Y. Ber. I, 3 d ט' ברכות וכ' such is the formula of the benedictions; Lev. R. s. 34, end; Y. Sabb. XV, end, 15 b טופוס.—Esp. the formula or blank of documents, opp. תורף containing names, dates &c. Y. Gitt. III, beg. 44 c כתב תרפו בט' (also בתוֹפֵס) if the writer filled out a blank. B. Mets. 7 b; a. fr.— Pl. טוֹפְסִין, constr. טוֹפְסֵי. Y. Gitt. II, beg. 44 a פוסל בט' declares illegal deeds of divorce written into ready-made blanks. Gitt. III, 2 הכותב ט' גיטין וכ' he who writes formulas of letters of divorce must leave blanks for the name &c.; a. fr.

sense.definition: , ch. same, = h. טָפוּס, דָּפוּס, frame, mould, cast.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Num. XXV, 1 (cmp. Sabb. 64 a s. v. דָּפוּס). Targ. Y. Ex. XXXII, 4 בטֻפְסָא Ar. a Levita (ed. בטופרא, corr. acc.) in a mould.—[B. Bath. 103 b טופסא Ar., v. טַפְתָּא.]

sense.definition: nail of the human finger; claw; hoof; trnsf. pencil.
sense.notes: Targ. Jer. XVII, 1.—Ḥull. 17 b the knife must be examined, אבישרא ואט' וכ' on the fleshy top of the finger and on the nail &c.; a. fr.— Pl. טוּפְרִין, טִפְ', טוּפְרַיָּיא. Targ. Jud. V, 22 (h. text עקבות) Targ. O. Deut. XXI, 12 טוֹפְרָהָא ed. Berl. (ed. Vien. טוּפְרָנָהָא; Y. טוּפְרַיָּיהָא).—M. Kat. 18 a חזנהו לטופריה וכ' (not לטופרי) saw that his nails were long; a. e.—Midr. Sam. ch. XI, v. אִסְטְלִי.
Targ. O. Ex. XXX, 34.—[Targ. Y. Gen. III, 7 לבוש טופרא, read: שׂוּפְרָא.—Lev. R. s. 33 טופרין ושער ועצמות, read: טפוסין של צלמים, v. Yalk. Dan. 1061.—Targ. Y. Ex. XXXII, 4, v. טוּפְסָא.]—V. next w.
noun (preced.) nails. Targ. O. Deut. XXI, 2.—[Y. Snh. I, 18 c bot. טופרני, read: טוּפְרוֹי; Y. R. Hash. II, 58 b top טפרוי; v. דְּקָקָה.]

sense.definition: Valley of Beth-Tofeth Koh. R. to V, 8; v., however, נְטוֹפָה II.

, Y. Sabb. VI, 7 d bot. פרוש טוק טקלין ed., Ar.
פרסטקולין, פרוסטוקטולין, prob. a corruption of כְּרוּסוֹקַסְטְלוֹן (χρυσοκαστέλλιον) a golden castle, name of a head-dress (עיר הזהב; v. Sm. Ant. s. v. Corona).

sense.notes: טַיֵּיר (cmp. תּוּר) to espy, to augur. Targ. Y. Gen. XLIV, 8; 15 (h. text נחש).
Ib. XXX, 27.

sense.definition: (preced., cmp. b. h. צוּר) mount, mountain.
sense.notes: Targ. O. Ex. III, 12 (Y. טוורא). Targ. Y. Gen. XXIII, 2; a. fr.—Ḥull. 7 b, v. גְּבַהּ. Sabb. 152 a ט'תלג a mountain of snow (my head is white). Gen. R. s. 32, v. בְּרַךְ; a. fr.— Pl. טוּרִין, טוּרַיָּא, טוּרֵי, טַוְו'. Targ. Job. IX, 5. Targ. Deut. XI, 11; a. fr.—Gen. R. l. c. אי מט' רמיא if it belongs among the high mountains; a. e.—[Sabb. 98 b כי טירין, v. טָרִיז.]—טור מלכא (h. הר המלך) King’s Mountain, ט' שמעון Mount Simeon. Gitt. 55 b. Y. Taan. IV, 69 a; Lam. R. to II, 2 (v. Neub. Géogr. p. 41; p. 267).—ט' פרזלא Iron Mount. Targ. Y. Num. XXXIV, 3.—For other compounds, v. respective determinants.
Gen. R. s. 99 (ref. to המסדרונה, Jud. III, 23) [read:] ערפלי ט' וכ' the clouds of brightness, where the angels are seated in order.

sense.definition: tura, name of a bitter herb.
sense.notes: Pes. 39 a (Ms. M. סורא).

sense.definition: (tribulum, τρίβολος) only in מִטָּה של ט' threshing sledge (couch) consisting of a wooden platform studded underneath with sharp pieces of flint or with iron teeth.
sense.notes: Ab. Zar. 24 b (Ar. a. Yalk. Sam. 122 טרבן); Zeb. 116 b; Men. 22 a Ms. M. (ed. טרבל), v. דַּיְשָׁאָה. Par. XII, 9 טַרְבֵּל.
, v. טְרָיָינוֹס

Pirke d’R. El. ch. XLI כטנדס שהיא פרוסה Ar. (ed. only כטנדס, corr. acc., and add בתיך האהל; v. Mekh. Yithro, Baḥod. s. 4 כאדם שהוא מציע את הכר על ראש המטה) like a couch which is spread in a tent. [Ar. refers טנדס to the late Latin tenta, Gr. τέντα (τένδα), Italian tenda.]

sense.definition: (טרז = טרד II; cmp. טְרוּזָא) [ locked up things, cmp. אוֹצָר,] royal wardrobe, armory.
sense.notes: Ber. 56 a ריש ט' וכ' (some ed. טורזינא, Ar. טרזיא) the chief of the royal wardrobe dreamt. Ib. אתיוה לריש ט' וכ' (Ms. M. אמר קיסר אייתיה לריש טריא) they brought the chief … up, and he was put do death. [For Var. lect., v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. notes 1, 2.]

Ber. 56 a אפתחא דריש ט' (Ar. טרזיא, v. preced.) at the entrance of the chief treasury; [prob. to be read: דבי ט', דריש having come in by tautography from the suceeding ריש טורזיא.]—B. Bath. 8 a לשורא … ולטר' וכ' (Ms. F. טורדינא, Alf. Ms. טורדיתא) for the maintenance of the town-wall, the horse-guard and the armory even orphans must contribute.

sense.definition: (sub. ריש) superintendent of the armory or treasury.
sense.notes: Erub. 80 a ההוא ט' וכ' (ed. Sonc. טורזיינא) there was a (gentile) superintendent that lived in the neighborhood &c.

Sabb. 153 a כלום … בלא ט' is there a banquet without visible preparation?; (Koh. R. to IX, 8 הֶטְרֵחַ). M. Kat. 8 b מפני הט' on account of the labor (connected with preparing the wedding). Y. Pes. X, 37 d top מה הט' … מטריחים וכ' what is all that trouble for to which you put us &c.?; a. fr.— Pl. טָרְחוֹת. Ber. 58 a כמה ט' טרח וכ' to how much trouble did the host go &c.; (Y. ib. IX, 13 c כמה טורח). Lev. R. s. 1 משה עסוק בט' וכ' Moses (like an agoranomos) was engaged in the (dietary) affairs of Israel. Gen. R. s. 94 ט' נפש אחת the troubles of providing for one soul.—V. טַרְחוּת a. טִרְחָא.
Targ. O. Deut. I, 12. Targ. Koh. II, 21; a. fr.—Ib. 11 טוּרְחָתִי.—B. Mets. 40 b טָרְחֵיה, v. בַּרְזָנִיתָא.—V. טִרְחָא.
, v. sub טַרְח'.
Targ. Y. I Num. XI, 12.
f., v. טוּרְחָא

origin, cmp. טְרָא) balance, steel-yard. Sifra K’dosh. Par. 3, ch. VIII במשקל זו טרי' ‘in weight’ (Lev. XIX, 35) that means the trutina. Sabb. 81 a וכי ט' יכניס shall a (gold) balance be brought in (to weigh accurately)?; Men. 87 b. B. Kam. 119 a. B. Bath. 89 a ט' (for weighing gold), contrad. to מאזנים. Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. II, 5.—Y. Shek. VI, end, 50 b כמין ט' arranged like a steel-yard. Sot. 34 a (ref. to מוֹט, Num. XIII, 23) ט' וט' דט' a combination of balancing poles (for four couples of carriers); Y. ib. VII, 21 d bot. טוּרְטיּרִין several poles (each carried by two); ט' וטוּרְטוּרֵי טרוטורין a combination &c.— Pl. טוּרְטָנִין. B. Kam. l. c. Ms. R. 2 (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 400).
, v. טִירָא
pr. n. pl., v. טְרָיָיא
, v. טְרָיָינָא, טְרָיָינוֹס.
, v. טירייסקי
, v. טְרוֹמִיטָא

sense.definition: , pl. טוּרְמִיאוֹת, טוּרְמִיּוֹת (turma, τούρμη) turma, a squadron of horse; in gen. division of an army.
sense.notes: Y. Sot. VIII, beg. 22 b (ref. to Ps. XVIII, 13) כנגד טומיות שלהם (corr. acc.) corresponding to their (the enemy’s) squadrons. Yalk. Sam. 160; Mekh. B’shall s. 2 תּוּרְמִיּוֹת. Ib. ת' ת' של מה"ש troops of angels. Ib. (ref. to סֵעַ: Ex. XIV, 10) נעשו … ת' ת' כאיש אחד they all formed squadrons marching like one man; Yalk. Ex. 230 ט' ט'. Ib. מכאן … מתנהגות ת' from here (the Egyptian warfare) the governments learned to form squadrons; Yalk. Ex. 230 ט'.
, v. טְרוֹמִיטָא
, v. חֲמִיסִין

sense.definition: (tormenta) engines for hurling missiles; missiles, shots from the engine.
sense.notes: Y. Sot. VIII, beg. 22 b (ref. to גחלי, Ps. XVIII, 13) כנגד מרמנטן וכ' (corr. acc.) corresponding to their (the enemy’s) tormenta (v. טוּרְמִי); Yalk. Sam. 160 תרמצה; Mekh. B’shall. s. 2 טרמנסנה (corr. acc.). Midr. Till. to Ps. XVIII סימנטרא (read: טוּרְמִינְטָא). Sifré Deut. 204 מיני מטרניאות; Yalk. ib. 923 מיני מטרסאות (read: טוּרְמִנְטָאוֹת).
— Pl. טוּרָנִין, טוּרְנַיָּא. Targ. Is. X, 17 (h. text שמיר!). Ib. XXXIV, 7; a. e.—Esp. Philistean magistrates. Targ. Jud. III, 3 (h. text סרני); a. fr.
Pesik. R. s. 21 למורנס הזה (read: כט', v. Friedm. a. l. note 29) like the lathe which shows a front wherever you turn it.

sense.definition: (also in one word) pr. n. m. Turnus Rufus (supposed to be a corruption of T.
sense.notes: Annius Rufus), a Roman commander in the days of the Hadrianic persecutions. Taan. 29 a טורנסרופוס ed. (Ms. M. טורנוסנורופוס, or טורנוסט', v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note). Y. Ber. IX, 14 b bot. טונוס טר' (Tosaf. to Sot. 31 a טורנוסר'). Koh. R. to III, 17. Snh. 65 b. Ned. 50 b top; Ab. Zar. 20 a. Pesik. R. s. 23.
, v. preced.
, v. טַרְסִיס
, v. טַרְסִי
, Targ. Ps. I, 3 ed. Lag., v. טְיָפָא
, Sifré Num. 89, v. נוֹטָרִיקוֹן
, Ar. s. v. ברנט; v. לַבְרָטִין a. נַרְתֵּק.
, v. טוּס

Pes. 30 b; Zeb. 95 b, a. e. אין טָשִׁין וכ' one must not polish the stove with &c. Tosef. B. Kam. IX, 31 [in a misplaced passage, belonging after שבידיו; read:] הרָק כנגד פני חבירו וטָשׁ פניו (ref. to Is. L, 6 b) who spat into or besmeared his neighbor’s face; (cmp. Mish. ib. VIII, 6; Sifra Emor Par. 14, ch. XX).
Taan. 22 b מְטַשְׁטְשִׁין את הארץ (the heavy rains) make the soil muddy and it yields no fruit; Yalk. Lev. 671.

Part. pass. מְטוּשְׁטָשׁ, pl. מְטוּשְׁטָשִׁין. Pes. 65 b היו בגדיו מט' if his (the priest’s) garments were besmeared (with blood &c.); Zeb. 18 a, sq.; ib. 35 a.—Meg. 18 b אותיות מְטוּשְׁטָשׁוֹת letters made illegible by being smeared over.

הִיטַּשְׁטֵשׁ to be smeared over, be dirty. B. Bath. 168 b נמחק או נט' if the writing was blotted out or blurred. Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. IV, 13 נִטַּשְׁטְשָׁה a metal mirror which became blurred (blind). Sabb. 81 a נִיטַּשְׁטְשׁוּ Ms. M. (ed. נשטש', corr. acc.) the spots were washed away (became indistinct). Cant. R. to VIII, 9 a picture on a wall אע"פ שמִטַּשְׁטֶשֶׁת (prob. שמְטוּשְׁטֶשֶׁת, v. supra) even if it be smeared over.

Targ. Y. Deut. XXVIII, 40 תטושון Ar. (ed. תשוטון, corr. acc. or תשועון, v. שׁוּע) you will oint yourselves. Targ. Y. II Lev. XIV, 42 ויטשון (read וִיטוּשׁוּן) shall plaster over; (Targ. Y. I ויִתְטַשׁ Ithpa.).—Gen. R. s. 34, end וטָשִׁין מותיה (not וטושין) and paste the plaster on its scull.
Targ. Y. Lev. XIV, 43; 48; v. supra.

sense.definition: to smear over, to make muddy.
sense.notes: Part. pass. מְטַשְׁטַשׁ; v. infra.

sense.definition: to be smeared over, to be made muddy.
sense.notes: Targ. Job. XVI, 16 מִטַּ' Ms. (ed. מְטַ'; h. text חמרמר'); Targ. Ps. XLVI, 4 (h. text חמר; cmp. חֵמָרָא).
אָטֵישׁ to hide, reserve (corresp. to h. צָפַן). Targ. Ps. XXXI, 20 אָטֵשְתָּא Ms. (ed. אַטְשֵׁיתָא, v. טְשִׁי). Ib. CXIX, 11 (some ed. אשיש', corr. acc.). Targ. Job X, 13. Ib. XXIII, 12.
Ib. XV, 20. Ib. XXIV, 1.—V. טְשֵׁי, נטש.
, v. טְוָות
, v. טחי
, v. טְחָיֵי
Sifra Aḥãré beg.; Yalk. Lev. 571.
Targ. Job XXXVII, 11 Regia (ed. ברירותא, h. text ברי).
Ḥull. III, 2. Snh. 21 b; Ab. Zar. 44 a נטולי ט' having had their milt cut out (as fast runners); a. fr.
. Targ. Esth. VIII, 10; v. טַחֲלָא.
, v. טְחִינָה

— Pl. טְתוֹנִין, טְחוֹנַיָּא. Y. Peah I, 15 c bot.; Y. Kidd. I, 61 b bot. אתת … ט' an ordinance was issued for millers (for government work); Pesik. R. s. 23-24 טחונים (read … יא). Y. Pes. III, 30 a top; a. fr.
Midr. Sam. ch. X היה יושב כט' when one sat straining himself like &c.

sense.definition: k’ri טְחֹרִים; v. טְחַר) piles, hemorrhoids.
sense.notes: Targ. Deut. XXVIII, 27; a. e.—Targ. Ps. LXXVIII, 66 (h. text אחור).

sense.definition: (v. טוּחַ II) to squeeze into, fasten to.
sense.notes: Gitt. 69 b נִיטַחְיֵיה בתנורא (not … חייא) let him squeeze it (the milt) into (the cracks of) an oven; ניט' ביני אורבי let him squeeze it in between bricks &c.
, v. טִיחְיָא

sense.definition: (טחא, cmp. טוּחַ I) cakes smeared with oil.
sense.notes: Sabb. 119 a; Ḥull. 111 a תלת סאוי ט' three S’ah of flour made into glistening cakes.
, v. טְחַן
Pes. 11 a; a. fr.—Men. XI, 3 (96 a) טְחִינָתָן (Mish. ed. טְחוֹנָן); Tosef. ib. XI, 4 טְחֹנָן.—Trnsf. sexual contact. Sot. 10 a; Num. R. s. 9 (ref. to Jud. XVI, 21, a. Job XXXI, 10).
Tosef. Dem. I, 24; Ḥull. 6 a; Y. Dem. I, 22 a סח' (corr. acc.)
Gitt. 69 b לט' for pain in the milt. Ḥull. 93 a; a. fr.— Pl. טַחֲלֵי. Ib. דט' וכ' the veins (sinews) of milts must be removed as fat; v. חוּטָא. Ib. 111 a תבשילא דט' a dish of pieces of milt.

Sabb. VII, 2 הטוֹחֵן he who grinds (on the Sabbath). Ex. R. s. 36, beg. טוֹחֲנִין אותם (the olives) are crushed. Sot. 9 b … ועקרן וטְחָנָן וכ' and Samson uprooted them (the mountains) and ground them against one another; Snh. 24 a; a. fr.—Trnsf. to have sexual intercourse (cmp. μύλλω). Gen. R. s. 48, end.—
Pesik. R. s. 23-24 (ed. Fr. p. 122 b) טוֹחֲנוֹ ברחיים, v. infra, a. כָּדַן.

Kidd. 31 a bot. ויש מַטְחִינוֹ ברחיים and some one may make his father grind in the mill (v. supra, a. כָּדַן). Keth. 59 b (ref. to ib. V, 5) טוֹחֶנֶת ס"ד … מַטְחֶנֶת you cannot mean that she must do the grinding?… she must attend to the grinding.

Targ. Jud. XVI, 21; a. e.—Pesik. R. s. 23-24; Y. Kidd. I, 61 b bot.; Y. Peah I, 15 c bot. טְחוֹן תחותי grind thou in my place. Ib. הוה איטחין, read: הוה טָחֵין as Y. Kidd. l. c.—Snh. 96 a טַחְנֵי קשייתא were grinding date-stones; a. fr.— Part. pass. טְחִין, טְחִינָא. Ib. b טְחִינַת קמחא ט' thou groundest ground flour (you conquered Israel because it was doomed to destruction). Ber. 43 a bot. משחא ט' oil perfumed with ground ingredients, contrad. to כבישא.—Y. Ned. VI, end, 40 a קליין וטְחִינָן וכ' roasted and ground &c. [Cant. R. to I, 16 לא מטחנא, read: מְטַמְּנָא (?), v. נְצַע.]
m. = טְחִינָה q. v.

Koh. R. to XII, 7 נמשלו ד"ת כט' וכ' the study of the Law is allegorized as a mill, as the mill does not stop &c.— Pl. טוֹחֲנוֹת (fr. טוֹחֲנָה) millstones. Lam. R. introd. (R. Josh. 2) נמשלו ישראל כט' Israel is compared to millstones (never resting), v. supra. Ib. הט' אלו משניות וכ' ‘the millstones’ (Koh. XII, 3), that means the study of the great Mishnayoth of &c.
— Part. pass. טָחוּף; fem. טְחוּפָה, pl. טְחוּפוֹת (of wool) dirty-white, gray, opp. לבנה bright-white. Ḥull. XI, 2; ib. 136 b Ar. (ed. שחופות). [Cmp. Arab. ṭaḫf moeror, nubes.]

sense.definition: (= תחר, denom. of אחר; cmp. טִיגָּן) to press, to strain the rectum.
sense.notes: Sabb. 82 a לא לִיטְחַר טפי Ar. (ed. ליטרח; Ms. M. לִיתְחַר, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) one must not strain himself too much.—V. טְחוֹרַיָּא.

sense.definition: two (in the language of כתפי, כיתפי or גדפי).
sense.notes: Snh. 4 b; Zeb. 37 b; Men. 34 b
Ḥull. 110 a (in R. Gershon Ms. טלטל לפוש, v. Koh. Ar. Compl. s. v.;—perh. a perversion of בלשפט).
f. pl., a corruption of טֵטְרָפוּלָאוֹת, v. טֶיטְרַפְלִיוֹת
, v. טוֹט'

sense.definition: (τετράμουλος) a chariot with four animals ( mules) abreast, (Lat.) quadriga; [a compound not recorded in Greek dictionaries].
sense.notes: Ex. R. s. 3 I shall come down בט' שלי with my quadriga (ref. to Ez. I, 5); ib. s. 42 מילין … (corr. acc.); Tanḥ. Ki Thissa 21. Ex. R. s. 43 והם שומטים אחד מן ט' וכ' and they will unhitch one of the four animals of my chariot.
, v. טֶיטְרַפְלִיּוֹת

of טרג, cmp. טָרֵיךְ, טַרְכְּנוּתָא) to molest, provoke. Erub. 61 a טַטְרוּגֵי מְטַטְרְגֵי להו וכ' the residents of G. used to molest those of Ḥ. (visiting their place; v. Ms. M. a. Rabb. D. S. a. l. notes).

sense.definition: (τετράγωνος) four-cornered, in a quadrangle, in a square.
sense.notes: Naz. 8 b; B. Bath. 164 b (בית) ט' a house of four corners. Cant. R. to IV, 4 (expl. תלפיות) טֶטְרָגוֹנִין (τετραγώνιον) in a square. Pesik. R. s. 10 בוטרגונין (corr. acc.), v. אִסְטְרוֹנְגִּילוֹן.

sense.definition: (τετράγονος, v. דִּיגוֹן) for the fourth time.
sense.notes: Tosef. Naz. I, 2 הריני נזיר ט' וכ' ‘I will be a Nazir tetragon’, means four times; Naz. l. c.; B. Bath. l. c.
Midr. Till. to Ps. LXXVIII, 49 מט' היה (corr. acc.) each plague was fourfold; ed. Bub. טֶטְרָאגוֹן.

Y. Sot. VIII, 22 d top (ref. to Ex. XXXII, 15) ט' the engraving on the tablets was in a square (containing the Ten Commandments four times on each side, and readable whichever way you turned it); Cant. R. to V, 14 טטרוגא (corr. acc.).
, v. preced.
, infin. of טַטְרֵג.
, v. טֶטְרָאמ'
, v. טִיטַ'
, v. טִיטְרַפְלִיּוֹת
, Tosef. Ohol. XVIII, 13, v. טִיטְרַפְלוֹן
, Y. Gitt. IV, 45 d bot., הרנירק ט', v. אנדכתרי
, Cant. R. beg., some ed. טיארון, read: תִּיאַטְרוֹן.
, v. טְיָיר

sense.definition: (טוב, cmp. טֶבַע) form, nature, character, peculiarity.
sense.notes: Y. Ber. VII, 11 b ט' ברכה the form of a benediction. Kidd. 13 a ט' גטין וכ' the legal form of deeds of divorce and of betrothals. Gen. R. s. 17 אדם זה מה טִיבוֹ this man (whom thou art going to create)—what will his nature (distinction) be?—Keth. I, 8 מה טיבו של זה what is that man? Ib. 9 מה ט' של עובר זה what is this expected child (who is its father)?—Snh. 108 b מה טִיבָם וכ' what is the nature of these seven days?—Sifra Emor ch. XVIII, Par. 14 מה טִיבְךָ ליטע וכ' what art thou (what right hast thou) to put up thy tent &c.?; a. fr.
ch.

sense.definition: same. Targ. Cant. VII, 1 מה טִיבְכוֹן what right have you?—Y.
sense.notes: Sabb. II, 4 d top מה הוה טִיבֵיה what sort of a man was he?; Y. Ter. XI, end, 48 b מה טבייה (corr. acc.).—
Targ. I Sam. XVII, 18 טִיבְהוֹן ed. Lag. (oth. ed. טִיבֵיהוֹן, h. text עֲרֻבָּה). [Targ. Am. IX, 4 לטיבא, some ed., read לטָבָא. Targ. Is. IX, 9 טיבין, some ed., read טָבִין.]

sense.definition: (טבב, cmp. דָּבַב, דִּיבָּה) murmuring, rumor, ( evil) report.
sense.notes: Targ. O. Gen. XXXVII, 2 טִיבְּהוֹן ed. Berl. (oth. ed. דִּבְּ'; Y. טִיבֵיהוֹן). Targ. Prov. X, 18 טיבא ed. Lag. (some ed. טָבָא, read טִבָּ'); a. fr.—[Targ. Y. Gen. XXXIV, 30 טימי, Var. שׁמי, read טִיבִּי.]
טִיֵּיב, Pa. טַיֵּיב, v. טוּב.
— Pl. טִיבוֹת. Snh. 61 b מטִיבוֹתָן וכ' from the qualities of the near deities &c., [Ms. F. טוֹבוֹתָן, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 90].

sense.definition: , goodness, good deed; profit, enjoyment, pleasure.
sense.notes: Targ. Gen. XXIII, 13. Targ. Koh. IV, 8; a. fr.—Y. Ḥag. II, 77 d bot. חדא ט' one good deed. Tam. 32 a יעביד ט' עם וכ' let him act kindly towards &c. Taan. 23 b ולא נחזיק ט' וכ' without having credit given to us. Y. Ber. II, 5 a bot., v. חֲזַק. Lam. R. to I, 5; a. fr.—Men. 52 a מטֵיבוּתָן לא אמרי Ms. M. (ed. מטֵבוּתִין) of our good teachings they do not speak. Ib. הני נמי מטיבותן היא Ms. M. (ed. טבותין) this is also one of our good things.

Pes. 115 a כל שׁטִיבּוּלוֹ במשקה וכ' whatever eatable is dipped into a liquid, requires hand-washing (before partaking of it). Gitt. 70 a יהא רגיל בט' וכ' let him make it a habit to eat relishes dipped (in vinegar &c.) in the summer as well as &c. Bets. 18 b; Sabb. 111 a קודם ט' before the antepast. Pes. 115 b בט' ראשון when dipping the first time; a. e.

sense.definition: (טָבַל II) the act which makes food subject to priestly gifts (טֶבֶל).
sense.notes: Y. Ḥall. III, 59 b top גילגולה טִיבּוּלָהּ the rolling of the dough makes it Tebel
Targ. Y. Num. XIX, 4. Ib. 7, sq.; a. e.— Pl. טִיבּוּלֵי. Pes. 114 b תרי ט' dipping twice.

sense.definition: (טָבַע I) sinking; לט' for being sunk, at the risk of receiving no consideration.
sense.notes: Keth. 76 b קידושין לט' ניתנו the object of value given at betrothal is made a present even at the risk of death before the consummation of marriage; B. Bath. 145 a

Sabb. XVIII, 3 (128 b) את הט' the infant’s navel string. Nidd. 13 b על טִבּוּרוֹ (Ar. טיב') above his navel. Yoma 85 a מטיבורו the formation of the embryo begins from the navel. Midr. Till. to Ps. XIX; a. fr.—Trnsf. centre or highest part. Meg. 6 a (homiletic etymol. of טבריה) שיושבת בטִיבּוּרָהּ של א"י it is situated on the height of Palestine.

Sabb. 66 b סחופי כסא אטיבורא Ms. M. (ed. אטיבורי, אטבורי, corr. acc.) to put a dry cup on the navel.—Y. Kil. VIII, 31 c bot. חיי מן טִיבּוּרְיֵיה it draws nourishment through its navel string; איפסיק טיבורייה when its navel string is cut.
, v. טִיבוּ
, v. sub טבר'.
, v. טִבְלָא
, v. sub טבר'.
, v. טְבַרְיָא
, v. next w.
-Scott Gr. Dict. s. v.; prob. of Semitic origin = תגן, denom. of אגן; as for ט = ת cmp. Syr. טגר P. Sm. 1432 with Chald. תגרא)

sense.definition: frying pan; also (interch. with טִיגּוּן) a flour-dish prepared with oil.
sense.notes: Snh. 21 a (ref. to ותצק, II Sam. XIII, 9) עשתה לו מיני ט' she made for him oil-dishes. Men. 104 b ה' מיני טיגון (most eds.) five sorts of oil-dishes (ref. to Lev. II, 1; 4; 5; 7; 14—15).— Pl. טִיגָּנִין. Tosef. Ab. Zar. V (VI), 1; VIII (IX), 2 הט' the frying pans.

sense.definition: (cmp. Syr. טוגנא, P. Sm. 1431) an engine of torture and execution.
sense.notes: Pesik. R. s. 43 נתנוהו בתיך הטיגנו (read: הטיגנן or הטיגנון) they put him into the teganon.—Denom. טָגַן, Pi. טִיגֵּן 1) to fry, roast. Men. 50 b (expl. תפיני, Lev. VI, 14; 21) אופה ואח"כ מְטַגְּנָהּ one baked it and then fried it with oil; a. fr.—Part. pass. מְטוּגָּן. Y. Ned. VI, beg. 39 c. [Ib. VI, end, 40 a, v. next w.]—2) to torture, put to death. Pesik. R. l. c. וטיגס אותו (Var. וטגים), read: אותו וטִיגְּנוּ or וטִיגְּנוּהוּ.—Trnsf. to torture, agonize. Tanḥ. Vayiggash 9 אתה טִגַּנְתָּה וכ' thou causedst agony to thy father &c.

Kidd. 44 a כמן ימא לט' הוא (some ed. לטִיגְנִי) (his report of the proceedings of the college is) as direct as catching a fish from the lake and throwing it into the frying pan. Y. Ber. III, 6 d מן ימא לט' from the lake into the pan, i.e. this is an immediate application of the lesson learned.—Y. Kidd. II, 62 b top והות מן ימא לט' it was a fresh report, v. supra; Y. Gitt. VI, 48 a לטִיגְנִי …—Denom. טַגֵּן to fry with oil. Part. pass. מְטַגַּן, מְטַגְּנָא. Targ. Y. Lev. VI, 14; VII, 12.— Pl. מְטַגְּנָן. Y. Ned. VI, end, 40 a (not מטוגן).
Ab. Zar. 28 a bot.
, v. טִיגָּן, טיגָּנָא.
, v. טִירְיָנָא
Ber. 59 a Ms. F.; Y. ib. IX, 13 d; Yalk. Is. 335 נראה שמים בטִהֲרוֹ (read: רקיע).
ch.

sense.definition: same. Ber. 59 a bot. אימת מתחזי בטִיהֲרֵיה Ms. M. (ed. only אימתי) when is the sky seen in its brightness?— Pl. טִיהֲרִין, טִהֲ'.
sense.notes: Targ. Jer. IV, 11 רוח ט' a clearing, sweeping wind (h. text צח).

sense.definition: (cmp. Targ. Jer. l. c.) cold wind, cold (cmp. אִסְתָּנָא).
sense.notes: Lam. R. introd. (R. Joh. 1) בט' ובקייטא in cold weather and in summer heat.

Targ. O. Deut. XXVIII, 29; a. fr.—Yoma 59 a, a. e., v. טֹהַר. Sabb. 63 a שרגא בט' a lamp at noon (useless thing); Ḥull. 60 b; a. fr.— Pl. טִיהֲרַיָּא. Targ. Ps. XCI, 6 Ms. (ed. sing.), Ib. XXXVII, 6 Ms. (ed. sing.).

sense.definition: (preced.; v. Ps. XCI, 6) midday-demons during the summer.
sense.notes: Targ. Cant. IV, 6 טהרי ed. Lag.—Targ. Y. I Deut. XXXII, 24 (some ed. incorr. טיהרדי).

sense.definition: (טַיֵּיט) blotting, filling a blank with dots or blots.
sense.notes: B. Bath. 163 a (commentaries use h. form טִיאוּט a. טִיּוּט). [Targ. Prov. IX, 17 Ar. ed. Koh. s. v. טיטויא, v. טִימוּרָא.]
Targ. Job XXIX, 15 ט' רגליא Ms. (ed. only ט'; ed. Lag. טִיּיוּל), v. טַיָּיל.
Ex. R. s. 15 (some ed. טויסין).—V. טַיְיסָן.
, v. טְיָפָא
, v. טַיְיפָה
Tosef. Kel. B. Kam. IV, 19, sq. [read, as R. S. to Kel. V, 11:] אם יכיל הט' לעמוד בפני עצמו if the lining can stand by itself (form a vessel of itself); v. הֶטֵּחַ.
Neg. XII, 6; Sifra Metsora, Neg., Par. 6, ch. IV.

sense.definition: (preced.) smearing with a fatty substance, glazing.
sense.notes: M. Kat. 17 a ומהניא ביה כי ט' בתנורא and (the excommunication) retains its effect on him as does the glazing on the tiles of the oven. Pes. 30 a ההוא תנורא דטחו ביה ט' an oven which they smeared with fat for glazing purposes; Zeb. 95 b דאטחו בה טיחייה (Ms. R. 2 טחו … טחויי; Ms. K. טְחָיֵי ‘in which they baked cakes smeared with fat’, Rashi; v. טְחָיֵי).

sense.definition: c. (b. h.; = טנטן, v. טָנַן; cmp. גַּג; Assyr.
sense.notes: ṭ î ṭ u) [ moist, viscid substance,] plaster, clay, mud. Pes. 55 a, v. גְּרִיד. M. Kat. 7 a, v. טוּחַ I. Mikv. VII, 1 הט' הנרוק, v. רָקַק. Ib. 7 ט' העבה thick clay; a. fr.—[Sabb. 67 a בר ט' son of mud, a demon, prob. a Var. lect. of בר טינא.]
, Targ. Prov. IX, 17 Ar. (Var. טיוטא, טיטורא) a. some ed., a corrupt. of טִימוּרָא.

sense.definition: Titus (Flavius Sabinus Vespasianus), Roman general, later emperor, captor of Jerusalem.
sense.notes: Targ. Lam. I, 19.—Gitt. 56 b; a. fr. (mostly with the by-name ‘the wicked’).—[Sot. IX, 14 (49 b) פולמוס של ט', v. Frankel Monatssch. 1852, p. 393 sq.]
, v. טיטויא
, Esth. R. to I, 2, v. טַמְיָקוֹן, a. טַמְיוֹן.
Y. Ber. III, 6 c; Y. Bicc, III, 65 d יודה בר ט'.—Y. Ter. VIII, 45 c bot. חייה בר ט'.

sense.definition: (= טרטרוס, טרטר', v. טְרִי, with format.
sense.notes: ס; cmp. אַטְלֵס) a perforated vessel, sprinkler, strainer. Kel. II, 6 (Var. סיטרוס).

sense.definition: (τέταρτον) tetarton ( quart), a liquid measure, about one quart of a pint.
sense.notes: Y. Sabb. VIII, beg. 11 a; Y. Shek. III, 47 b bot.; Y. Pes. X, 37 c top ט' ורביע (not טיטרטין, טט') one and one fourth of a t. (is a ritual cup). Ib. III, 30 a top ט' דמיי בגו מודייה (not טרטון) one t. of water for a modius of wheat.

sense.definition: (v. next w.) tetrapylon, ( Mansion-house), name of a prominent building in Caesarea Palestinae.
sense.notes: Tosef. Ohol. XVIII, 13 טטרפלין ed. Zuck. (corr. acc., Var. מטרפלון).

sense.definition: (τετράπυλον) buildings with four gates, prominent mansions.
sense.notes: Y. Succ. I, 52 a bot. טו' שבכרכים the tetrapyla (mansions) in fortified cities; Y. Kil. IV, 29 b bot. טי' שבכרמים (corr. acc.).—Midr. Till. to Ps. XLVIII טִטְרָאפִילוֹת Ar. (ed. טטפראות); Yalk. Ps. 756; טטרפאות; Yalk. Zech. 568; B. Bath. 75 b טוטפראות (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 50).
Y. Shebi. IV, beg. 35 a איזהו הט' wherein consists the improvement (spoken of in the Mishnah)?

sense.definition: (dialect. for טַיְיסָן q. v.) proud fool.
sense.notes: Ab. Zar. 26 a גרדנא דלא ט' שתא בציר מְשַׁנֵּי (Ms. M. … טייזיאן משניה, read: טַיְיזָאן) a year (of) scarce earning will change (better) a weaver, if he be no proud fool. [Var. in Ar. s. v. ג' דלטייא׃ גרדנא or דלטייה; Yalk. Gen. 133 … שמתא בצרא …] [The supposed meaning of our w. of humble seems to have risen from a misunderstanding of a running commentary embodied in Rashi a. Tosafoth, where דלא ט' is interpreted עניו.]

sense.definition: (denom. of טִיט) to smear over, blot, soil.
sense.notes: B. Bath. 163 a דמְטַיֵּיט ליה he marks the blank space with blots (Ar. מְדַיֵּית, v. דְּיוּתָא).
, v. טוּל

sense.definition: (preced.) one at leisure, opp. to פועל.
sense.notes: Keth. 62 a bot.— Pl. טַיָּילִים, לִין … Ib. V, 6 (61 b). Ib. 62 a מאי ט' who are meant by tayyalin?
Targ. Job XXIX, 15 Var., v. טִיּוּלָא.
, v. אלטינין
, v. טוּס ch.

sense.definition: (preced.) a bird swooping for prey, bird of prey.
sense.notes: Y. II Gen. XV, 11 (h. text עיט).
Targ. Y. Gen. I, 20.
Y. Ber. III, 6 a bot.; (Y. Naz. VII, 56 a top סייסן; comment.: סייטן flighty, restless).

sense.definition: (טוע, cmp. טעי) traveller, esp. Arabian caravan merchant.
sense.notes: B. Bath. 73 b. Ber. 56 b ט' בעלמא dreaming of an Arab in general (not of Ishmael, the son of Abraham). Men. 69 b כדעדי ט' (Ms. M. בר עדי) as in the case of Adi the merchant; Ab. Zar. 33 a בר עדי ט'. Yeb. 102 a סנדלא דט' וכ' a traveller’s sandal which fits closely.— Pl. טַיָּיעֵי. Sabb. 112 a, v. אוּשְׁכָּפָא. Ab. Zar. 34 b, v. אַבְטָא. B. Bath. 36 a בנהרדעא ט' שכיחי in N. Arabs (stealing cattle) are frequent.

sense.definition: (preced.) travellers’ custom; (adv.) in the manner of travellers.
sense.notes: Pes. 65 b (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 60).
Gitt. 45 b (Ar. ed. pr. טייתא).
, v. טְיָפָא
Y. Dem. III, 23 c; Y. Yeb. VIII, beg. 8 c טיו' סמוקי.
, v. טוּר

Pesik. Par. p. 33 b שהיו יודעים במזל וערומים בט' they understood astrology and were shrewd in augury; (Pesik. R. s. 14, v. אַסְטְרוֹלוֹגְיָא); Tanḥ. Ḥuck. 6; ed. Bub. 11; Koh. R. to VII, 23 קוסמין בעופות ובקיאין בט' divined from birds and were experts in divination.— Pl. טְיָירִין (טְיָארִין, טִיאוּרִין); חכמת הט' the art of divination. Ib. to X, 20 (ref. to עוף ib.) זה הוא העורב בח' ט' Ar. (ed. חכמת טיאריו, read בח' … ין) that means, the raven (carries the sound) through the art of divination; Midr. Till. to Ps. VII, beg. וח' טיארין; Yalk. Koh. 979 העורב ח' טיאורין … (read בח'); Lev. R. s. 32 וח' טייארין.
, v. טַיַּיעְתָּא
Pesik. R. s. 14 the sand stands before the Ocean כט' וכחומה like a dam and a wall (cmp. טִיכְסָא). [It is not likely that our w. is the Greek τεῖχος, which is identical in meaning with חומה.]
Targ. Y. Ex. XXVIII, 8; XXXIX, 5 (h. text אֲפֻדָה).
Y’lamd. Sh’laḥ, quot. in Ar. (v. Koh. Ar. Compl. s. v.).

Gen. R. s. 63 על טי' דמדינ' Ar. (ed. מטכסא) on the rampart of the fortress (in spite of the gates being closed); Yalk. Gen. 110.— Pl. טִיסְסַיָּיא, טִכְ'. Lam. R. to I, 5 פליג ד' ט' וכ' he assigned the demolition of the four ramparts of the Temple mount to the four generals, and the western gate came under the command of Pangar.
, v. טוּל
Targ. Y. Gen. XXIX, 1 לטִילָא (perh. to be read לטַיָּלָא).

sense.definition: tila or tilia, name of an inferior austere wine.
