sense.notes: Ab. Zar. 28 a bot. (Rashi: טילייא). Ib. 30 a bot. (by יין חד is meant) ט' חריפא וכ' the austere tila which bursts the bag. Gitt. 70 a the worst of all is טיליא וכ' white t

sense.definition: (טלי, v. טְלָאי) patch, rag; trnsf. insignificant person.
sense.notes: — Pl. טִילְיִי. Koh. R. to XI, 10 כל ט' סירוי טפשן … all rags are ‘ill-smells’ (paltry persons are quarrelsome), and all ‘ill-smells’ are foolish.
, v. טִלְטוּלַיָּיא
&c., v. sub טִלְט'.
, v. טִילָא
, v. טְלוּמָא
, v. טלְפָא
, v. טִימִי I
, v. טוֹמוֹס
, Y. Dem. II, beg. 22 b, read: סִימּוֹק (v. R. S. to Dem. II, 1).
Targ. Prov. IX, 17 ed. Lag. a. oth. (some ed. טיטויא, טיטורא; corr. acc.).—[Targ. Ps. XI, 4 טימורוי ed. Lag., v. תִּימְרָא.]—Targ. Job XL, 21 טִמוּר constr.
Ib. XXIV, 15.
f. same. Targ. Koh. X, 20 (ed. Amst. טִמּוֹ').

sense.definition: (next w.) becoming a cohesive shapeless mass.
sense.notes: Y. Ḥall. III, beg. 59 a, contrad. to גילגול.

sense.definition: to knead into a cohesive shapeless mass, contrad. to גלגל to roll and shape the dough.
sense.notes: Ḥall. III, 1 טִימְטְמָהּ בשעורים after one has formed a lump of barley flour; Tosef. ib. I, 11; a. e.

sense.definition: to thicken, obstruct, esp. to blunt the understanding.
sense.notes: Pes. 42 a מְטַמְטֵם את הלב obstructs the heart (makes a person dull). Yoma 39 a עבירה מְטַמְטֶמֶת … ונְטַמֹּתֶם Ms. (ed. ונטמטם, corr. acc.) sin dulls the heart of man, read not (Lev. XI, 4

sense.definition: v’nitmethem (you will be defiled) but un’tammothem (from טָמַם) (you will become dull-hearted); Yalk. Lev. 545.
sense.notes: —Ch. טַמְטֵם.
Ḥall. l. c. ותִטַּמְטֵם; Tosef. ib. l. c. יתִיטַּמְטֵים.

sense.definition: (τιμή, inflected like a native word; cmp. אוֹנִי I)

sense.notes: Targ. Esth. III, 8. Targ. Y. Num. XX, 19 טִימְהוֹן. Targ. Prov. XXXI, 10 טִימָהָא (missing in some eds.) her value.—Y. Peah I, 15 d bot., a. fr. דלית לה ט' invaluable (cmp. אֲטִימִיטוֹן). Gen. R. s. 2, beg., v. אוֹנִי I. Koh. R. to XI, 9 אייתי ט' מה דאכלת make payment for what thou hast eaten; a. fr.—Y. Shek. V, end, 49 b [read:] הא לך טִימִיתָהּ וזבין קופד here is its price and buy a piece of meat for it. Y. Taan. I, 64 b bot. טִימִיתֵיה (not … תי) the money received for it; a. fr.—Also: טִימִין (accus. of τιμή). Targ. Y. Gen. XXIII, 15. Targ. Esth. VII, 4.
Y. Ab. Zar. III, 42 d ט' דרומי the figure of a Roman deity. [Targ. Y. Gen. XXXIV, 30, v. טִיב II.]
Koh. R. to IX, 7 ר' יהושוע בריה דר' ט' (Yalk. Koh 979 only ר' שמלאי).
, v. טַמְיוֹן
, v. טַמְיָא
טִימֵי (Chaldaism, v. טַמְיָא) bones. Tanḥ. Mick. 2 (play on חרט̇מ̇ים, Dan. II, 2) אלו בטִימֵי מתים … those who consult the bones of the dead.
, v. טוֹמוֹס
, v. טַמְיָקוֹן
, v. טִימִי I
, v. טוֹמוֹס

Targ. Ez. XIII, 11. Targ. Zech. X, 5 (ed. Lag. סִין; h. text טיט). Targ. Ex. I, 14 (h. text חֹמֶר); a. fr.—Ab. Zar. 39 a דלא מרבי ט' וכ' (not מרבה) the muddy soil of the river suffers no unclean fish to live in it; Succ. 18 a Ms. M. 2 (ed. טינייהו, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 40). Yoma 29 a ט' בר ט' cement made out of cement (that has before been used, is hard to make). B. Bath. 3 a בט' when clay has been used as cement, contrad. to ריכסא. Ib. 73 b, v. אָכְלָה I; a. fr.—Sabb. 67 a, v. טִיט.

Y. Kil. II, 27 d top, a. e., v. גְּרִיד. Y. Shebi. II, 33 d עפר עושה לה ט' by covering it with earth he prepares for the plant a muddy ground. Y. Kidd. III, end, 65 a (prov). מוליכין ט' אצל ט' וכ' mud is carried to mud, and thorns to thorns. Deut. R. s. 5, beg.; Yalk. Prov. 938 מפני הט' on account of the moist soil.

sense.definition: (cmp. זִימָּה a. טְנָנָא) impure thought, lust.
sense.notes: Ḥag. 15 b ט' היתה בלבם there was impurity in their hearts (heathen sensuality). Snh. 75 a העלה לבו ט' a vehement passion seized him (which threatened his health).
, Targ. Y. Lev. XXV, 31, כט' דפריסן, read כטִינָּרֵי דפריסין, v. טִינָּרָא.
, v. טִינָּא
, v. טיינון

Cant. R. to V, 3. Ex. R. s. 5 לשון ט' nirpim (Ex. V, 8) has the meaning of uncleanliness (in secretory functions, v. רפי), opp. קדושים. Bekh. III, 1 ט' a discharge from the womb indicating abortion; Nidd. 25 a; a. e.
Sabb. 125 a
f.

sense.definition: same. Meg. 3 a (in Chald. dict.) בטקום הט' at a place soiled with secretion.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 50 ט' עבודת וכ' the defilement by idolatry; a. fr.

B. Bath. VI, 2 (93 b) the buyer must accept רובע ט' לסאה one fourth of a Kab of refuse in a S’ah; Tosef. ib. VI, 2; a. e.— Pl. טִינּוֹפוֹת, טִנּ' worthless grains. Num. R. s. 4, beg.; Tanḥ. B’midbar 19; ed. Bub. 22.
, v. טִנָנָא
, Y. Snh. I, 18 c bot., read מֵינַץ or יֵינַץ, v. נוּץ ch.
— Pl. טִינָּרִין. Ex. R. s. 23 שני ט' two pieces of flint (Sot. 11 b עגולין).

Targ. Job. XXXIX, 28. Targ. O. Ex. IV, 25 טִינָּ' ed. Berl. (ed. Amst. a. Y. טִינְרָא); a. fr.—Gitt. 68 a ומכסיא בט' and covered it up with a stone.— Pl. טִינָּרִין, טִינָּרַיָּא, טִינָּרֵי, טִנָּ'. Targ. Y. I. Num. XXIV, 21 (ed. Amst. טִינְרַ'). Targ. Ps. LXXVIII, 15 Ms. (ed. Lag. a. oth. טוּרִין). [Targ. Job. XXVII, 16 טינרין Ms., ed. טינא.]—Trnsf. large, hard tubercles. Ḥull. 48 b דקיימא ט' ט' lungs covered with &c.
Targ. Jud. XV, 15 בט' in the mud (h. text טריה).
Yalk. Ex. 243 טס … ט' אחת flew to Egypt in one flight.
Makhsh. VI, 2. Tosef. Bets. I, 18 ed. Zuck. (ed. סיטני, corr. acc.); a. fr.
, v. טַסְקָא
, v. טַיְיעָא

sense.definition: (cmp. next w.) receptacle of overflow, a stand for a portable stove.
sense.notes: Tosef. Kel. B. Kam. V, 4.

sense.definition: (v. טִיפָּה) dripping; ט' ט' constant dripping.
sense.notes: Pes. 111 b מאן דשתי ט' ט' one who drinks the drippings of wine. Ab. Zar. 30 b מי ט' ט' אין וכ' (Ms. M. omits מי) to liquids which drip into a vessel the rule concerning uncovered liquids does not apply; והוא דעביד ט' ט' בהדי ט' ט' Ms. M. (ed. ט' להדי ט' ט' …, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) provided the drops follow each other without intermission.

sense.definition: ; pl. טְיָפִין, טְיָפֵי, (טְוָו') טְיָי' (טוף, cmp. preced. wrds.
sense.notes: , cmp. preced. wrds.)

—Targ. Prov. V, 16 (ed. Lag. טוופי). Targ. Ps. I, 3 טְוָפֵי ed. Wil. (ed. Lag. טורפי, some ed. טרופי, read טוו'). Ib. CXIX, 136. Targ. Job XXIX, 6 (h. text everywhere פלגי). Ib. XX, 17 (h. text פלגות).
Ib. XXXVI, 27 טְיוּפֵי ed. Lag. (oth. ed. טייפי, Ms. טוופי, h. text נטפי).

sense.definition: c. ch. = next w. Arakh. 7 a ט' דמ"ה the venomous drop (on the sword) of the angel of death, v. next w.— Pl. טִיפַּיָּיא.
sense.notes: Y. Ḥag. II, 78 a top [read:] ביני ט' הוינא מהלכין we walked between the rain drops (so that we did not get wet).

Taan. 6 b על כל ט' וט' וכ' for every drop of rain which thou hast caused to come down for us. Toh. III, 3. Kerith. 13 a ט' מלוכלכת וכ' the drop mixing with the moisture of the nibble. Ab. Zar. 20 b וט' של מרה וכ' and a drop of poison hangs on it (the sword of the angel of death); a. fr.—Y. Nidd. III, 50 d כט' של זבוב like the dripping of a fly (v. infra).— Pl. טִיפִּין, טִיפּוֹת, טִפּ'. Mikv. VIII, 3. Cant. R. to I, 2 מה מים יורדין ט' ט' וכ' as waters come down in drops and form rivers …, so does learning &c. Y. Nidd. l. c.; Bab. ib. 25 a כשתי ט' like two drippings of a fly (Rashi: like the two eye-balls). Hor. 10 a כמה טפות וכ' (Ms. M. טפין, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) how many drops there are in the sea; a. fr.

sense.definition: (טָפַח I) clapping of hands (in mourning or rejoicing).
sense.notes: Y. Bets. V. 63 a ט' שהוא לרצונו tippua ḥ means a clapping which is done purposely, opp. סיפוק spontaneous clapping; M. Kat. 27 b ט' ביד tippua ḥ is done with the hands, opp. קילוס, striking of feet.—

Tosef. Nidd. II, 4 חייבת … בט' וכ' a woman is bound to nurse her child twenty four months (during which she must not remarry), whether her own &c. B. Mets. 69 a טִיפּוּלָהּ מרובה the care-taking of small cattle is more troublesome; Bekh. 26 b טִפּ'; a. e.

Pes. 42 b טִיפּוּלָן של וכ' the paste used by the daughters of rich men.— Pl. טִיפּוּלִין, constr. טִיפּוּלֵי. Y. ib. II, beg. 29 d אית תניי תני ט' some read in the Mishnah tippulé (in place of תכשיטי).
Tem. 30 a טִיפוּנֵה דכלב the excess of the value of the dog over that of any single lamb taken in exchange.

(v. טָפַח II), ט' רוחא conceitedness. Y. Yeb. XVI, 15 d פלוני אינו בעולם ט' רוחיה עליה ‘the man—is not in this world’, is not a clear testimony of death, as it may be interpreted, ‘his conceit came over him’.—V. תִּיפַּח.
, v. טָפַף II
, v. טפִּיטָא
, &c., v. sub. טפש'.
ch. = h. טִיפָּה. Nidd. 20 b ט' קמייתא the first dripping of menstruation. B. Kam. 98 a דט' דדמא וכ' an extravasation of a drop of blood took place in his ear.
Targ. II Kings XVI, 18 (h. text מיסך).
Targ. Jer. I, 13 טיקוס משיריתיה (v. טְקַס). Targ. Ez. XLIII, 10 (h. text תכנית). Ib. 13 (h. text גב); a. e.

טֵיקַס, טֵקַס, (preced.) banner, arrangement of troops, standard, division belonging to one standard (corresp. to h. דֶּגֶל). Targ. Num. II, 2; 3; a. fr. Y. ib. וטִיקְסֵיה וכ' and its banner was made of wool &c.— Pl. טִיקְסִין, טִיקְסַיָּא, טִקְ'. Ib. 17; a. fr.—Targ. Cant. VI, 4 ארבע טִקְסַיִךְ וכ' thy four divisions in the desert.—[Lam. R. to I, 5 טִיקְסַיָּה Ar., ed. טכס', v. טִיכְסָא].
— Pl. טִירִים, טִירִין. Macc. 10 a; Yalk. Deut. 921.
, Y. M. Kat. III, 83 c bot., בר ט', v. נְזִירָא II

sense.definition: , pl. טִירָאוֹת (v. טִירָה) places for augury, ( templum).
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 83 (play on מטרד, Gen. XXXVI, 39) שהיו מעמידין טיראות וכ' ‘Rashi’ (in ed. Wil. 1878; text טוּרָיוֹת) they put up auguries for idolatry, v. טוּר I; Yalk. ib. 140 טיריון (read: טִירָיוֹת.).
, Pesik. R. s. 10 באים עליהם ט', read: באים לעסק טירונין, v. טִירוֹן I
v. טִרְדָּא

sense.definition:
v. Ez. XLVI,
23; טור or נטר) guard, trnsf. surrounding of an oven, brick-work.
sense.notes: Kel. V, 3 טִירַת התנור. Tosef. ib., B. Kam. IV, 3 חפר … להן ט' if he made a guard around them by digging in the ground. Ib. טִירַת כירה (Kel. l. c. עטרת), v. כִּירָה. Ib. הרי הן כט' (Var. corrupt קטירה) are in ritual law like &c.
, v. next w.
Lev. R. s. 18, end בו"ד גוזר ט' וכ' (not טירודא) a human authority decrees banishment, so does the Lord (to the leper). Gen. R. s. 2, beg.; Yalk. ib. 4. [Num. R. s. 7, v. טָרַד.]

sense.definition: (tiro, τίρων) young soldier, trnsf. beginner, novice.
sense.notes: Ex. R. s. 3, beg. ט' היה וכ' Moses was a novice in prophecy. Y. Erub. V, beg. 22 b (ref. to I Kings XVII, 1, where Elijah is for the first time mentioned as a prophet and yet says, ‘the Lord before whom I stood’) והלא אלי' ט' לנבואה היה (not טירונין לנביאים) was not Elijah at that time a novice &c.?— Pl. טִירוֹנִין. Tanḥ. Ki Thissa 1 לעסק ט' Ar. (ed. טרופין, corr. acc.) for the levy of soldiers; Pesik. R. s. 10 עליהם טירבוס (corr. acc.).

sense.definition: , pl. טִירוֹנִין (טוּר or נטר, cmp. טוּרָנָא, v. טִיר) guards of observation.
sense.notes: Lam. R. introd. (R. Josh. 2) ט' (expl. כרים על שערים, Ez. XXI, 27; Koh. R. to XII, 8 כרקומין).
pl. טִירוֹנִין. Targ. Y. Num. XXXI, 10 טִירוֹנֵיהוֹן (h. text טִירֹתָם).
— Pl. טִירוּנִין. Targ. Y. Deut. XX, 1 (synonym. with גֵּיוְתָנִין).

sense.definition: (tironia, a denom. of tiron, not otherwise recorded) levy of soldiers.
sense.notes: Cant. R. to II, 8; Gen. R. s. 42; s. 70 שמכתבת ט' וכ' which writes out a levy from all nations. [Ib. s. 88 שכותבת ט' Ar., ed. שמכתבת טרימוסיאה; Yalk. ib. 147 טירני, prob. a corrupt. of טְרִיבּוּטָא (tribute) tributes.]

sense.definition: (τυραννία) sovereignty, absolute rule, usurpation (corresp. to h. זְרוֹעַ).
sense.notes: Y. Yeb. VIII, 9 d top; Y. Kidd. IV, 65 d bot. עיקר ט' וכ' the principal designation of their (the priests’) usurpation lies in the words (Hos. IV, 4). Pesik. R. s. 15; Pesik. Haḥod. p. 52 b; Lev. R. s. 23, beg. (ref. to בזרוע, Ps. LXXVII, 16) בטר' with imperial power. Y. Maas. Sh. V, end, 56 d אלו שהן באין בט' לפני וכ' those who come before the Lord with power (interch. with בזרוע). Ab. Zar. 3 a אין הקב"ה בא בט'וכ' the Lord does not deal despotically with his creatures. Yalk. Deut. 945 היה עולה אצל אביו בט' (Ruth R. introd. במרוצה) came to his father with arrogance.

Ber. V, 4 (34 a) מפני הטי' because he might become confused (and be unable to resume his prayers); Deut. R. s. 7, beg.—Cant. R. to VIII, 13 בט' הדעת in confusion (not in concert).—Tanḥ. Mick. 2 נטרף טרוף אחד had only one trouble (about the interpretation of his dream).— Pl. טֵירוּפִין, טֵר'. Ib. נטרף שני ט' had two troubles (not knowing even the dream).—Sifré Deut. 296 (ref. to בדרך, Deut. XXV, 17) בשעת טֵיוּפֵיכֶם when you were in a state of disorder.
Gen. R. s. 15; Midr. Till. to Ps. CXXXIX (omitt. in ed. Bub.); Yalk. ib. 887 טֵירוּפִי מתוכה my banishment from Eden.
, v. טַרְחוּת

sense.definition: (טרי) the shaking movement of the mill.
sense.notes: B. Bath. 18 a (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 50). Ib. 20 b.—V. טַרְיָיתָא.

Sifré Num. 157; Yalk. ib. 785 (play on טירתם, Num. XXXI, 10) מקום שהיו בט' the place where they were in trouble (fear of the enemy).—[Yalk. Gen. 140, v. טִירָא.—Y. Taan. II, 66 a יום ט', v. טְרָיָינוֹס.]
, v. טִירָא
, v. טִירְיָא
, v. טִירְיָנָא
Ab. Zar. 11 b (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note); Y. ib. I, 39 c תִּירְיַיסְקֵי a Median festival

sense.definition: (Pers. tiryân, Lag.; v. P. Sm. 1508) basket.
sense.notes: Pes. 88 a (Ms. M. טידיי', read טיר'; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note; Taan. 9 b צנא).
, Esth. R. to I, 2 כטירכי מרכבתו, a corrupt tautography; read: כמרכבתו, v. מֶרְכָּבָה
, v. טרים

sense.definition: Tirnaah, surname of one R. Ḥãnina.
sense.notes: Kerith. 9 a; (Ned. 57 b תְּרִיתָאָה; ib. 59 b תִּירְתָּאָה; Y. Peah II, 17 d תורתייה; Y. Kidd. I, 60 c bot. תִּרְתָּיָיה; Y. Ber. III, 6 d תִּרְתָּיָה).
, v. טַרְסָאָה

sense.definition: (טְרַף) document conferring the right of seizure of a debtor’s property sold after the loan, v. אַדְרַכְתָּא.
sense.notes: B. Bath. 169 a כל ט' וכ' a tirpa which fails to contain the words, ‘We have torn the note of indebtedness’ &c. B. Kam. 9 a אחוי טִירְפָּךְ וכ' show thy t., and I shall pay thee. Keth. 95 a top.
v. טָפַס
, v. טְרַקְסִין
Targ. Prov. XXI, 14.
Targ. Ps. XL, 3.

sense.definition: Teth, name of the ninth letter of the Alphabet.
sense.notes: Maas. Sh. IV, 11 טי"ת טבל Y. ed. (Mish. a. Bab. ed. ט') if the vessel is marked Teth, it means Tebel (טֶבֶל). V. ט'.
, v. תַּכְתַּקָּא
, v. טִיכְנִי

sense.definition: (cmp. דָּכַס) to stamp, tread upon, press.
sense.notes: Cant. R. to III, 7 [read:] היו רואין שבע מחיצות של אש טוֹכְסוֹת וכ' they saw seven partitions of fire one pressing the other; Midr. Sam. ch. XVII טונסות (corr. acc.); (Yalk. Ex. 362; Yalk. Ps. 795 נוצצות; Num. R. s. 11, Pesik. R. s. 15, Pesik. Haḥod., p. 45 a, v. כָּסַס).
—Part. pass. מְטוּכָּס filled up. Midr. Till. to Ps. XC, 2 מקום מט' a filled up place, mound (v. טִיכּוּס, טִיכְסָא).

sense.definition: (v. next w.) to equip, v. טָקַס.

sense.notes: טַכֵּיס
Targ. Y. Lev. XVI, 4 [read:] יְטַכֵּיס.

sense.definition: (corresp. to b. h. אָסַר) to fasten, to harness and load.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Ex. XXVIII, 28. Targ. Y. I Deut. XXXIV, 8 (ed. Amst. טְכִיסוּ Pe.).—Part. pass. מְטַכַּס harnessed, equipped. Targ. Y. II Gen. XLIX, 19. Targ. II Esth. VI, 10 (some ed. מִיטּ' Ithpa.), v. טְקַס.—V. טִיכּוּסָא.
, v. טִיכְ'
, Lev. R. s. 12, beg., quot. in Ar., expl. תקנה, prob. meant for next w.; missing in eds.
, v. next w.

sense.definition: (τάξις; inflected like a native word, formed like עָצִיץ, as if fr. טכס) order, array, order of battle; arrangement.
sense.notes: Pesik. Vayhi, p. 66 b בט' מלכים Ar. (ed. … בטכסיסי של, read: בטַכְסִיסִין, pl.) in the order in which kings go to war; Tanḥ. Bo. 4 כטקסין של וכ'; ed. Bub. ib. 4 בטכסיס מלך וכ'; Pesik R. S. 17 בטַכְסִיסֵי מלכים (pl. constr.). Cant. R. to IV, 12 בטק' המלכים in the order of a royal (regular) army. Ex. R. s. 8, end בט' הזה הבא וכ' in this consecutive order bring &c.; Tanḥ. Vaëra 9 בטקסין הזה הביא (corr. acc.). Midr. Till. to Ps. XC בט' של נבואה under the order of prophecy. Num. R. s. 15 בט' גְּדוּלָּה (not בטקסים) in the array of power (arrogating power to themselves); Tanḥ. B’haãl. 14 בטקסים גדולים (corr. acc.). Ib. B’midb. 12 יש להם טכסין מן יעקב אביהן they have a traditional order from the way their father Jacob arranged his funeral escort; ed. Bub. ib. 12 יש בידן טכסיס אביהן. Cant. R. to II, 4 טקסים של מעלה (read … ס) the heavenly array; a. v. fr.—2) (fem.) garrison. Y. Ab. Zar. I 39 c, הדא טק' דקסרין the garrison of Caesarea, v. דּוּקִים.— Pl. טַכְסִיסִין, טַקְ', constr. טַכְסִיסֵי, טַקְ'. Sabb. 31 a ט' מלכות court ceremonial. Pesik. R. s. 17, a. e., v. supra.
, v. סַטְכַּת

Taan. 3 a בטל וברוחות וכ' as to mentioning dew and winds in the prayer &c.—Ib. b טל דברכה a fructifying dew; a. fr.— Pl. טְלָלִים, טְלָלֵין. Ḥag. 12 b עליית ט' the upper chamber (store) of dews, v. אֲגָלִים. Lev. R. s. 28 ט' קשים injurious dews; a. fr.
Targ. Is. XVIII, 4. Targ. O. Gen. XXVII, 28; a. fr.— Pl. טַלִּין. Targ. Y. Gen. l. c.; a. e.
, v. טלי.—[Targ. Y. Lev. XVI, 27, v. טַלְיָא.]

sense.definition: a piece of cloth used as blanket.
sense.notes: Succ. 17 b ראוי לט' על וכ' Ms. M. a. Ar. (ed. ליטלו) fit for a blanket over an ass.
Ber. 43 b ט' על גבי ט' patch upon patch. V. טְלָיוֹת.
Kidd. 70 b (prob. a nickname, v. בְּלָאֵי).
Ḥag. 9 b בקרו ט' examine the lamb, v. בָּקַר; a. e.— Pl. טְלָאִים, טְלָיִים. Y. Ber. IV, 7 b top ט' מבוקרים, v. בָּקַר. Ib.; Tam. III, 3 לשכת הט' the (Temple) store for daily offerings; a. e.
m. = טָלֵי. Targ. Y. Gen. XXXVII, 2 (ed. Amst. טלח, corr. acc.)
Targ. Y. Deut. VII, 14 (prob. to be read טְלָיֵי).
, Targ. Y. Num. VI, 24. read טְלָנֵי.
[טְלוּלַיָּא, v. טִלְטוּלַיָּא.]
Targ. Ps. VII, 4 (Ms. טול'). Ib. LXII, 11 (Var. טְלִי', טִילְ'); a. fr.— Pl. טְלוּמַיָּא. Targ. Prov. XXVIII, 16 (ed. Wil. טול').
Targ. Ps. X, 3 (some ed. incorr. טְלוּ'); a. fr.— Pl. טָלוֹמַיָּא, טַלּוֹ'. Ib. XVIII, 5.
Targ. Prov. XXIX, 25 (v. Pesh., h. text חרדת!).
Targ. Gen. XXV, 34; a. e.—Ab. Zar. 38 b ט' דחלא, ט' דמיא lentils boiled in vinegar, … in water. Yeb. 63 b; Yalk. Koh. 976 טַפְלוֹחָאִי; a. fr.

sense.definition: (cmp. Lat. lenticula) a trough in the wine or oil press (h. עדשה).
sense.notes: B. Bath. 67 b, expl. יָם (v. עֲדַשָּׁה).
, Targ. II Esth. II, 7 וט' some ed., read: בטַלְיוּתָהּ, v. טַלְיוּ
אַטְלַח (= טלע) to halt. Targ. Y. Gen. XXXII, 32 (some ed. אטלע). [Targ. Y. ib. XXXVII, 2, v. טָלֵה.]
Sabb. 43 b ט' מן הצד moving a thing sideways (in an unusual manner); a. fr.
Lev. R. s. 5 (ref. to Is. XXII, 17) ט' אחר ט' repeated migration from land to land. Gen. R. s. 39 (expl. נְדֹד, B. LV, 8), v. נִדְנוּד.
Targ. Job XVI, 5 (h. text ניד).

Targ. Is. XXII, 17. Targ. Ps. XVIII, 19 (h. text איד).—Ib. LVI, 9 (some ed. pl.; h. text נ̇ד); a. fr.—טִלְטוּלִין, טִלְטוּלֵי, טִילְ'. Keth. 28 a (ref. to Is. XXII, 17) ט' דגברא קשין וכ' the sufferings of homelessness are harder on man than on woman; (Snh. 26 a; Yalk. Is. 280 sing.).
— Pl. טַלְטוּלִין. Targ. Lam. III, 45 (h. text סחי).
Targ. Is. III, 21 (Ar. טְלוּלַיָּא, טִילּוּלַ'; h. text נזמי האף).
of טלל, cmp. דלדל)
Sabb. III, 6 מְטַלְטְלִין וכ' you may handle (on the Sabbath) a new lamp; a. v. fr.

sense.definition: to make unsteady, to exile; (with דעת) to confound.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 39 טַלְטֵל עצמך וכ' banish thyself (travel) from place to place. Ib. s. 38 (expl. הניעמו, Ps. LIX, 12) טַלְטְלֵימוֹ make them exiles. Y. Peah I, 15 d top (expl. נעו, Prov. V, 6) טי' הקב"ה מתן וכ' the Lord made unsteady (irregular) the reward of the observants, that they might observe the commands in faith. Num. R. s. 10 (ed. Amst. p. 238 a) שהן מְטַלְטְלִין דעתו וכ' they (carnal pleasures) confound man’s judgment (cmp. טָרַף).—Part. pass. מְטוּלְטָל, f. מְטוּלְטֶלֶת. Tanḥ. ed. Bub., Sh’mini 7 והדעת מט' and the mind becomes confused.—
נִתְטַלְטֵל, נִיטַּ'

sense.definition: to be moved, handled; to be made restless.
sense.notes: Sabb. l. c. כל הנרות מִטַּלְטְלִין all lamps may be handled. Ib. 35 a מעיין הַמִיטַּלְטֵל a travelling spring (changing its place). Gen. R. s. 39. Sifra Sh’mini ch. VII, Par. 6 מִטַּלְטְלִין במלואם are carried with their contents; Kel. XV, 1 עשויין לִיטַּלְטֵל וכ'. Yalk. Prov. 964; Midr. Prov. to XXX, 27 Alexander the Macedonian שנ' בכל וכ' who in his unrest drove all over the world like a locust &c.; a. fr.—V. מִטַּלְטְלִין.
Tanḥ. Sh’mini 5 נִתְטַלְטְלָה דעתו וכ' his mind is confused, and he knows not what he is talking &c. Ib. כדי שלא תִטַּלְטֵל דעתו in order that he may not get mixed up; a. e.
. Targ. Ps. XXII, 8; CIX, 25; a. fr.

sense.definition: to exile, Targ. Deut. XXIX, 27; a. fr. Part.
sense.notes: pass. מְטַלְטַל. Targ. Gen. IV, 12; 14; a. fr.

Targ. Y. Ex. XVI, 29 (cmp. Erub. 17 b).—Sabb. 45 a לטַלְטוּלֵי שרגא וכ' to remove the light of Ḥanuckah, v. חַבָּרָא. Pes. 69 a טלטולי בעלמא הוה it is merely a moving (no creative labor). Sabb. 49 a לא מְטַלְטְלִינָן להו we must not handle them.—Y. Snh. VI, 23 c bot.; Y. Ḥag. II, 77 d bot. וִיטַלְטְלִינָהּ מן וכ' and shall lift her off the ground. Ib., sq. טַלְטְלַתְנֵיה וכ' as soon as thou liftest him off &c., he can do nothing; a. fr.
. Targ. Lam. IV, 14. Targ. Ps. LXVIII, 13.

sense.definition: to be unsteady, to be moved, to be movable.
sense.notes: Targ. Prov. V, 6.—Y. Lev. XXV, 14 עסקא דמִיטַּלְטְלָא movable chattel.—B. Bath. 150 a כל דְּמִטַּלְטַל (or דַּמְ') whatever is movable; a. fr.

sense.definition: to hang on, to patch, line.
sense.notes: Kel. XXVI, 2 טלא עליו וכ' Ar. (Mish. ed. טלה, Talm. ed. טִילָּה), v. מַטְלִית. Ib. XXVII, 6 שטְלָיָיהּ וכ' which he put on &c. Y. Meg. I, 71 d top וטוֹלִין, v. מַטְלִית. Ḥull. 122 b שטְלָאָהּ לקופתו which he hanged over his basket. Gitt. 45 b ט' עליהן עור covered them with a leather casing.
same, v. supra. Part. pass. מְטוּלָּא, pl. מְטוּלָּאִים. Ber. 43 b, a. fr. מנעלים המט' patched shoes; v. טְלָאי.
Koh. R. to IX, 5 טְלִי טליתיך lift up thy cloak (Ber. 18 a דלי־).—[

sense.definition: (preced. wds.) hanging, covering, esp. table outfit, linen.
sense.notes: — Pl. טֵלִים, constr. טְלֵי. Keth. 68 a top, will you dine בט' כסף או בט' זהב with the silver outfit, i.e. with the outfit used in connection with silver vessels, or with the gold outfit?—B. Mets. 78 b has the worm come בט' כסף או בט' זהב in the silver outfit (white linen) &c.?; cmp. אוֹלָרִין, חִימּוּצָתָא.

Targ. Y. Lev. XV. 2. Targ. Ps. XXXVII, 25. Targ. Y. Gen. XLI, 12; a. fr.—Targ. Y. Lev. XVI, 27 טָלָא.—B. Bath. 142 b, v. חוּלַּק. Y. Yeb. XII, 12 d bot. הוא ט' וכ' if he is young and she old. Lam. R. to I, 16 בגין דאית לי ט' וכ' (not טלאי) since I have a young slave &.; a. fr.—Yeb. 114 a top טלי וטליא boys and girls.— Pl. טָלַיָּא, טָלַיָּיא, טָלִין, טְלָאֵי. Targ. Joel II, 16. Targ. II Esth. I, 2 טָלִין וְטַלְיָין ed. Lag. boys and girls, v. supra.—Targ. Prov. I, 4; a. fr.—Sot. 33 a נצחו ט' the boys (sons of the Highpriest) have won the battle; Y. ib. IX, 24 b. Y. Meg. III, 74 a bot. טָלַיָּיה. Y. Ter. VIII, 46 b bot. טַלְיֵי דבי וכ' the boys of the Nasi’s house; a. fr.— Fem. v. טַלְיְתָא.
Targ. Y. Ex. I, 15.— Pl. as ab. Targ. Y. Gen. XXX, 40. Targ. Ps. CXVIII, 27.
Snh. 52 b, v. אִימַּרְתָּא.

Targ. Ps. LXXXVIII, 16 טליו Ms. (Levita טליותא, ed. טליא, incorr.). Targ. Job XXXVI, 14; a. fr.—Lev. R. s. 18, beg. Midr. Till. to Ps. IX מן ט' עד וכ' from childhood to old age.—Lam. R. to I, 16 young woman, v. טַלְיְתָא.
, v. טַלִּית
, v. טַלְיוּ
Targ. Y. II Gen. XLIX, 1 (Y. I טְלָנֵיתָא).
, v. טַלְיְתָא
, v. טְלוּמָא

sense.definition: , מערת ט' the Cave of T’limon, near the sea-shore of Judaea.
sense.notes: Y. Dem. II, 22 c (Hildesh. Beitr. p. 10 suggests סלימון).
Gitt. 28 a; B. Mets. 20 b (Ms. F. טלוקא, Ms. R. 1 טליסקא, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 400), v. גְּלוּסְקְמָא.

sense.definition: (טלל) cover, sheet, cloak (similar to the Roman pallium, Gr. φᾶρος).
sense.notes: Sabb. 147 a ט' מקופלת a cloak folded up and thrown over the shoulder. Men. 41 a ט' כפולה a double-sized sheet worn by doubling it. Sabb. 138 a ט' כפולה וכ' one must not make a tent on the Sabbath by spreading a double-sized sheet on poles so that the ends hang down. Kidd. 18 a sq. (ref. to בבגדו, Ex. XXI, 8) כיון שפירש טַלִּיתוֹ עליה since he spread his (bed-) sheet over her (v. בָּגַד).—Esp. Tallith, the cloak of honor, the scholar’s or officer’s distinction (adorned with fringes according to Num. XV, 38 sq.); the cloak of the leader in prayer. Num. R. s. 8, end שמלה זו ט' simlah (Deut. X, 18), that means the cloak to which the show-fringes are attached. Gen. R. s. 36 (ref. to השמלה, Gen. IX, 23) לפיכך זכה שם לט' וכ' therefore was Shem privileged to wear the Tallith &c. Ex. R. s. 27 נתמנה … ונטל ט' וכ' when one has been appointed to an office and has taken the T., he must not &c.; a. fr.— Pl. טַלִּיתוֹת, טַלִּיּוֹת. Sabb. 147 a ed. (Ms. M. sing.). Tanḥ. Korah 2; Num. R. s. 18, beg. ט' תכלת cloaks all of purple blue; Y. Snh. X, 27 d bot. טלויות, ed. Krot. טלוי' (corr. acc. or טַלִּיוֹת). Zab. IV, 5 עשר טליות וכ' if ten sheets are placed above one another. Ib. 7; Sabb. 93 a
Targ. Y. Ex. XXII, 26 (ed. Amst. טָלֵית, Var. טַלֵּת).
Koh. R. to IX, 5 טַלִּיתֵיה (Ber. 18 a תכלתיה). Ib. טלי טַלִּיתָיךְ, v. טְלֵי.

Targ. Y. Gen. XXXIV, 4 (ed. Amst. טַלְיָ'); a. fr.—Yeb. 114 a, v. טָלֵי.—Y. ib. XII, 12 d bot. היא ט' וכ' if she is young and he old. Lam. R. to I, 16 (v. טַלְיוּ).— Pl. טַלְיָתָא, טַלְיָי', טַלְיָין. Targ. II, Esth. I, 2 טלייתא ed. (ed. Lag. טליין). Targ. Prov. IX, 3 טלייתהא ed. Lag. (ed. Wil. טְלִיתָ', corr. acc.). Ib. XXXI, 15; a. fr.

sense.definition: to hang over, (of liquids) to form drops; v. טַל.
sense.notes: — Part. pass. טָלוּל, f. טְלוּלָה a) hanging. Y. Ab. Zar. IV, 44 a bot. [read:] שלא היתה שם טיפה אחת ט' that there should not have been there (in the vat) one drop hanging (which drops down on being touched or shaken). b) (with שנה, denom. of טַל) blessed with dew. Taan. 24 b; Y. Yoma V, 42 c top.; Lev. R. s. 20; Tanḥ. Aḥãre 3; ed. Bub. ib. 4, v. גָּשַׁם.

טַלֵּיל to make a טְלָלָא; to cover, screen. Targ. I Kings VI, 9 (h. text ספן). Targ. Y. Ex. XL, 21 (O. Af ; h. text ויסך). Ib. XXV, 20 מְטַלְלִין (O. מַטְּלִין); a. fr.—Succ. 31 a (a beam) דגזלה ומְטַלֵּל עלה Ms. M. (ed. דגזולה only) which one stole and put upon it the covering of the Succah, v. מְטַלַּלְתָּא.— Part. pass. מְטַלַּל, f. מְטַלְּלָא. B. Kam. 50 b משום דמט' because the cave is roofed. Ib. דלא מְטַלְּלֵי which are uncovered.—Trnsf. to obscure. Sabb. 78 a מסו ומְטַלְּלֵי they heal (the eye-sore) but dim the eye-sight.

sense.definition: same, same, to cover, v. supra. Targ. Is. IV, 5, sq.
sense.notes: , v. supra. Targ. Is. IV, 5, sq.; a. fr.
Dan. IV, 9.
Targ. Ps. LXVIII, 14 מִיטַּ' (some ed. מְט', v. supra). Targ. I Chr. II, 55.

טַלֵּיל, Af. אַטְלֵיל to play, sport, Succ. 53 a לוי הוה מְטַלֵּל וכ' Ar. (ed. מְטַיֵּיל, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 200) L. was sporting … with eight knives. B. Bath. 91 b נהירנא … מְטַלְּלִין וכ' Ar. (ed. מטיילין, Var. מְטַלִּין or מַטְּלִין, מְטַלְּיָין, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 40) I remember that boys and girls enjoyed themselves &c.
same. Kidd. 21 b אִיטְּלַלִיתוּ, v. איסְקוּנְדְּרֵי
Targ. Koh. VIII, 13 (some ed. טול). Ib. VI, 12. Targ. Ps. XCI, 1; a. fr.

sense.definition: (cmp. סכך, סֻכָּה, מָסָךְ) cover of twigs, reeds &c.; in gen. ceiling, cover, screen.
sense.notes: Targ. Ps. XXVII, 5; a. fr.—Ber. 19 a נפל קניא מט' (Ms. M. משמי ט') a reed fell down from the ceiling. Ib. 48 a אחוי לשמי ט' pointed up to the ceiling. B. Kam. 66 b מעיקרא כשורא והשתא ט' formerly it was named beam, now ceiling, v. מָרֵישׁ.— Pl. טְלָלַיָּא. Targ. Job XL, 21, sq. (h. text צאלים).

sense.definition: to bend, press, esp. (corresp. to h. עָשַׁק) to take undue advantage of, to oppress.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Lev. V, 21. Targ. Ps. CXIX, 122; a. fr.—Part. pass. טְלִים, (טְלוּם). Targ. Y. Deut. XXVIII, 33. Targ. Ps. CIII, 6 (some ed. incorr. טָלוֹ'); a. e.—Lev. R. s. 12 (ref. to Prov. XXIII, 35) טָלְמִין ליה וכ' they overcharge him (in his drunkenness), and he knows it not &c.
same. Targ. I Chr. XVI, 21.
, v. טוּלְמָא I
Koh. R. to V, 10. [Y. Snh. II, 20 c bot. מנהם טלמא, perh. מנחם טלמיא.]
, v. טוֹלְמִיסִין
Targ. Cant. III, 8. Ib. IV, 6. Targ. Koh. II, 5. Targ. Y. Num. VI, 24 טלוי (corr. acc.)
, v. טְלָיוּתָא

, Cant. R. to VII, 8 כמין ט', read: כמי נִילוֹס like the inundation of the Nile (so did the fire spread from the furnace when it was broken through); v. אוקיי. [The entire passage from כיצד to אוקיי belongs to VII, 9, after the words: מכאן שנפרץ הכבשן; v. פְּלַטְיָא.]

sense.definition: [ to hang over, incline,] to halt.

sense.notes: same. Targ. Gen. XXXII, 32, v. טְלַח. [Yeb. 39 b אַטְלַע לה רגליך וכ' turn thy right foot towards her ואטלע לה וכ' and he did so, Rashi; v. next w.]
Meg. 22 b; Taan 25 a; Succ. 53 a
Targ. Ruth IV, 7; 8 (h. text שלף). Targ. Lam. IV, 3 (h. text חלץ).

Targ. Y. Deut. XXIX, 4.—Yeb. 39 b אִיטְּלַע לה וכ' ed. (Ar. לך) have the shoe of thy right food untied (for her); ואַטְּלַע ליה וכ' Ar. and he loosened the shoe of …, and she took it off (ed. ואיט' לה and he had his shoe … loosened &c.); [other interpret., v. preced.].

sense.definition: c. (cmp. צלף) [ glittering, pealing,] hoof, esp. (b. h. פרסה) cloven foot.
sense.notes: Ex. R. s. 18 beg. B. Bath 75 b; Kidd. 22 b אחזה בטַלְפָהּ if he seized the animal by its hoof.— Du. טְלָפַיִים, טְלָפַיִם, טְלָפַיִין, pl. טְלָפִים (?), טְלָפוֹת. Bekh. 44 a; Tosef. Par. II (I), 2.—Par. II, 2 שקרניה וטְלָפֶיהָ וכ'; Bekh. l. c. שקרנים וטלפים (corr. acc.). Nidd. VI, 9 יש לו ט' has cloven feet. Ruth R. to III, 13 מטַלְפֵי סוסי by the hoofs of my horse (counting his steps, I know the distance); Koh. R. to VII, 8 (v. next w.).—Y. Snh. X, 28 d bot. ואין טְלָפֶיהָ סדוקות and are not her feet cloven (is she not clean for you, fit to be your wife)?—Midr. Till. to Ps. XVIII, 11 טַלְפוֹת סוסיהן וכ' the hoofs of their horses fell off; a. e. [Tosef. Ukts. II, 10 טלפין Var., v. מילפפון.]
ch.

sense.definition: same. Pl. טַלְפִין, טַלְפַיָיא, טַלְפֵי, טִילְ'.
sense.notes: Targ. Lev. XI, 3; a. fr.—Y. Ḥag. II, 77 b bot. מן ט' דסוסיי וכ by counting the steps of my horse &c., v. preced.—Denom. מְטַלַּף, מִיטְלַף, (מַטִּילְפָא) מַטְלַף with cloven foot, cloven. Targ. Lev. l. c.—Targ. O. Deut. XIV, 6; a. fr. (v. Berl. Targ. O. II, p. 34).

Ned. 66 b a Babylonian asked his Palestinean wife בשילי לי תרי טלפי cook for me two (a few) beans, בשילה ליה תרי טלפי and she cooked two feet (Rashi); [anoth. interpret.: she cooked for him just two beans and no more; marginal emendation בשילה ליה תרי טלפחי.]
, v. טְלוּפְחָא
, Y. Shek. VIII, beg. 51 a לט', read אפַּלְטֵירָא.

Targ. Ps. LV, 23; Targ. Lam. II, 1; a. fr. (h. text השליך).—Gen. R. s. 75 שלח … וטַלְקֵיה וכ' he took off the purple cloak and threw it down before him. Y. Yeb. XII, 12 d top; Y. Sabb. VI, 8 a bot. [read:] טלקיה לחנותא דחליטרא pitched it into a confectioner’s shop. [Targ. Y. II, Ex. XXI, 18, v. Ithpa.]

sense.definition: same, also to cast away, reject.
sense.notes: Targ. Ps. LI, 13 (ed. Lag. Pe.).—Y. Sabb. l. c. מְטַלֵּק לה; (Y. Yeb. l. c. מסלק). Y. Keth. XII, 35 a טליק גרמיה threw himself down; (Y. Kil. IX, 32 b top טְלַק); a. e.—Part. pass. מְטַלַּק. Targ. Y. Lev. XVII, 15.—Y. Snh. VII, end, 25 d דאינון מְטַלְּקִין בימא they have been thrown into the sea. Lam. R. to I, 1 רבתי (חד מאת' 3) מְטַלְּקָא, v. מְדוֹכָא.

sense.definition: to be thrown, to be cast away.
sense.notes: Targ. Job III, 4, v. אִטְלָקוּתָא. Targ. Y. II Ex. XXI, 18 [read:] ויִטַּלַּק, or ויִטְּלֵיק (h. text נפל). Targ. Ps. XXII, 11.—Y. Sot. V, 20 b bot. א' עלוי it was thrown upon him, i.e. a penalty was imposed &c.

sense.definition: (prob. dial. for טלל', טלל, cmp. Syr.
sense.notes: טלרא P. Sm. 1482) soldier’s iron shoe. Targ. I Kings II, 5 (h. text מנעל).
, v. טַלִּית ch.

sense.definition: (= טעמא, v. M. Kat. 18 a quot.
sense.notes: s. v. טַעֲמָא, a. T’shuboth G’onim ed. Cassel, p. 22 a) reason, argument (on the cause of grief), consolation.— Pl. טַמַּיָּא, or טָמַיָּא.—בֵּי ט' gathering of comforters around the mourner in his house or at the place of worship. Ber. 6 b אגרא דבי ט' וכ' (Ar. טמא, Tshub. G’onim l. c. טעמא) the merit of attending the mourner’s gathering lies in the silence (which must be observed until the mourner begins to speak). Snh. 113 a [read:] למשאל ביה ט' (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note), v. טַעֲמָא.

sense.definition: [ to be filled up, inaccesible,] to be unclean; v. טָמֵא II.
to make unclean, to soil, defile.
sense.notes: Yoma 39 a אדם מְטַמֵּא עצמו מעט מְטַמְּאִין וכ' if a man begins to defile himself a little (through sin), he will soon be defiled largely. Yad. III, 5, a. fr. מט' את הידים their handling makes the hands unclean (washing the hands is required after handling them). Kel. I, 1; a. v. fr.
Toh. VI, 2. Eduy I, 11; a. v. fr.—Makhsh. VI, 2 טִימְּאוּ; Y. Dem. V, 24 d טִימּוּ.
הִתְטַמֵּא, הִיטַּמֵּא

definition.italic: to become unclean, to be made unclean.

sense.notes: Ukts. I, 1 מְטַמֵּא ומִיטַּמֵּא eventually makes unclean and becomes unclean. Kel. II, 1 מִיתְטַמְּאִין וכ' (ed. Dehr. מִיטַּ') are fit to become unclean and to make unclean. Ib. ומיט' מאחוריהן ואינן מיט' וכ' Mish. ed. (Talm. ed. מִטַּ') may be made unclean through their backs (touching uncleanness), &c. Ib. VI, 4 ונִטְמְאוּ and which became unclean; a. v. fr.—Yoma 38 b [read:] בא לִטַּמֵּא פְּתָחִין לו (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) to him who is willing to defile himself, doors are open; Sabb. 104 a; Ab. Zar. 55 a; Men. 29 b

sense.definition: to make one’s self unclean by handling a corpse &c. (v. Lev. XXI, 1, sq.).
sense.notes: Yeb. 60 a מִטַּמֵּא לה he (the priest) may attend to her burial; a. fr.
v. טְמִי

sense.definition: v. preced. art.) unclean, levitically impure, forbidden.
sense.notes: Kel. XII, 2 המחובר לט' ט' whatever is attached to an object which is fit to become unclean, may become unclean. Ib. 1 טבעת אדם ט' a ring used by man may eventually become unclean; a. v. fr.—Ḥull. VII, 5 דג ט' a fish forbidden to eat. Ib. 6 (בהמה) ט' a forbidden animal; a. v. fr.—Ab. Zar. 39 a (referring to ‘the ass of the sea’, v. חֲמָר, a. ‘the ox of the sea’, v. תּוֹרָא) ט' טהור טהור ט' what is unclean (on land) is clean (in water) &c.—טְמֵא מת = b. h. טָ' למת, one made unclean through a corpse. Pes. 19 b; a. fr.— Pl. טְמֵאִים, טְמֵאִין; f. טְמֵאוֹת. Ḥull. VIII, 6. Pes. 17 a. Kel. XI, 8; a. v. fr.—טְמֵאֵי מתים, v. supra. Pes. 66 b; a. fr.
v. טְמֵי
Esth. R. to I, 4, v. גְּרָאפָא.
Ab. Zar. 39 a (Ms. M. טמו ביריא, v. Neub. Géogr. p. 392).
, v. preced.
, v. טוֹמוֹס
Targ. Ps. CIV, 19 טְמוֹעֵיה (Ms. טַמּוּ').
Targ. Ps. XXXII, 7. Targ. Job XXII, 14 ed. Lag. (ed. טְמִיר, טַמִּיר). [Targ. Ps. XIX, 13 טמורות ed. Lag., v. טְמִיר.]
, v. sub טִימ'.
, v. טָמִיר
, v. טִימְ'
, v. טְמַם

sense.definition: = h. טָמֵא, to be, become unclean.
sense.notes: Targ. Ps. CVI, 39 טְמִיאוּ (some ed. incorr. טַמִּי').

Targ. Y. II Num. XII, 12.—Targ. Mic. II, 10 בדיל לטַמָּיוּתָהּ ed. Lag. (ed. בדיל ט' corr. acc.) in order to defile her.—Ḥull. 3 a לטַמְּיֵיה וטַמִּיתֵיה לבשר … the person will make the knife unclean and then the knife will make the flesh unclean. Pes. 79 a דבשר הוא דמְטַמְּיָא ליה וכ' which affects only the flesh, but not the person. (Ms. M. דמִיטַּמֵּי … מִיטַּמְּאֵי, Ithpe.). Ib. 67 b טַמּוּיֵי מְטַמֵּי makes unclean; a. fr.
Ḥull. 2 b; a. e.
(preced.) unclean. Targ. Num. V, 2, a. fr. ט' נפשא, v. טָמֵא II.—Pl. f. טַמְיַין. Targ. Y. Deut. XIV, 4 [read:] עִיבּוּרֵי ט' (v. Bekh. 7 a) offsprings of unclean mothers.

— Pl. טְמַיָּא, (טִימַיָּא). אובא ט', v. אוֹב ch.—שחיק ט' (an imprecation) whose bones be ground to dust. Lev. R. s. 25; a. fr.—[Tosef. Ohol. XVII, 3 מלוא טימיא, v. לָטוֹמְיָא.]—שׁוּם טְמַיָּא pr. n. pl. Shum T’mayya, in Babylonia. B. Bath. 153 a (Ms. M. שוטמי'; oth. Verss. v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note).
, v. טַמָּא
, v. next w.

Lev. R. s. 19 מכניס ממונם לט' confiscated their property for the fiscus. Ib. s. 11, a. e. גבאי ט' tax collector; Ruth R. introd. end טַמִיאוֹן (insert גבאי). Gen. R. s. 61 עד שנמצאת ארץ מצרים לטי' until it was found by calculation that the entire land of Egypt would be forfeited to the treasury (for its indebtedness to the Jews); Yalk. ib. 110; (Meg. Taan. ch. III עד שהיתה מצרים שלהם). Gen. R. s. 51 תשרף מן ט' shall be set on fire at public expense; a. fr.—Esth. R. to I, 2 טיטיון, read טימ', v. טַמְיָקוֹן.

sense.definition: (טָמַן) a place for chafing dishes, contrad. to כירה cooking stove.
sense.notes: Y. Sabb. IV, end, 7 a

sense.definition: (ταμιακός, tamiacus) belonging to the imperial treasury, tamiaca ( praedia), crown-lands, imperial domains.
sense.notes: Esth. R. introd. אתם ט' אתם you are crown property (God’s own people); הלוקח לו עבד מן הט' שוב וכ' (read של בשר ודם, abbr. של ב"ו, for שוב) does not he who takes to himself a slave from the crown lands forfeit his life? Ib. (ref. to Esth. VIII, 7) על דפשט ידיה בט' because he stretched forth his hand against crown property (the Jews).

m. (variously corrupted) same. Pesik. Vayhi, p. 7 b הן דמלכא שרי ט' where the king resides (in the seventh heaven) there is the crown property (which must not be desecrated by symbolical representations); Num. R. s. 12; Cant. R. to VI, 4; [Esth. R. to I, 2 טיטיון, v. טַמְיוֹן.]

sense.definition: c. (טְמַר, v. טְמוֹר) hidden, secret; (also as noun) secrecy.
sense.notes: Targ. I Sam. X, 22. Ib. XXI, 3 (h. text אלמני); a. fr.—עבד ט' to live hidden. Y. Shebi. VIII, 38 b top. Y. Dem. I, 21 d bot. עבדת טמירה גבן (not טמו'), was hidden with them; Y. Shek. V, 48 d top טמירא.— Pl. טְמִירִין, f. טְמִירָן, טְמִירָתָא. Targ. Josh. VII, 21. Targ. Ps. XLIV, 22. Ib. XIX, 13 (ed. Lag. טמורות). Targ. Gen. XLI, 45 (v. Berl. Targ. O. II, p. 15).

sense.definition: (v. טָמֵא I) to fill up, stop.
sense.notes: Sabb. 73 b; 81 b טְמָמָהּ filled it up. V. טוּם.

Targ. O. Gen. XXVI, 15; 18 טַמּוֹנוּן (ed. Berl. טָמוּנִין; Y. טמונינון, corr. acc.). Targ. II Kings III, 19.—Gitt. 68 a וטַמִּינְהוּ and filled the pits up. Yeb. 63 a טוֹם וכ' fill up a hole in the wall (in time) &c.—Part. pass. טְמִים, טְמִימָא. M. Kat. 4 b למיכרא נהרא ט' to dig up a channel the source of which is choked up.
Meg. 27 b דתִיטּוֹם בשיראי that thou be buried in silk. Ib. עד דא' וכ' until he was covered up with the silk garments (put upon him while he was asleep).
Targ. Jud. III, 22 (h. text סגר). Targ. Y. Deut. XXIX, 3. Targ. Is. VI, 10 טמטם ed. Lag. (ed. עמעם, corr. acc.); a. e.—Part. pass. מְטַמְטַם. Ib. XLIV, 18.
Ib. XXXII, 3. Targ. Ps. CXIX, 70 Regia (ed. איטפש).

sense.definition: cmp. preced.) to hide, store away, preserve, esp. to keep dishes warm for the Sabbath.
sense.notes: Sabb. II, 7 טוֹמְנִין את החמין you may put warm dishes in the chafing stove &c. Ib. IV, 1; a. fr.—Makhsh. I, 6 הטומן פירותיו וכ' if one hides his fruits in water against thieves.—Koh. R. to X, 8 שהוא ט' וכ' that he buried it there; a. e.—Part. pass. טָמוּן. B. Kam. 5 b, a. e. נזקי ט' באש damage caused to things hidden in a pile to which fire was set. Gen. R. s. 68 היה ט' וכ' he (Jacob) was hiding (before Esau) in the house of Eber; Meg. 17 a מוּטְמָן (Ms. M. נטמן, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note); a. fr.

sense.definition: to be hidden, to hide one’s self, to be stored up.
sense.notes: Ib. שנ' בבית עבר, v. supra. Lev. R. s. 3 ויִטָּמְנוּ ד"ת בפיך and the words of the Law shall be stored up in thy mouth. Pesik. R. s. 4 נ' במערה sought protection in a cave; a. e.

B. Kam. 61 b שדרכם להַטְמִין וכ' which it is customary to hide in the stack. B. Mets. 61 b לא יַטְמִין … במלח he must not keep his weights in salt (by which they gain in weight); a. fr.—Part. pass. מוּטְמָן, v. supra.

sense.definition: to hide one’s self, lie in wait.
sense.notes: B. Kam. 79 b ראוהו שה' וכ' if he has been seen hiding himself in the woods (waiting for a chance to steal).
Targ. Job XIV, 13 Ms. (ed. טשא). [Targ. Esth. V, 14 נטמון, Buxt., some ed. נטמא, נדמון, read with ed. Lag.: נרמי, נרמון.—Targ. Y. Gen. XXVI, 15; 18, v. טְמַם.]
, Y. Dem. II, end, 23 a, read: נוּמִּין, v. לוּמָּא

sense.definition: , (cmp. טָמַן) to hide, sink (cmp. טָבַע I).
to be hidden, sunk, to be mixed up beyond recognition.
sense.notes: Kidd. 70 b וכולן נִטְמְעוּ בכהונה and all of them have been lost among the priesthood (can no longer be distinguished from original priests). Ib. 71 a a family שנִיטְמְעָה נ' (or שנִיטַּמְּעָה Nithpa.) once mixed with Israelites beyond traces of genealogical disabilities, shall remain so (shall not be traced up). Keth. 14 b, v. עִיסָה; a. e.
Targ. Lam. II, 9 (h. text טבע). Targ. Y. Num. XXVI, 11. Targ. Ps. LXIX, 3; a. e.
. Targ. Y. Gen. XV, 17; a. fr.

Targ. Y. Ex. XV, 4; 12. Targ. Job XXXI, 33; a. e.— Part. pass. טְמִיעַ a) hidden, buried. Ib. III, 16 (h. text טמון); a. e.—b) darkened, obscured. ט' מזלא one whose planet is obscured, hapless fellow. Koh. R. to VII, 15. Ib. XI, 9; a. e.

sense.definition: (cmp. טמם) to be inaccessible to argument, to be dull.
sense.notes: Targ. Job XVIII, 3 טְמַעְנָא (not טִ'; Ms. Var. אִיטַּנַּפְנָא, v. טְנַף; h. text נטמינו).
Ib. XL, 13 Ms. (ed. Pe.)
Targ. Job XXXVIII, 6 Ms. (ed. טְמִיעָן).
Targ. Gen. XXXV, 4 (h. text טמן); a. fr.—Part. pass. טָמִיר q. v.
אַטְמַר to hide, withhold, keep removed. Targ. Is. XXIX, 10. Targ. Ex. II, 2; a. e.—Part. pass. מְטַמַּר, v. infra.

sense.definition: to be hidden, hide one’s self.
sense.notes: Targ. Gen. III, 8; a. fr.—B. Kam. 57 a כיון דמִיטְּמַר וכ' when he hides himself from people; ib. 79 b דקא מִטַּמַּר מינייהו Ms. M. (ed. מטמרי, incorr.; Ms. H. מיטמר). Ib. מִטַּמְּרֵי אִיטַּמּוּרֵי; a. e.—Gitt. 56 b מילי דמִטַּמְּרָן (or דמְטַמְּרָן, v. supra) hidden treasures.—[Tosef. Sabb. XVII (XVIII), 19 ואין מטמרין אותו, ed. Zuck., a corrupt tautography of אין משמרין אותו.]

sense.definition: (cmp. preced.; corresp. to h. טבל) to dip, immerse.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Ex. XII, 22; a. fr.—Part. pass. טְמִישׁ. Targ. Ps. LXXX, 6 (not טַמִּ').

Targ. Ruth II, 14 (ed. Amst. Pe.); a. fr.—Snh. 110 a bot. וטַמְּשֵׁיה במיא Ar. (ed. ואמשייה מייא) and dipped it in water. B. Bath. 74 a וטמשיה Ar. (ed. אמשינה, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 6). Gitt. 69 a ונִיטמֵּישׁ וכ' (or ונִיטְמִישׁ) and let him dip them &c.; a. e.— Part. pass. מְטַמַּשׁ bathed, washed. Targ. Job XXIV, 8 (ed. Wil. מִטַ' Ithpa.).
Targ. Ps. LX, 10.—Succ. 10 b אִיטְּמִישָׁא ליה וכ' (Ms. M. אשתמיטא, cler. error for אִתְטְמִישָׁא) his garment became soaked with water.
, Lam. R. to I, 17, read טרשא, v. טְרַשׁ II
, v. טַנְדּוּ
, v. טְנִי
, v. טְנָנָא

sense.definition: (טבר, v. טִיבּוּר, cmp. טַבְלָא I) tamburine, taborin.
sense.notes: Sot. 49 b

sense.definition: (= טְעַן דֵּו, v. דֵּיו; cmp. טוּנָא I) adv. with a load of grief, in trouble.

sense.notes: , v. טינדיסין
, Pirké d’R. El. ch. XLI כט', v. טוֹרוּס
, v. טִינּ'

sense.definition: the second element of the word שַׁעַטְנֵז, phonetically representing ט̇וי, the act of spinning, and נֹוזֹ, the act of weaving.
sense.notes: Y. Kel. IX, end, 32 d, v. שַׁעַטְנֵז.
Tam. III, 6, v. תַּרְקַב. Ib. 9.

Kel. XII, 3 כסוי ט' וכ' the metal cover of a box; של רופאים physicians’ medicine box. Ib. XIV, 6; XVI, 7; Tosef. ib., B. Mets. II, 9 כסיטנא (corr. acc.); ib. IV, 11.—Y. Sot. IX, 24 b bot. לתוך ט' וכ'; Bab. ib. 48 b בט' Ar. (ed. אִיטְּנִי q. v.) into a box made of lead and filled with barley husks.
, v. טַאֲנֵיס
, v. טְנַף
, Y. Kil. IX, 32 c top, read: מנכי, v. נְכֵי

sense.definition: (cmp. טִין) to be moistened and softened, (of grains) to be easily pealed in grinding.
sense.notes: Makhsh. III, 4 וטָנְנוּ and the wheat grew prepared for grinding. [Tanḥ. Vayiggash 9 טננתה some ed., read טִגַּ'.]
Makhsh. l. c. המְטַנֵּן בחול if one prepares wheat by mixing with sand; ib. 5 המט' בטיט וכ' with dried clay.—Part. pass. מְטוּנָּן, f. מְטוּנֶּנֶת. M. Kat. 6 b שדה מ' moist and fat soil, opp. גריד.

same. Makhsh. l. c. מְטִינִּים בחול (or מֵטִינִ' fr. טין). Ib. 5 לְהָטֵן Mish. ed. (Talm. ed. להָטֵל fr. טָלַל). Tosef. ib. II, 2 להטיח ed. Zuck. (Var. להָטֵין). Tosef. Shebi V, 16 (twice) להטיל (Var. להטין), (once) להטין; Y. ib. VII, beg., 37 b מהו לחטן בחוטין (read: להָטֵן בו חטין); ib. (repeatedly) לחטן (corr. acc.).
Targ. Job III, 5 (h. text גאל, Regia יטנפ').

sense.definition: (cmp. our to drivel, Germ, geifern) to be jealous, zealous, agitated (corresp. to h. קנא).
sense.notes: Targ. Ps. LXXIII, 3. Targ. Prov. III, 31; a. fr.
Y. Pes. VII, 30 a top מְטַנְּנָה אסור to mix the wheat with moist sand is forbidden, v. preced.

sense.definition: to be jealous &c. Targ. Ps. XXXVII, 1 תְטַנֵּין Ms. (ed. תִטְנֵין.
sense.notes: Pe., תַטְנֵין Af.). Targ. Job XXXVI, 33 מְטַנְנִין וכ' (Ms. מְטַנִּין) attacking each other in the heat of discussion (cmp. קנאת סופרים, s. v. קִנְאָה).
, v. supra.

sense.definition: (preced.) jealousy, zeal, agitation (corresp. to h. קִנְאָה).
sense.notes: Targ. Ps. LXIX, 10. Targ. Job. V, 2. Targ. II Esth. V, 8 (Var. טְנָאנָא, טִנְאֲנָא). Ib. VII, 4 (h. text נֵזֶק!); a. fr.
f. same. Targ. Ps. LXXIX, 5.

sense.definition: to soil with excrements, secretions &c.; to secrete (blood or mucus from the womb).
sense.notes: Pesik. Par., p. 40 b שטי' בפלטין וכ' that made a nuisance in the palace &c. Bekh. 20 a, a. e. מְטַנֶּפֶת an animal secreting from the vagina (an evidence of birth or abortion). B. Kam. 3 a טִינְּפָה פירות the animal soiled fruits (by rolling in them). Tosef. Joma V (IV), 5 כדי שלא יְטַנְּפוּ וכ' that his feet may not soil his garments; a. fr.— Part. pass. מְטוּנָּף, f. מְטוּנֶּפֶת; pl. מְטוּנָּפִין, מְטוּנָּפוֹת soiled, filthy, defiled, polluted. Y. Snh. X, 27 d top. Cant. R. to II, 8; a. fr.

נִטְנַף to be soiled, defiled. Y. Yoma VIII, 44 d נִיטַּנְּפוּ רגליו (or נִיטְנְפוּ) if his feet became muddy.—*Y. Ber. I, 3 c bot. ראה כפים הללו שלא ניטנפו בבנין וכ' ed. Lehm. (ed. Ven. נטפו, ed. Krot. חטפו, v. חָטַף) see these hands which have not been in the least soiled by misappropriating the Temple funds.
Part. pass. טָנִיף. Sabb. 57 a טְנִיפָן they were soiled with dirt (Rashi: מִיטַּנְּפֵי Ithpa.).

Targ. Cant. V, 3 (ed. Lag. אטופ', read: אֲטַנְּפִי'). Targ. Job III, 5 (v. טְנַן). Targ. Y. Num. XXXV, 33. [Ib. יִטּוֹף; Targ. Y. Deut. XXI, 23 תְטוּפוּן, prob. to be read: יְטַנֵּף, תְטַנְּפוּן.]—Bekh. 20 a ודאי לא ט' it has certainly not had any secretion indicative of birth, v. preced.
Targ. Lam. IV, 14. Targ. Job. XVIII, 3 (v. טְמַע). Targ. Ps. CVI, 38; a. e.—Sabb. 57 a, v. supra. B. Bath. 82 b קמִיטַּנְּפֵי פירי the fruits are soiled (will rot, when falling on moist plants).
, v. טִינָּ'
, v. טוּס

sense.definition: (טסס, sec. r. of טוּס) [ glittering, flying] foil, plate.
sense.notes: Gitt. 20 b כתב … על טס וכ' if he wrote to her a letter of divorce on gold foil; Y. ib. II, 44 b. Kel. XIII, 6 השן שבטס a key-ward fastened to a thin plate. Sabb. 60 a ט' של זהב וכ' the pin has on one end a gold plate.— Pl. טַסִּים, טַסִּין. Kel. XI, 3 מן הט' וכ' of (tin) foil or other plating material; Tosef. ib. B. Bath. V, 16. Sabb. 103 a טַסֵּי משכן the foils used for the Tabernacle (Ex. XXXIX, 3).
Targ. Prov. XXVI, 8 (Var. כיפא, h. text אבן); v. נִיקְצָא.— Pl. טָסִין, טַסִּ'. Targ. Num. XVII, 3. Targ. Ex. XXXIX, 3.
noun (v. preced.) soldiers with glittering armor (?). Targ. Nah. III, 17 (h. text מנזריך).

sense.definition: , Sifré Num. 42, read סְטַ' = אִסְטַבְלָאוֹת stables.
(Ispe. noun of סְבַר II, cmp. טַצְדְּקָא) treasure, store, store-house.
sense.notes: — Pl. טִסְבְּרִין, טִיסְ'. Targ. Koh II, 8. Targ. Esth. VIII, 1.—Targ. Ps. LXVIII, 14 (h. text אברות־!).—V. תִּסְבְּרָא.
, Y. Keth. XI, 34 b bot., v. סַנְטֵירָא
, v. דטסים
, v. טִיסָנִי

sense.definition: (v. Freit. Arab. Dict. s. v. tòask)

sense.notes: Gitt. 78 a לאיתויי ט' דאכלא בה וכ' (Tosaf. to Ab. Zar. 14 b quotes … ביה) to include the measure in which she measures (or eats) figs (destined) for her particular use. Meg. 7 b מלא ט' וכ' (Ms. O. טיסקא, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l., Var. צנא) a taska full of &c.

sense.definition: name of a Persian land-tax (a certain measure for each certain quantity of produces).
sense.notes: B. Mets. 73 b ארעא לט' וכ' the land is pledged to the taska, and the king has decreed that he who pays the taska shall have the usufruct of the land; B. Bath. 54 b. B. Mets. 110 a תקינו … יהיב ט' the Rabbis have given him a remedy in hand in ordering that the mortgagee shall pay the taxes (and thus secure his ownership against the mortgager’s eventual claims). Gitt. 58 b קביל ארעא בט' rented a piece of land for the taxes on it; Ned. 46 b. B. Bath. 55 a, v. זִיהֲרוֹרָא.—Kidd. 70 b, v. דַּסְקָא.
, v. טעי
Targ. Jer. III, 8 (ed. Wil. טְעוֹ). Targ. Is. XIX, 14. Targ. Ps. CXXXIX, 24 אורח דט' Regia (ed. דטָעִין; h. text עצב); a. fr.— Pl. טַעֲוָותָא. Targ. Nah. III, 4; a. e.
Targ. Y. Deut. IV, 16. Targ. II Chr. XXXII, 15. Ib. XXXV, 21 טָעוּתִי (or טַעֲוָתִי) my deity.— Pl. טַעֲוָן, טַעֲוַון, טַעֲוָתָא, טַעֲוָו'. Targ. Is. I, 29. Targ. Deut. XXVIII, 36; a. fr.
, v. טְעִין a. טְעַן. [Constr. of טְעוּנָא q. v.]
of טָעַן;
טְעוּן (טְעַן II, v. טוּנָא I)

Targ. I Sam. XVI, 20 ט' חמרא ט' דלחמא ed. Lag. (oth. ed. טעין דלחמא) an ass-load consisting of a load (or bag, v. infra) of bread and &c. Targ. II Kings V, 17; a. e.—Sot. 34 a, v. דְּלֵי. B. Mets. 97 a; a. e.— Pl. טְעוּנַיָּיא, טְעוּנֵי. Ib. 32 a … וטְעוּנַיְּיהוּ וכ' דרמי when they themselves and their loads lie on the road.
— Pl. as ab. Targ. Josh. II, 6 ט' כיתנא bags of flax.—Y. Dem. II, 22 d, contrad. to אַשְׁפְּלָה. Lam. R. introd. (R. Joh. 1) מובלי ט' דחלא loads of bags of sand.

B. Mets. 15 b; Keth. 51 a, a. fr. ט' סופר, v. אַחֲרָיוּת. Gen. R. s. 99, v. סוּתָה.—B. Kam. 113 b וטָעוּתוֹ (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.) and a gain through his (the gentile’s) mistake; a. fr.— Pl. טָעִיּוֹת Macc. 12 a. Men. 29 b; a. e.
Sifré Num. 131 אוי לכם ולטָעוּתְכֶם woe is unto you and your idol; Y. Snh. X, 28 d אין לכם וכ' (corr. acc.).
, v. טָעוּ

Ber. II, 3 קרא וט' יחזור למקום שט' if in reading the Sh’ma one made a mistake, he must go back to the passage in which he made a mistake. B. Mets. 63 b בכדי שהדעת טוֹעָה within the limits of a reasonable mistake in counting. Snh. 33 b ט' בדבר שהצדוקין וכ' if the judge made a mistake in a case in which there is no difference of opinion between the Sadducees and Pharisees. Ib. 6 a, a. e. ט' בדבר משנה if the judge gave a wrong decision against an explicit law in the Mishnah; ט' בשיקול הדעת, v. דַּעַת; a. fr.

sense.definition: to seek, to miss (cmp. טָעַן I).
sense.notes: Taan. III, 8 אבן הטוֹעִים; B. Mets. 28 b אבן טוֹעִין Ms. M. (ed. טוֹעַן, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note), v. אֶבֶן.—Lev. R. s. 13, beg. אני טָעִיתִי את ההלכה I had forgotten the law in the case.

sense.definition: to lead astray, to deceive, disappoint.
sense.notes: B. Mets. VI, 1 הִטְעוּ זה את זה they deceived one another, i.e. the agent employed to engage laborers did not act according to instruction, v. next w.—M. Kat. II, 1 הִטְעוּהוּ פועלים hired men disappointed him. Gen. R. s. 19 end (interpret. hishshiani, Gen. III, 13) הִטְעַנִי he deceived me with false promises; a. e.

sense.definition: to be led astray, be deceived.
sense.notes: Tanḥ. Balak 5 כמו שהטעה ה' as he led astray, so was he led astray.—Part. מוּטְעֶה, f. מוּטַעַת, מוּטְעֵית misled, brought about by mistake, under false premises. Yeb. 106 a חליצה מ' a ḥ ãlitsah to which the yabam consented in consequence of a deception (a promise not kept); Tosef. ib. XII, 13; Keth. 74 a.—R. Hash. 25 a אתם אפי' מוּטָעִין ‘ye’ (shall appoint), even if deceived by witnesses (your decision stands). Sabb. 101 b מוטעין (mattings fastened, or spread) by mistake; a. e.

sense.definition: (corresp. to b. h. תָּעָה) to wander, be lost; to reel.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Gen. XXI, 14 טָעָת (O. ed. Berl. טְעַת, ed. Vien. תָּעַת). Targ. Is. XXVIII, 7. Ib. XIX, 13; a. fr.—Gitt. 68 b רויא דהוה קא טָעֵי באורחא a drunken man that was lost on the road; a. e.

sense.definition: (corresp. to b. h. זָנָה) to go astray, worship idols, to be licentious &c. Targ. Am. VII, 17.
sense.notes: Targ. Ex. XXXIV, 15 ויִטְעוֹן (ed. Amst. O. ויִטְעוּן). Ib. 16 ויַטְעַיָן ed. Berl. (ed. Amst. ויִטְעַיַין, Y. I וכד טַעֲיָין, Y. II וִיטַעֲיָן); a. fr.—Gen. R. s. 87, beg. (expl. סררת Prov. VII, 11) טַעֲיָא running about, prostitute, v. טָעִיתָא.
Targ. Ps. LXXVIII, 9 טְעוּ miscalculated the term of redemption (v. Ex. R. s. 20).—Yeb. 121 a מִיטְעָא טְעִינָא I was mistaken; a. e.
Targ. Prov. II, 17. Ib. XXXI, 5; 7. Ib. VI, 20 (ed. Vien. תטעי מנימוסא deviate from).

Targ. Deut. XXVII, 18 יַטְעֵי (not יִטְ'). Targ. Ex. XXXIV, 16; a. fr.—B. Mets. 76 a אַטְעוּ פועלים וכ' the hired men deceived (the one engaging the others deceived them as to their wages, v. preced.); (Var. אִיטְּעוּ וכ' they were deceived by one of their own).—Ḥull. 94 b מַטְעוּ נפשייהו they deceive themselves; a. fr.
. Targ. O. Lev. XIX, 29.

sense.definition: (denom. of טַעֲוָא) to deify, worship as deity.
sense.notes: . Targ. II Chr. XXIV, 17 (v. Ex. R. s. 8).—[

sense.definition: to cause to be forgotten, to ignore.
sense.notes: Targ. Prov. XVII, 14 אַטְעֵי (ed. Lag. מטעי, prob. to be read: אַטֵּישׁ, h. text נְטוֹשׁ.]
B. Mets. 76 a, v. supra.
Targ. Prov. VI, 33 (h. text תמחה).
, v. טְעַם

testing, the quantity used for testing the color. Men. 42 b ט' פסולה the quantity taken out of the kettle for testing is unfit for sacred use; ט' פסלה that quantity, if put back, disqualifies the entire contents of the kettle. Ib. 40 a גזירה משום ט' (not טעימא or דטעימא) it is to be feared lest the quantity used for testing may be put back again.
, v. טְעַן,

[Targ. I Sam. XVI, 20, v. טְעוּנָא.] Targ. Esth. II, 15 טְעִינַת טיבו (h. text נשאת חן).—Gen. R. s. 70 ממון אתית ט' וכ' that I came laden with money; I bring only words.— Pl. (טְעוּ') טְעִינִין; f. טְעִינָן. Targ. Gen. XXXVII, 25 (Y. ed. Amst. טְעוֹ'). Ib. XLV, 23; a. e.

sense.definition: loading, assistance rendered in loading up, opp. פְּרִיקָה.
sense.notes: B. Mets. 31 a. Ib. 32 a ט' בשכר for assistance in loading one may claim wages; a. e.
Num. R. s. 6 לשם טְעִינַת הארון for the office of carrying the Ark.
Targ. Nah. III, 4; a. e.—Yalk. Prov. 940 (expl. סררת, Prov. VII, 1
; (Gen. R. s. 87 טעייא), v. טְעֵי

sense.definition: (b. h.) [ to be bright, wise (v. Ps. XXXIV, 9),] to examine, to taste, test, try, experience.
sense.notes: Yoma 22 b לא ט' טַעַם חטא never tasted the taste of sin (was innocent). Y. Succ. V, 55 b לא היו טוֹעֲמִין טעם וכ' had not even a taste of sleep. Ber. 35 a אסור … שיִטְעוֹם וכ' one must not taste food without a blessing. Ib. 14 a מהו שיטעום dare he (who fasts) taste food when cooking? Num. R. s. 7 כל מי … היה טוֹעֲמוֹ whoever desired to eat meat felt its taste (in the mannah); a. v. fr.

Ned. 66 b עד שתַּטְעִימִי … לרב וכ' until thou makest R. J. taste of thy dish. B. Mets. 75 a כדי להַטְעִימָן וכ' in order to give them a taste of usury (that they might feel its oppressiveness). Cant. R. to VII, 2 תהא … ומטעמני (read ומַטְעִימֵנִי or ומְטַעֲמֵנִי Pi.) thou shalt bring some of them before me and let me taste them; a. fr.
Sot. 21 b המַטְעִים דבריו וכ' who explains his case to the judge (trying to preoccupy him), before his adversary appears; Tanḥ. Mishp. 6; a. e.—V. מַטְעֶמֶת.

Targ. I Sam. XIV, 24; a. fr.—Targ. Y. Deut. XXXII, 1 דלא טַעֲמִין מיתותא which taste no death (heaven and earth).—Ber. 44 a דלא ט' זיונא that he tasted no food. Sabb. 11 a לִיטְעוֹם מר מידי take some refreshment, Sir!—Hor. 11 a אִטְעוֹם טעם דאיסורא I wish to try how a forbidden thing tastes; a. fr.

Targ. Y. Gen. XXIV, 17.—Koh. R. to I, 3 לית את מַטְעַם לי מתבשילי wilt thou not let me taste what I have cooked (for thee?); Lev. R. s. 28; Pesik. R. s. 18; Pesik. Haomer, p. 70 a … מַטְעִים … מתבשילך of the dish prepared for thee?
Part. pass. מְטַעַם tasted, touched. Lev. R. l. c. why do the dishes come out ולא מְטַעֲמִין without being touched?; (Koh. R. l. c. ולא טעמין and they taste them not).

sense.definition: sense, wisdom, sound reasoning; reason, cause, ground.
sense.notes: Ab. Zar. 18 a דברים של ט' sensible argument. Ḥull. 6 a להחזיר לו ט' to give him a clear answer.—Sabb. 83 b ולא נתגלה טַעֲמָהּ the reason of it has not been made known. Ḥull. 101 b מאיזה ט' וכ' for what reason it has been forbidden to them; a. fr.— Pl. טְעָמִים, טְעָמִין. Snh. 34 a מקרא אחד יוצא לכמה ט' ואין טעם אחד וכ' one biblical expression may be used for many arguments, but one and the same argument must not be deduced from different biblical expressions. Erub. 13 b טַעֲמֵי טומאה arguments in favor of uncleanness; a. fr.—פִּסְקי טְעָמִים the incisions, in the Bible verse, according to sense; punctuation signs, accents. Meg. 3 a (ref. to ויבינו במקרא, Neh. VIII, 8) אלו פ' ט' that means the punctuation signs; Y. ib. IV, 74 d bot.; Gen. R. s. 36 (ref. to ושום שכל, Neh. l. c.) אלו הט' (sub. פסקי).—Esp. taste. Yoma 22 b, v. טָעַם. Ḥull. 98 b ט' כעיקר the taste of a forbidden thing is as forbidden as the substance itself. Pes. 44 b top ליתן ט' כעיקר to intimate that the taste (of grapes soaked in water) is equally forbidden as the substance (of grapes). Ḥull. 108 a טַעֲמוֹ ולא ממשו וכ' the taste of a thing without the substance (after removing the forbidden substance) is in all cases biblically forbidden. Ib. VII, 4 אם יש בה בנותן ט' if there is enough of it to give a taste to the entire mixture. Ib. בזמן שמכירו בנותן ט' as long as it can be recognized (and removed), it depends on its giving a taste (whether or not the mixture is forbidden). Ib. 111 b נותן ט' בר נותן ט' an object forbidden for its having absorbed the taste of a forbidden thing, and which (through mixture) has again given taste to another thing, a taste-giver in the second degree. Ab. Zar. 39 b, a. fr. נותן טעם לפגם (abbr. נ"ט) imparting a deteriorating taste, נ"ט לשבח giving an improving taste; a. v. fr.—
Dan. III, 10; a. e.

sense.definition: reason, argument, sense &c. Targ. Job XII, 20; a. e.—B.
sense.notes: Bath. 173 b דלא יהבי ט' וכ' who give no reason for their decisions (judge arbitrarily). Ib., a. fr. מאי ט' (abbr. מ"ט) what is the reason (of the law of the Mishnah)?—Kidd. 68 b, a. fr. דריש ט' דקרא interprets the biblical law on its reason and accordingly modifies it, extending or limiting, e.g. (B. Mets. 115 a) applying the law Deut. XXIV, 17 only to poor widows. Ib. אלא לרבנן מאי טַעֲמֵיה but according to the Rabbis (who do not interpret the law on its reason), where is the argument for it? (prob. to be read: טַעֲמַיְיהוּ; Yeb. 23 a מנא לן). Ber. 7 b מ"ט לא אתי מר וכ' why do you not come to synagogue for prayer?—Ib. 11 a קא מפרשי טַעֲמַיְיהוּ וט' וכ' they give their reason for their own opinion and for differing with Beth-Sh.—Keth. 83 b הלכה כר' … ולא מטַעֲמֵיה the rule (practice) is in agreement with R. S.’s opinion, but not for the reason he had for it. Ib. 84 a כטעמיה וכהלכתיה in agreement both with his argument and his legal opinion; a. fr.—Pes. 21 b, a. fr. ט' דכתב וכ' the reason (of this) is, because &c., i.e. this is so only because &c.—וּלְטַעֲמֵיךְ now, according to your argument (assuming it to be correct,—what then?). Ber. 43 a; a. v. fr.

sense.definition: argument on the cause of bereavement, consolation (v. טַמָּא).
sense.notes: M. Kat. 18 a למישאל ט' מיניה (Ms. M.; second time, לשיולי ביה ט') to get his permission to argue (with him), i.e. to console him. Snh. 113 a [read:] למשאל ביה ט' (or טמא, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 7) to console him.—בֵּי טַעֲמָא, v. טַמָּא.

Targ. Num. XI, 8; a. e.—Yoma 78 b ט' דמיתותא a foretaste of death. Hor. 11 a, v. טְעַם. Ḥull. 97 a בט' it depends on the taste (whether a mixture be forbidden), v. preced. Ib. b מין בשאינו מינו … בט' in case of a mixture of heterogeneous things which are permitted, we decide by the taste; a. fr.— Pl. טַעֲמִין. Targ. Cant. V, 11; 13.
Pl. טָעֲמַיָּא. Esth. R. to I, 3 בני ט' ובני סגניא דיליה his young pleaders and counselors. Ib. בני ט' בני … דיליה pleaders means his counsellors.

sense.definition: to claim before court, to sue, to plead.
sense.notes: Keth. XIII, 4 הטוֹעֵן את חבירו כדי וכ' if one claims from his neighbor a certain number of jugs of oil. Ib. 108 b, a. e. טְעָנוֹ חטין וכ' if one claims wheat and barley (two different things), and defendant admits barley. Shebu. 43 a עד שיִטְעֲנֶנּוּ בדבר וכ' until he sues him for something weighable or countable. Gitt. 58 b טוֹעֲנִין ליורש וכ' the court pleads in behalf of the heir &c.; a. v. fr.—Part. pass. טָעוּן, f. טְעוּנָה is required for, requires. Zeb. V, 7 דמן ט' הזייה their blood is required for sprinkling (must be sprinkled). Bicc. II, 1 טְעוּנִים רחיצת וכ' require washing of hands; a. v. fr.—Denom. טֹעַן, טוֹעַן requirement, obligation, fr. which טָ' טֹעַן to require. Sifra introd. ויצא מן הכלל לִיטְעוֹן ט' אחר שהוא וכ' and is specified for another requirement in keeping with the general subject.

sense.definition: to seek after, to suspect, v. infra.
to be sued, to be respondent, defendant.
sense.notes: Y. B. Kam. X, beg. 7 b אפי' קטנים נִטְעָנִין להן בב"ד even for minors defense is made in court (prob. to be read: טוֹעֲנִין, cmp. Gitt. 58 b, quoted supra). [In later literature טוֹעֵן claimant, נִטְעָן defendant.]

sense.definition: to be inquired after, suspected, to be summoned on suspicion.
sense.notes: Yeb. II, 8 הנ' על א"א וכ' if one was suspected of intercourse with a married woman, and the court caused her to be sent away from him (her husband) on his account; ib. 24 b; Tosef. ib. IV, 5 הניט' מא"א. Y. ib. II, 4 a bot. בנ' בעדים when the suspicion has been corroborated by witnesses.
Keth. 105 b אי בעי טָעֵין וכ' if he chooses, he may plead thus. Gitt. 58 b אי דקא טעין וכ' is it that he pleads (demurs) and says &c.?; a. fr.

sense.definition: , a. Ges. H. Dict. 10 s. v. צען) [ to move, make ready for travelling,]

sense.notes: Num. R. s. 6 וטוֹעֲנִים על העגלות and pack (them) upon wagons; a. fr.—Part. pass. טָעוּן (interch. with טוֹעֵן) laden, carrying. Ib. s. 5 מי שהוא ט' בקרשים some had a share in carrying (moving) the boards. Ib. טוענין כל כלי האריגה had to carry all woven materials. Ib. s. 6 היה מִטּוֹעֲנֵי וכ' was one of those carrying the ark. B. Mets. 32 b טְעוּנָה יין אסור carrying forbidden wine.—Midr. Till. to Ps. XVIII בשעה … טְעוּנִין את המים when the clouds are charged with water; Yalk. Sam. 160 טוענין מן המים (corr. acc.), v. חָשַׁךְ. Ib. אלו טוענין חרבות וכ' those carrying swords, others lances &c.; a. fr.—3) Esp. to help one broken down on the road to load again, contrad. to פרק to help in unloading. B. Mets. II, 10 מצוה לִטְעוֹן … the biblical law requires man to help in unloading, but not in loading (without remuneration); אף לט' loading, too, must be done gratuitously, v. טְעִינָה; a. fr.
Gen. R. s. 82 נ' ברכות was laden with blessings; a. e.—Trnsf. (cmp. כָּבֵד) to be very ill. Treat. S’maḥ. ch. VIII אמר לו נ' he said to him, He (thy son) is very ill.
Midr. Till. to Ps. LXXXVII [read:) אינן יכולין להִטָּעֵן … וטוֹעֲנִין וכ' who cannot be carried (on wagons &c.) … and they carry them on their hands (in a chair); (v. next w. a. Yalk. Ps. 838).

Lev. R. s. 13 ה' לחמורו וכ' he put on his ass five S’ah &c. Sabb. 5 a הִטְעִינוֹ חבירו his neighbor placed something in his hand to carry, ה' שמים the heavens placed &c. (when he put his hand forth to collect and carry rain water); a. e.
Y. Peah I, 16 a top (ref. to Lev. XIX, 16) שלא תהא כרוכל הזה מַטְעִין דבריו וכ' be not like the peddler carrying the talk of this one to the other &c.

sense.definition: to be laden; to carry, bear (h. נשא).
sense.notes: Targ. Y. II Num. XIII, 23 (ed. Amst. טַעֲנוּ Pa.). Targ. O. Gen. XLIV, 1. Targ. Joel II, 22; a. fr.—B. Mets. 40 b כיון דטָעוּן טָעוּן when they are once impregnated (with the fluid), they resorb no more.—Trnsf. to suffer, bear. Targ. Prov. IX, 12; a. e.

Targ. O. Gen. XLV, 17 טְעוּנוּ ed. Berl. (oth ed. a. Y. טְעִינוּ). Targ. Y. ib. XLIV, 13.—Esp. to help carrying, opp. פרק, v. preced. Gen. R. s. 96 משל הדיוט … טעון וכ' the common adage says, if thy friend’s son is dead, help carrying; if thy friend is dead, throw off (common people show no favor where no return can be expected). Y. Ḥag. II, 77 b top מִיטְעוֹן תרי וכ' that two carry one load; a. fr.

Ib. הוון מְטַעֲנִין להין they made them carry &c.—Part. pass. מְטַעַן carried, moved. Cant. R. to IV, 8 דלית אינון … מְטַעֲנִין וכ' who are too feeble to be carried in a lectica, and whom they carry in a cathedra

Ib. מַטְעִינִין. Y. Ḥag. l. c. אַטְעוּנְנוֹן יחידאין carry them singly, אַטְעוֹנִינוֹן וכ' they did so; אטעונינון צלוחיין carry straight through (without resting).—א' חינא = h. נשא חן to find grace. Targ. Esth. II, 17 (ed. Lag. אִיטְּ', Ithpe.); a. e.
. Targ. Lam. V, 5. Targ. Esth. l. c., v. supra.
Y. Bets. I, 60 c bot. מִיטְּעַן מערס וכ' allowed himself to be carried from one seat (where he lectured) to another. Ib., v. סְדִינָא.

sense.definition: (v. preced. Nif.) to become severely ill.
sense.notes: Targ. II Sam. XII, 15 (h. text ויאנש).

sense.definition: to move to and back, to swing a whip &c. Num. R. s. 12 דלא יהוון טַעֲנִין וכ' that they should not swing the rod over the children (Midr. Till. to Ps. XCI … מחון; Yalk. Ps. 842 מחיין).
swung upon, struck with a spear &c., wounded.
sense.notes: Targ. Is. XIV, 19 מְטַעֲנֵי חרב (h. text מְטֹעֲנֵי). Targ. Jer. XXXVII, 10 מְטַעֲנִין (h. text מדקרים); a. e.

sense.definition: requirement, v. טוֹעַן a. טָעַן I.
sense.notes: I.
B. Mets. 28 b אבן ט', v. טָעָה.

Shebu. VI, 1 הט' … וההודאה וכ' if the claim is for two M’ah silver, and the defendant admits the value of a P’rutah. Ib. אם אין ההודאה ממין הט' if the defendant’s admission is not homogeneous with the claim (e.g. one sues for wheat and the defendant alleges to owe barley). Ib. 39 b כפירת ט' שתי וכ' the claim of two M’ah in the Mishnah means that amount of the claim which is disputed; ט' עצמה וכ' it means that the original claim was for two &c. Keth. I, 1 טַעֲנַת בתולים, v. בְּתוּלִים.—B. Kam. 57 a ט' גנב, v. גַּנָּב. Ib. ט' לסטים, v. לִסְטֵיס; a. fr.— Pl. טַעֲנוֹת. Y. Snh. III, 21 b bot. צריך … לשנות טַעֲנוֹתֵיהֶן the judge must repeat the pleas of the contesting parties; Midr. Till. to Ps. LXXII לשקול ט'; Yalk. Kings 175 לשקול ט' בפני שניהם weigh their pleas in the presence of both parties; a. e.

Num. R. s. 10 (ed. Amst. p. 240 a) מפני טענת הבריות not to give rise to people’s talk; Ab. d’R. N. ch. II. Y. Ber. I, 3 c מפני ט' המינין not to give support to the talk of the heretics (Bab. ib. 12 a תרעומת).
Kidd. 28 a האי ט' מעליית' היא is not this a good plea?— Pl. טַעֲנָתָא. Keth. 18 a כולהי ט' טענת וכ' all pleas consist of the claim of other people and one’s own admission (replique).

sense.definition: (עוק, ט for ת; cmp. טִיגָּן) to be narrow.
sense.notes: Targ. Prov. IV, 12 תִּטְעוּק ed. Lag. (Levita תִּטְעַק; ed. Wil. תתעוק).
Targ. Ps. XXXI, 10 אִיטָּעַק Ms. (ed. אִיטְּעַק, ed. Wil. אִתְּעָק; ed. Lag. איטלק). Targ. Prov. XXIV, 10 מִתְטָעִיק Ms. a. Lev. (ed. Lag. a. oth. מתתעיק). V. תְּעַק.

pl. (b. h.; טָפַף I; cmp. טפל) [ joined to, dependent,] children. Ḥag. 3 a (ref. to Deut. XXXI, 12) טף למה באין why must the children come?; Tosef. Sot. VII, 9 טף למה בא (Var. טְפֵלִין … באין); Ab. d’R. N. ch. XVIII. Mekh. Bo. s. 16 וכי טף היה יודע וכ' would children have known to distinguish &c.?
, v. טְפֵי
, v. sub טִיפּ'.
, Y. Ber. I, 2 c bot., read: נוֹפוֹ, v. נוֹף II.—Targ. Cant. II, 8, v. טְפַז.
, v. טִיפּוּח
, v. טָפַח II a. טְפִיחַ II
— Pl. טְפוּחִין. Targ. Y. Gen. XXVII, 30 כתרתין ט' about the time needed for two raps.

sense.definition: (v. preced.) knocker, one who by rapping at the wall discovers hidden treasures.
sense.notes: — Pl. טְפוֹחָאֵי. B. Mets. 42 a; cmp. גָּשׁוֹשָׁא.
, v. טַפִּיטָא

sense.definition: tippuyin, name of certain small insects.
sense.notes: Sabb. 107 b הט' Ms. M. a. Rashi (ed. טִפּוּיֵי; Ms. O. טִיפּוּיִין); cmp. טִיפָּה.

Kel. XVI, 7 ט' של תפלה the block on which the case of the phylacteries is shaped. Y. Snh. X, 28 d top ט' של פעור a cast of the idol P’or; (Sifré Num. 131 דפיס; Snh. 106 a יראתה). Y. Sabb. IV, 8 b bot. ט' של דדים, v. דָּפוּס. Dem. V, 4 (ed. Y. טִיפּוּס). Y. ib. 24 d top נחתום עושה ט' אחד if the baker makes only one form of loaves. Ib. (once) טופוס אחד (corr. acc.); a. e.— Pt. טְפוּסִין. Dem. V, 3 (Ar. דפ'). Y. ib. l. c. נחתום … כמה ט' if the baker makes several forms of loaves. Ib. שני טפסין (corr. acc.).—Cant. R. to VI, 4 טִיפּוּסִים של פעור, v. supra.

sense.definition: (corresp. to h. קפץ) [ to join, contract,]

sense.notes: Targ. Job V, 16 טָפְזַת ed. Lag. (some ed. טַפְּיַת).
Targ. Y. Num. XXI, 35.—Targ. Cant. II, 8 וט' על קיצא (ed. Lag. וטפו, ed. Vien. וטפן, corr. acc.) leaped over (redeemed them before) the destined end of the captivity. Targ. Ps. LXVIII, 17; a. fr.
same. Ib. CXIV, 6 דאתון מְטַפְּזִין Ms. (ed. טפזו incorr.). Targ. Job XXI, 11; a. fr.—V. טְפֵי IV

Targ. O. Lev. XI, 5 (ed. Berl. טַבְ', v. Berl. Massor. p. 86; Y. טַוְו'); Targ. Deut. XIV, 7. Gen. R. s. 12 הדין ט' מיגין וכ' the rabbit seeks protection under a projecting rock from the bird of prey &c.; Yalk. Ps. 862. — Pl. טַפְזַיָּא. Targ. Ps. CIV, 18.

sense.definition: [ to join closely, whence טֶפַח (cmp. קוֹמֶץ) joined fingers, hand-breadth,] to come in close contact; (cmp. נָקַשׁ) to strike, knock.
sense.notes: B. Kam. 32 b נתזה בקעת וטָפְחָה לו על פניו Ms. M. a chip flew off and struck him in the face. Ib. נתזו … וטָפְחוּ לו וכ' Ms. M. sparks flew off and hit him &c.; a. fr.—Esp. (denom. of טֶפַח) טָפַח, a.

sense.definition: to strike with the flat hand, to slap.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 22, end התחיל אדה"ר מְטַפֵּחַ על פניו Adam slapped his own face; Lev. R. s. 10 טוֹפֵחַ. Kidd. 31 a טָפְחָה לו על ראשו slapped him on his head. Gen. R. s. 45 טְפָחַתָּהּ וכ' (Yalk. ib. 79 קפחתה) she slapped her face with her shoe. Y. Kil. VIII, 31 c top טי' כנגד וכ' (Kidd. 24 b הכהו) if he struck him over his eye and blinded him. Ab. Zar. IV, 10 היה מְטַפֵּחַ על וכ' (Bab. ed. 60 b מַטְפִּיחַ, Y. ed. מתפח) he slapped upon the fermenting barrel (to check fermentation). Toh. III, 8 שדרך התינוק לטַפֵּחַ a child likes to slap (dough &c., to dabble); a. e.

sense.definition: to clap hands to a certain tune in rejoicing or mourning, v. טִיפּוּחַ.
sense.notes: Bets. V, 2 לא מְטַפְּחִין וכ' we must not clap hands, or strike upon the knees, or stamp on the Holy Day. M. Kat. III, 8 מענות אבל לא מְטַפְּחוֹת may sing the dirge but must not clap. Ib. 9. Num. R. s. 4 … שהיה מקיש וטוֹפַחַ he knocked his hands against each other and clapped; ib. וטפח. Cant. R. to II, 14 מְטַפַּחַת באגפיה clapped her wings.

definition.italic: to collect the contents of a broken vessel by palming, to wipe with the palm.

sense.notes: Ter. XI, 7. Sabb. 143 b ולא יְטַפֵּחַ בשמן must not use the palm for collecting oil in the broken vessel.
same. Ab. Zar. 60 b, v. supra.
טַפֵּחַ ch. same,
B. Kam. 23 a לא ט' באפיה (Ms. H. טפא, v. טְפֵי IV) he did not carefully close (the stable) before him.

sense.definition: to slap, strike with hand, stamp with foot.
sense.notes: Targ. II Kings XIX, 24; Is. XXXVII, 25. Targ. Ez. XXI, 17; 19; a. fr.—Targ. Jon. IV, 8 ט' שמשא וכ' the sun beat upon &c.—B. Kam. 32 b ט' ליה רבא בסנדליה Raba struck him upon his (R. Shimi’s) sandal (to silence him); M. Kat. 25 a; B. Bath. 22 a; a. e.
Y. Snh. II, beg. 19 d; Y. Hor. III, beg. 47 a שרי ט' בחדא וכ' he made the motion of clapping with one hand; ובחדא טַפְחִין do people clap with one hand?; a. e.
Targ. Ps. CXLI, 5; Targ. Is. XLI, 7 (h. text הלם).

sense.definition: (cmp. טָפַף II) to drip, be moist.
sense.notes: Sabb. 17 a עדיין משקה טוֹפֵחַ וכ' moisture is still dripping on them. Yoma 78 a טוֹפֵחַ ע"מ להַטְפִּיחַ moist enough to moisten other objects; Ab. Zar. 60 b טופח ע"מ להטפיח Ms. M. (ed. ט' להט'). Toh. VIII, 9; a. fr.—2) (cmp. דאב, דוי) to melt, decay, ferment (of a running and fermenting dough). B. Mets. 59 b אף בצק … ט' (Ms. R. 2 תפח, v. תָּפַח) even the dough under the hands of the kneading women fermented.—Y. Yeb. XII, end, 13 a וטפח רוחי עלי; Yalk. Prov. 964 טָפְחָה וכ' my mind in me became fermenting, i.e. I felt proud (v. טוּף).— Part. pass. טָפוּחַ decaying, languishing (from starvation). Sifra B’ḥuck. Par. 2, ch. VI טְפוּחֵי רעב (v. תָּפַח).
Yoma 78 a טינא מַטְפַּחַת clay which makes wet (those sitting on it). Ib.; Ab. Zar. 60 b להַטְפִּיחַ, v. supra. Ber. 25 a כל זמן שמַטְפִּיחִין as long as the spot is wet enough to moisten.

sense.definition: v. טָפַח I) hand-breadth, breadth of four fingers joined.
sense.notes: Succ. 4 b, a. fr. ארון תשעה וכפרת ט' the Ark was nine handbreadths high, and the lid one. Ib. 7 a ט' שוחק a liberal hand-breadth (four fingers not closely joined). v. אַמָּה.—Yoma 55 a top טִיפְחָהּ של כפורת Ar. a. Ms. M. 2 a. Ms. O. (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 9, ed. עוביה) the hand-breadth, i.e. the hight, of the lid, v. supra.; a. v. fr.— Pl. טְפָחִים, Du. טְפָחַיִים. Taan. 25 b; a. v. fr. [טְפָחִין, or טִפְחִין, v. טְפִיחַ II.]
, v. טַפִּיטָא
, v. טָפַף II

sense.definition: to grow faint, to die out, be extinguished.
sense.notes: Targ. I Sam. III, 3. Targ. Job XVIII, 5, sq.; a. e.—Y. Sabb. I, 3 b bot. אילין בעיין דיִטְפֵי וכ' they (the children) desire that the lamp grow dim (so that they need not study, and therefore will not snuff it). Lev. R. s. 9 אשכחא בוצינא טָפֵי she found the lamp gone out; (Y. Sot. I, 16 d bot. מִיטְּפֵי Ithpe); a. e.

Targ. Cant. VIII, 7. Targ. II Sam. XXI, 17; a. e.—Y. Yoma VIII, 45 b בעי מִטְפְתָה wanted to put it out; Y. Ned. IV, 38 d מיטפייה (read: מִיטְפִינָהּ). Ib. אפי' ר' אימי יִטְפֵי (or Af.) even R. I. would have been permitted to extinguish the fire on the Sabbath.
same. Tanḥ. Vayigg. 5 נורא דתמר כלתך אנא מַטְפֵי I will put out the fire intended for Tamar &c. (I will curb thy passion; Yalk. Gen. 150 אנן מנהרין we shall light for thee).

Y. Sabb. VI, 8 c bot. [read:] איטפי בוצינא אמרה לה לא איתטפי אמרי לא מיטפי בוצינא וכ' is the light out? Said she, it is not out. Upon which they said (this means) the light of Israel is not extinguished (R. A. is not dead). Y. Sot. I, 16 d bot., v. supra. Y. Ḥag. II, 77 c top ואִיטַּפְיַית and the fire over the grave was extinguished (v. דְּמַךְ).
Targ. Y. Ex. XXVI, 28 והוה טָפֵי (not והות).
Y. Snh. X, 29 a bot. ובעי מִטְפָא עלמא and wanted to inundate the world.
Targ. Job XV, 8 some ed. (v. טְפַף II).

Taan. 24 a אי טָפוּ לה וכ' when they put on too much or too little. Ab. Zar. 9 a ונִיטְפֵי עלייהו וכ' and let him add thereto twenty years. Yoma 35 a אי בציר מהני וט' אהני if he makes the ones less in value and adds to the value of the others; a. fr.—Part. טָפֵי, f. טַפְיָא more. Sabb. 19 a אי ט' if it is more in measure (than before washing).—Ab. Zar. 9 b דמתניתא ט' וכ' the calculation of the Boraitha is three years more.—Adv. טְפֵי more. Gitt. 44 a, a. e., v. חַד II.—R. Hash. 26 b bot. כמה … ט' מעלי the more … the better it is. B. Bath. 144 b חריף ט' he is smarter (than his brother); a. fr.

sense.definition: = טְפַח I, to close, Targ. Job V, 16 טְפִיַת (some ed. טַפְּיַת Pa.
sense.notes: ), v. טְפַז.—B. Kam. 23 a, v. טְפַח. [Targ. Cant. II, 8, v. טְפַז.]

sense.definition: (= טְפִיחַ I, v. טְפֵי II) [ dripper,] vessel with a narrow neck.
sense.notes: Kel. II, 3 ט' שהתקינו לענבים a pitcher which was made with the intention of using it for grapes. Ib. III, 2. Neg. XII, 5 טָפְיוֹ (R. S. a. l. תָּפְיוֹ) man’s oil vessels.
f., v. טְפֵי III.—[טַפְיָא m., v. next w.]

sense.definition: pitcher for drawing water for drinking or hand-washing.
sense.notes: Sabb. XVII, 6 (125 b), v. זְמוֹרָה. Ib. XXIV, 5, v. פָּקַק. B. Bath. 63 a ‘give him a share in my well לט' Ms. M. a. Rashb. (ed. לטפיחי, corr. acc.; Ms. F. לטַפְיָא, cmp. טָפִי) for the pitcher’, i.e. for drinking purposes. Tosef. Ber. IV, 11 [read as] Yoma 30 a ומחזיר הט' על האורחים (v. Rashi a. l.; Ms. M. והט' חוזר וכ') and passes the pitcher (which he had used for washing his hands) around the guests.

sense.definition: a pitcher-shaped vessel put up in walls and cornices as bird’s nest.
sense.notes: — Pl. טְפִיחִים, טְפִיחִין. Bets. 24 a; 25 a; Tosef. Sabb. XII (XIII), 4; ib. XVIII, 4 ed. Zuck. (Var. טפחין); ib. Bets. I, 10; Ḥull. 139 b

sense.definition: muddy soil, ground on which water subsided, opp. to גריד.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 33, end (Yalk. ib. 56 מקפה).

sense.definition: pl. טְפִיחִים, טְפִיחִין stinted, poor grains; [another opinion: (v. טָפַח I, a. cmp. סָפִיחַ) growth between grass].
sense.notes: Shebi. IX, 4. Y. ib. 39 a top טפחין; Tosef. ib. VII, 15 רחיפין ed. Zuck. (Var. רפיחין, ספיחין). [Tosef T’bul Yom. I, 1, sq., v. טוֹפַח.]

sense.definition: (sub. רעב) one looking like those who suffer from the effects of famine, yellowish-black.
sense.notes: Bekh. 45 b שחור … יצא מהן טָפוּחַ ed. (Rashi טפיח) a very dark-complected man must not marry an equally complected woman, lest their offspring may be a t’fia ḥ; [Rashi: black as a pitcher, v. טְפִיחַ I].

sense.definition: (טָפַח I) hammering for the purpose of polishing.
sense.notes: Tosef. Sabb. XI (XII), 2.

Lev. R. s. 30 (Ar. דיופוטא).— Pl. טַפִּיטִין. Koh. R. to III, 9 טפו' (corr. acc.) Gen. R. s. 33 saw in Rome עמודים מכוסין בט' וכ' (not בטפיסין) statues covered with rugs, in winter &c., Yalk. Ps. 727 בטיפיטין (corr. acc.); Lev. R. s. 27 בטיפטיאות (read: טַפִּיטִיאוֹת). Lam. R. to I, 16; ib. introd. (R. Joh. 2) טפטיות (read: טַפִּיטִיּוֹת).

sense.definition: (tapeta, acc. -tam) same, ט' של סוס horsecloth, housing.
sense.notes: Kel. XXIII, 2.
, Targ. Y. Lev. XI, 35 Bxt., v. תַּפְיָא.
, v. טְפֵלָ'
Y. Keth. VIII, 32 b top כדי טְפִילָתָן as much as their sustenance costs. Y. Orl. I, 60 d top כדי טְפִילָתָהּ worth the labor given to its (the grape-vine’s) cultivation (R. S. to Orl. I, 2 נפילתה).
, v. טַפִּיטָא

— Pl. טְפִיפִיּוֹת. Bekh. 22 a מִשֶּׁיֵּרָאוּ ט' from the time travailing has reached that stage when the ringlike formations at the mouth of the vagina are visible (indicating the passage of the embryo’s head); [Ar. reads: קְפִיפִים, Var. קְפִיפִיּוֹת; Tosef. Ohol. VIII, 8 קְפִיפִים.]—Cmp. טֶפֶף.
, v. טְפַשׁ

B. Mets. 73 b ושפכו ליה טפי כופיתא (Ms. M. ושפכי כופיתא, read טפיתא; Alf. טַפְיָיתָא pl.; Ms. H. טפי טוּפְיָאתָא; Ms. R. טפי טופיתא, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) and they (in delivering the wine) poured a liberal addition to the stipulated quantity.

Kel. III, 4 וטְפָלָן בגללין and lined them (the cracked vessels) with a paste of ordure. Ib. 5 הטוֹפֵל וכ' if one covers with paste a sound vessel. Bets. 34 a אין טוֹפְלִין וכ' you must not cover (the fowls) with potter’s clay (to get the feathers off); Tosef. ib. III, 19 וטובלין ed. Zuck. (corr. acc.). Sabb. 80 b; Pes. 43 a; M. Kat. 9 b טוֹפְלוֹת אותן בסיד dress their skins with lime (to keep them hairless). Y. Ab. Zar. II, 40 d (in Chald. diction) שחוק וטְפוֹל grind it to powder and apply it (as a remedy); a. fr.

Ḥag. 8 a בטוֹפֵל when he combines two different funds. Ib. טוֹפְלִין בהמה לבהמה וכ' you may use the second tithe money for buying an additional animal to that designated for the pilgrim’s offering (חֲגִיגָה), but you must not join the two funds (in order to buy a larger animal). Ab. Zar. 25 b טוֹפְלוֹ לימינו lets the gentile walk to his right side, v. זָמַן; (Tosef. ib. III, 4 נותנו); Ḥull. 91 a.— Part. pass. טָפוּל a) affixed, attached. Y. Sabb. XVI, 15 c bot. (ref. to Mish. ib. 2) בשאינו ט' לו וכ' when the casing is not attached to the book, but if it is &c.—b) dependent on, supported by. Y. Dem. II, 23 a top; Y. Peah IV, 18 b bot. טְפוּלִין לאביהן dependent on (living with) their parents (cmp. B. Mets. 12 b, s. v. סָמַךְ).

Lev. R. s. 6; s. 15; Yalk. Is. 281 ונִטְפְּלוּ בישעיה and they were embodied in the Book of Isaiah. Tanḥ. Vayḥi 17 נִטְפַּלְתֶּם בעצמי you will be attached to myself (be called sons of Jacob); Yalk. Gen. 161; (Gen. R. s. 100 זכיתם בעצמי you will have a share in me).

Ḥull. 91 a ישראל שנ' וכ', v. זָמַן. Men. 65 a ניט' להם וכ' R. J. joined their discussions. Snh. 9 a הני' לעוברי עבירה he who is an accessory to sin. Y. B. Kam. X, 7 c top, שלא … נִטְפָּלִין לגנבים that citizens may not be in conspiracy with thieves (and sell the stolen goods to their owner under the pretence of having bought them).

sense.definition: to attend to, to nurse, tend.
sense.notes: Y. Keth. XII, 35 a top מי שני' … יִטָּפֵל בי וכ' those who attended to me (nursed me) in life, shall attend to me in death; Y. Kil. IX, 32 b top; Gen. R. s. 100; Tanḥ. Vayḥi 3. Ib, a. e. להִטָּפֵל בקבורתו to attend to his funeral; a. fr.

B. Kam. 10 b, a. e. הבעלים מִטַּפְּלִין וכ' the owner has to attend to the disposal of the carcass. B. Mets. 28 b מִטַּפֵּל בהן must take care of them. Ex. R. s. 20; Deut. R. s. 11 אני בעצמי מט' וכ' I myself shall attend to thy burial; a. fr.

sense.definition: (of lower animals) to breed, increase (v. טָפֵל).
sense.notes: Kidd. 80 a ושרצים … מִיטַּפְּלִין שם vermin and frogs breed in the house.
