sense.definition: (denom. of טָפֵל) burdened with a large family.
sense.notes: Taan. 16 a, sq. מט' ואין לו one having a large family with no means of support.

sense.definition: , to paste, plaster &c. Pes. 74 b טַפְלֵיה ההוא וכ' put a dough paste over a pigeon.
sense.notes:
M. Kat. 9 b טַפְלָהּ אבר אבר put a paste on her (for improving her complexion) limb-wise; Sabb. 80 b.—Trnsf. (with שקרא) to charge falsely,
calumniate (cmp. טוּחַ I, v. Ps. CXIX, 69).—Targ. Y. I Deut. I, 1.

Part. מִיטַּפַּל, מִיטַּפְלָא, מִטַּ' (not מְ') forming a scab (h. מִסְפַּחַת). Targ. Y. Lev. XIII, 6; 7; 8; 19.—2) to attend, care. Y. Taan. IV, 68 d top עד דהוון מִיטַּפְּלִין ביה while they were engaged in burying him.—3) to join, attach one’s self. Keth. 23 a אִיטְּפֵל בקריבותיך marry one of thy relations. Snh. 26 a א' בהדיהו joined them. Y. Kil. IX, 32 c bot.; Y. Keth. XII, 35 b אזל וא' בהון מן תמן (not זמן) he went and remained in their company from thence.

sense.definition: attachment, of secondary import, opp. עיקר.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 39 ולוט ט' לו (Var. נטפל) and Lot was merely an attachment to Abraham. Ber. 12 b ויציאת … ט' לו and the exodus from Egypt will be considered of secondary import to it (the redemption from the powers). Ib. 13 a ויעקב ט' the name Jacob will be secondary to Israel; a. fr.

טְפֵלִים, טְפֵלִין dependants, children, minors. Kidd. 34 b (ref. to Deut. XXXI, 12) ט' חייבין minors are obliged to appear; v. טַף. B. Bath. 117 a; a. fr.—Y. Shebi. VII, beg. 37 b תְּפֵילִין, v. אֲלוּנְטִית II.—V. טְפֵלָה.

Targ. O. Gen. XXXIV, 29 (Y. pl.); a. fr.— Pl. טַפְלַיָּא, טַפְלִין, טַפְלֵי. Targ. Y. Gen. XLVII, 12. Targ. Y. I Ex. XIII, 18; a. e.—Ḥull. 18 a תלו ביה ט' (Ar. טוּפְלֵי) children are dependent on him.

Targ. Jer. XLIII, 9 טְפֵיל constr. (h. text מֶלֶט).—Pes. 74 b אי מעלי טִפְלֵיה if its dough-paste is good. M. Kat. 9 b, a. e. דשתי … בעיין בנתיה ט' because he drinks beer, his daughters need paste (to improve their complexion), v. טְפַל.
Kel. V, 7 גורר את הט' scrapes the plastering off. Ib. 8; 11. Tosef. ib. B. Kam. IV, 18; a. e.

Ber. VI, 7 כל שהוא עיקר ועמו ט' whatever food is the chief dish and something is offered to be eaten with it.—Tanḥ. Ki Thissa 27; Ex. R. s. 45, end, v. אָתַר.—Y. M. Kat. III, 82 c bot. ט' לט' (not בט') distant relations, grand-children.— Pl. טְפֵילוֹת. Y. Meg. I, 71 d bot. טְפֵילוֹתֵיהֶם their affixes (prefixes and suffixes).
, v. טְלוֹפְחָא

sense.definition: (cmp. טָפַף I) to join; part. טוֹפֵס q. v.
(cmp. טְפַז) to seize with hands or feet, to climb.
sense.notes: Tosef. Toh. VII, 10 הרבים מִטַּפְּסִין וכ' many climb (over the fences) and walk therein. Erub. 21 a אדם מִטַּפֵּס ועולה מט' וכ' a human being may climb up and down; Y. ib. IX, beg. 25 c כמִטַּרְפֵּס וכ' (fr. טִרְפֵּס) it is as in the case of accessibility by climbing &c. B. Bath. 11 b מטפס וכ' Ms. M. a. oth. (ed. מטפיס, corr. acc., v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) the chicken climbs &c. Cmp. תָּפַס.

sense.definition: (v. preced.) [ to join hands,] to agree, make a covenant.
sense.notes: Targ. O. Gen. XXXIV, 15; 22; 23 (Y. אתפייס, h. text נֵאוֹת). Targ. Prov. I, 10 ed. Lag. תטפיס (ed. תתפייס); [prob. everywhere Ithpe.].
Targ. II Kings XII, 9. Targ. Is. XIII, 17, ed. Lag. (ed. מטקסין, corr. acc.).
—ט' דמלכא royal chest, treasury, archive. Yeb. 46 a; B. Mets. 73 b (Ms. M. טפט', Ms. H. a. F. ספתא, ed. Ven. טפסרא, Ar. s. v. מהרק: ספטא, ספתא, v. סִיפְטָא).
v. טוּפְסָא.—טפסין, Y. Dem. V, 24 d top, v. טָפוּס.
טפסתא, P. Sm. 1505) carpets, horse-cloths. Targ. Jer. XXXVIII, 11; sq.

sense.definition: Assyr. dupsarru, Schr. KAT 2 p. 424) scribe, royal dignitary.
sense.notes: Ex. R. s. 43 (some ed. מלך as Num. R. s. 2). Gen. R. s. 90 (ref. to Jer. LI, 27) נבוכדנ' ט̇פ̇ס̇ר̇ ט̇פ̇ש … וש̇ר̇ וכ' dull as to wisdom though prince in years, v. אַבְרֵךְ.
Targ. Y. Deut. XXVIII, 12 (divine key-keeper). [B. Mets. 73 b ed. Ven., v. טַפְסָא.]— Pl. טַפְסְרַיָּא. Nah. III, 17 טַפְסְרַיִּךְ (ed. Lag. טפסרך).

sense.definition: (b. h.) to touch closely, (b. h. to mince); to join, add. Part.
sense.notes: pass. טָפוּף, f. טְפוּפָה (cmp. טְפֵי III) added to, liberally measured, contrad. to מחוק levelled, a. גדוש heaped. Men. 7 a לביסא ט' to a basin brimful, with something added on top.— Pl. טְפוּפוֹת. Yoma 48 a

Midr. Till. to Ps. LXXVIII, beg. טִיפְטְפָה דם issued drops of blood. Y. Ter. VIII, 46 a top הגשמים מְטַפְטְפִין ויורדין the rain dripped into it. Sabb. 44 a שמן המְטַפְטֵף oil dripping from the lamp.
Y. Ber. I, 3 a sq. החמה מְטַפְטֶפֶת וכ' the sun glistens on the tops of the mountains.
Targ. Job XV, 8 ואִיטַּפַּת (some ed. אַטְפֵי, h. text תגרע, v. גָּרַע II).

sense.definition: (טָפַף I) addition to city limits, suburb; pr. n. pl. Tefef.
sense.notes: B. Bath. 75 b עתיד … אלף ט' גינואות in the future the Lord shall add to Jerusalem one thousand times the area of Tefef for gardens; Yalk. Zech. 568 (for Var. lect., v. Rabb. D. S. to B. Bath. l. c. note 40. Comment. takes טפ"ף as numerals = 169).

sense.definition: tile; מעשה ט' cake baked on heated tiles.
sense.notes: Sabb. 125 a (Syr. טפקא panis tenuis in sartagine coctus, P. Sm. 1505).
, v. טוּפְרָא
Gen. R. s. 37, end (expl. סְפָר, Gen. X, 30, v. Sm. Bibl. Dict. s. v. Sephar).

sense.definition: (b. h.) to be covered with fat; to be inaccessible, dull, obdurate, stupid (cmp. Lat. pinguis).

sense.notes: Ber. 63 b מִטַּפְּשִׁים they become dull; Taan. 7 a; Macc. 10 a

sense.definition: , part. מְטוּפָּשׁ (denom. of טִפֵּשׁ) decried as a fool, made sport of.
sense.notes: Sifré Deut. 309; Yalk. ib. 942 (corresp. to נבל a. לא חכם, Deut. XXXII, 6) מנוולים ומְטוּפָּשִׁים disgraced and ridiculed as fools.
v. infra.
Targ. Is. VI, 10. Targ. Y. Deut. XXVIII, 28, v. מוֹקְרָא II.

sense.definition: to become or to be dull, foolish; to act foolishly.
sense.notes: Targ. Prov. XXX, 32 (some ed. תִיטְפֵשׁ Pe.). Targ. I Sam. XXVI, 21. Targ. Num. XII, 11. Targ. I Kings VIII, 47 (some ed. אַטְפֵ' Af.).; a. e.

Tem. 16 a. Y. Pes. X, 37 d (Mekh. Bo., s. 18 תם). Cant. R. to I, 1 חכם ט' וכ' first wise, then foolish &c.; a. fr.— Pl. טִפְּשִׁים, טִפְּשִׁין, טִיפְּ'. Sabb. 152 b. Y. Pes. IX, end, 37 a; a. fr.— Fem. טִפֶּשֶׁת. Num. R. s. 20 שזו הט' שבבהמה for this (the ass), the stupidest of animals; Tanḥ. Balak 9 הטִפְּשִׁית.
Targ. O. Lev. XXVI, 41 (h. text ערל). Targ. koh. II, 19; a. fr.—Koh. R. to X, 3 ט' … עמא טפשין וכ' the fool thinks all people are fools &c. Lam. R. to I, 1, רבתי (חד כות'

sense.definition: ט' דלבא dull of understanding; a. fr.— Pl. טַפְּשִׁין, טַפְּשַׁיָּא, טִיפְּ', טַפְּשָׁאֵי.
sense.notes: Targ. Jer. IV, 22. Targ. Koh. V, 3; a. fr.—Ber. 17 b (expl. אבירי לב, Is. XLVI, 1
, v. גּוֹבַיָּא. Yoma 57 a; a. fr.
Ned. 22 b מוסיף ט' gets more and more foolish. Sabb. 152 a טִפְּשׁוּתָן מתוספת בהן Ms. M. (ed. טפשות ניתוספ') their stupidity increases. Yalk. Num. 742 (expl. כסלם, Ps. LXXVIII, 7) טיפשותן; a. e.
Targ. Deut. X, 16 (h. text ערלת).
, v. טִפֵּשׁ

sense.definition: (טְפֵי III, cmp. טָפַף) additional, second layer of a clay dam.
sense.notes: B. Mets. 103 b (Ms. F. טוּפְתָּא; Ar. s. v. טופסא׃ ארכבתא, corr. acc.; v. Koh. Ar. Compl. s. v.), v. אַרְכַּבְתָּא.
, v. טִיפְ'

sense.definition: , pl. טַצְדְּקֵי (= אִצְטַ'; צדק, v. Pesik. Zutr. to Gen. XLIV, 16) excuse, subterfuge.
sense.notes: Men. 41 a ט' למיפטר וכ' you want excuses to free yourself from the duty of wearing show-fringes. [For the phonetic inflection of our and the following wds., cmp. Nöld. Mand. Gramm. § 49.]
B. Kam. 56 a כל ט' וכ' (Ar. a. Ms. F. טַצְדְּקֵי, pl.) whatever damage there is in the power of the animal (left in the scorching sun) to do, it will do in order to get out.
, v. טִיקּ'
, Y. Sabb. VI, 7 d bot., v. טוק

טִיקַּס (v. טכס) [ to stuff, press,] to harness, equip.—Part. pass. מְטוּקָּס, f. מְטוּקֶּסֶת, pl. מְטוּקָּסִּין, מְטוּקָּסוֹת. Num. R. s. 12 אין צב אלא מט' וכ' wagons of tsab (Num. VII, 3) means fully equipped, nothing wanting; Sifré Num. 45; Yalk. ib. 713; Cant. R. to VI, 4 מְטוּכָּס'; Yalk. Is. 372 מטוכ'.—V. next w. end.
אַטְקֵיס same,

sense.definition: (corresp. to b. h. אסר) to harness for war, to prepare battle.
sense.notes: Targ. I Kings XX, 14. Targ. Ex. XIV, 6. Targ. I Sam. XV, 5 וטַ' וכ' he arranged his camp (h. text וירב); a. fr.

sense.definition: to arrange coins, to count, collect.
sense.notes: Targ. II Kings XXII, 4 ( Af.); ib. 9 (ed. Wil. טְקִיסוּ Pe.).—Ib. XXIII, 35 (h. text נגש).—Part. pass. מְטַקַּס arranged, fitted, joined. Ib. XII, 12. Targ. I Kings VI, 31 (h. text חמשית). Targ. II Esth. V, 1 מט' trimmed

Targ. Ps. XX, 6 נִיטְקָס Ms. (ed. Ven. a. Levita נִיטְקֵס; Bxt. a. oth. נְטַקַּס, read נִיטּ'; h. text נדגל). [Targ. Is. XIII, 17, v. טְפַס.] Targ. I Kings VI, 7 מִטַּ' Levita, closely fitted stones (ed. מַטְקַס noun; h. text מסע); cmp. מַטְכְּסָא. [Some of the meanings of טקס a. of טכס are influenced by the Greek τάσσω, τάξις.]
, read:
Y. Erub. III, 21 b באילין ט' Ar. s. v. פרהגבן (ed. טקסיווט) concerning those troops which come as a garrison (whom one likes to meet), opp. רומאי Roman (hostile) troops.
v. טַכְסִיס
imper. of נְטַר.
, v. טְרִי
v. טָרָקָא
, v. טוּרְבִּיל
, Y. B. Bath. I, 15 a, read: פַּרְגּוֹל.
, v. טְרָכוֹנָא

sense.definition: (tragos, τράγος) a mess of groats of wheat, barley &c., groats used for a mess.
sense.notes: Makhsh. VI, 2 טרגיס. Ber. 37 a טרגיס (Ms. F. טריגוס); Ib. Ms. M. (missing in ed.) טרגוס, also טירגוס (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. notes 20, 30). M. Kat. 13 b טרגיס חדא לתלתא (Ms. M. also טירגיס) it is called tragos, when each grain is broken in three parts, v. חֶילְקָא II.
, v. לטרגיה
, v. טְרָיָינוֹס
, v. לטרגיה.—Tosef. Neg. VI, 3, v. טְרִיגוֹן.
Pes. 107 b … מטביל במיני ט' Ar. (ed. תרג') he may make a luncheon of various sweetmeats. Yoma 79 b; Succ. 27 a ת'. Tosef. Ber. IV, 4 תרגי' (Var. תרגומה).
, v. טְרָגוֹס.—[Tosef. Erub. III (II), 9 טרגיס ed. Zuck., read בּוּרְגִּין.]

Nidd. 49 b היה טוֹרֵד וכ' if the liquid drips drop after drop. Bekh. 44 a (עיניו) טוֹרְדוֹת running eyes (more than דלף); [Ar.: restless, constantly twinkling; oth. opin.: shutting with great trouble, v. infra).
Tosef. Yeb. XIV, 5 שמא גל טורד אותו וכ' (v. ed. Zuck. note) perhaps a wave carries and lands him. Ib. טְרָדַנִי גל לחבירו one wave carried me to the other; (Y. ib. XVI, 15 d top טרפני).

Lam. R. to I, 21 טְרָדָהּ חוץ וכ' he sent her out of the palace. Gen. R. s. 83 (play on מ̇הי̇טב̇אל בת מט̇ר̇ד̇) שהיו מט̇יב̇ין … ואח"כ טו̇רְדִין וכ' they dressed her for her husband and then led her away from her husband. Kidd. 31 a וטוֹרְדוֹ מן העולם and drives him (his father) out of the world (makes him desperate). Midr. Till. to Ps. XXXI, beg. וט' אותם מן העולם and drove them into despair, a. fr.—3) to weary, make unsteady. Snh. 22 b; Erub. 64 b דרך טוֹרְדָתוֹ (Taan. 17 b מַטְרִידָתוֹ Hif., Ms. M. everywhere מַטְרַחְתּוֹ, v. טָרַח) walking makes him unsteady (feel the wine).

Sabb. 139 b. Nidd. 25 a, sq. מים … וטוֹרְדִין וכ' water is strong (is in commotion) and stirs the mass up, opp. מצחצחו makes it clear.— Part. pass. טָרוּד, f. טְרוּדָה; pl. טְרוּדִים, דִין …, טְרוּדוֹת a) busily engaged, troubled, anxious. Gen. R. l. c. (play on מטרד, v. supra) ט' היו וכ' they were anxious for a living. Y. Ber. IX, 13 c bot. טרודין Asheri to Ber. IX, 13 (ed. Krot. טורדין) uninterrupted lightnings; a. fr.—b) banished. Num. R. s. 7, v. מַטְלוֹן.
Num. R. s. 20; Tanḥ. Balak 11, end היה נִטְרָד he became confused, opp. שפוי.
Deut. R. s. 2 יִטָּרֵד למטלון he shall be sent into exile. Ib. s. 6 תִּיטָּרֵד וכ'; a. fr.
Taan. 17 b, v. supra.

sense.definition: to trouble, stir up, keep in commotion.
sense.notes: B. Bath. 168 b הוו קא טַרְדֵּי ליה they were troubling him (begging persistently).—Part. pass. טָרִיד, f. טְרִידָא; pl. טְרִידִין, טְרִידָן. Targ. Is. LVII, 20 (h. text נגרש). Targ. Nah. II, 5 ברקין ט', v. preced.—Ber. 16 b הכא ט' in the one case his mind is preoccupied. Erub. 68 a טְרִידְנָא בגירסאי I am engrossed in my studies. Snh. 108 b [read:] דהות טריד (or דטְרִידַת; Ms. F., טְרִיחַת, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 9) that thou wert troubled (in my behalf); Yalk. Job 917 [read:] חמית דטרידת וכ'; a. fr.
Targ. Y. Gen. III, 24; a. fr.—
. Targ. Prov. XXV, 5. Targ. Y. Gen. XXVII, 45; a. e.
Ber. 35 b; Yalk. Deut. 863 דלא תִיטַּרְדּוּ וכ' that you may not be troubled about support &c.
Arakh. 16 b אתי לאִיטְּרוּדֵי he may get into a quarrel.

sense.definition: (cmp. טרק a. נְטַר) to guard, lock up, bolt.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Gen. XIX, 6 Ar. a. Levita (ed. אחד). Targ. Y. Ex. XIV, 3; a. e.—Lam. R. to I, 1 ט' תרעא (חד מירו') רבתי locked the door. Ib. to I, 18 טְרוֹדוּ תרעין shut the doors closely.—Y. Keth. VII, 31 c תרעה טָרִיד if her door is found locked, contrad. to מוגף, v. גּוּף I.
Targ. Y. II Gen. XLIX, 1.
Ber. 16 b אי משום ט' if anxiety be a cause for omitting to pray. Ib. ט' דרשות anxiety about a secular affair, ט' דמצוה about a religious matter; Succ. 25 a
, v. טַרְטֵימַר
= תַּרְדִּין, Tosef. Ter. IV, 5 והט' ed. Zuck. Var.
, v. טְרָיָינוֹס
, v. טַרְגִּימָא
, v. טָרַד
Snh. 26 a. [
Targ. Y. Gen. XXXVI, 30 quoted in ‘Rashi’ to Gen. R. s. 83, end, v. מִטְרְדָה.]
Targ. Y. Deut. II, 13; 14.

sense.definition: (טרז = טרד I, cmp. טרוזא P. Sm. 151
[ moist, cool,] a kind of cucumber or melon eaten for medicinal purposes.
sense.notes: Sabb. 109 a (Ar. טרי', ed. Sonc. טריד).

opin. half-closed; Rashi: round.]— Pl. טְרוּטוֹת. Tosef. Bekh. V, 3 עיניו ט' Var. (ed. Zuck. ת'); Bekh. 44 a (expl. הצִירָן, cmp. Targ. Y. I Gen. XXIX, 17) עיניו ט' Ar. (ed. ת'). Taan. 24 a עיניה ט', opp. יפות. Sabb. 31 a ת'. Snh. 107 b (in a passage omitted in later eds.) עיניה ט'.

sense.definition: (v. טִרְטֵט) straight-lined, abruptly ending, v. תָּרוּט.

sense.notes: , v. טְרוֹקְסִימוֹן

sense.definition: (τρῆμα, ατος, τρημάτιον) perforation, also eye of a needle; only in (בֵּיצָה) בֵּיצַת ט' an egg boiled down to the size of a pill which, on being swallowed by the patient, passes the body unchanged, carrying with it matter which serves the physician for diagnosis.
sense.notes: Ned. VI, 1 ביצת טרמיטא Mish. (Bab. ed. ביצה טורמוט'; Y. ed. טרמיטן); ib. 50 a ביצה טורמיטא; Y. ib. VI, 39 c bot. ביצה טרומיטא, expl. רופיטון.

sense.definition: adv. (נְטַר) waiting, looking out for business, idle.
sense.notes: Lam. R. introd. (R. Isaac 3) קאים ט' וכ' one stands idly waiting a whole day and is not tired, but for prayer one is tired; (Yalk. Is. 318 קאי וטרי; Esth. R. to I, 9 יתיב ומשתעי).

sense.definition: (a contr. of טרי אנא, v. טְרִי) I throw.
sense.notes: Lam. R. to II, 1 הא לכון ט' באפיכון here, you have it, I throw it in your face.
, v. טִיר'
, v. תְּרוֹנוֹס
Tosef. Neg. VIII, 2, v. טֶרֶף.

sense.definition: (part. pass. of טָרַף, cmp. Pi.) disfigured by irregular spots; (oth. opin.) chopped, full of incisions; (oth. opin.) planed, smooth.
sense.notes: Ned. 25 a; Shebu. 29 b (ref. to one swearing that he had seen a serpent ‘like the beam of an oil press’) בט' he meant ‘spotted’ like a beam &c. Ib. (in answer to the argument כולהו נחשי מיטרף טריפין (or טריפי, not טרפי) that all serpents are ‘spotted’) בשגבו ט' (Ms. M. שבגבו) he meant a serpent spotted on the back (and not only around the neck). Ned. l. c. קורת … גבו ט' (read גבה) the back of a press beam may be spotted (i.e. no objection of the purchaser is valid based on the spotted condition of the beam); according to the opinion: ט' = planed, all beams must be planed, (otherwise the purchaser has a right to reject).—[Other meanings, v. טָרַף.]
, v. טֵירוּף

sense.definition: those deciding on defects of animals for ritual purposes, meat-supervisors.
sense.notes: Ḥull. 55 b

sense.definition: those who decided in favor of t’refah, Ib.
sense.notes: 48 b. Ib. 49 a שקילו … דט' seize the cloak of those who decided &c. (make them pay damages).
, Targ. Ps. I, 3 some ed., v. טְיָפָא
, Tanḥ. Ki Thissa 1, לעסק ט', v. טִירוֹן I

sense.definition: (τρωκτή, sub. σταφυλή) dessert grapes, yielding no wine.
sense.notes: Yalk. Num. 709 טריק' (corr. acc.)—Trnsf. a woman that has no menstruation. Y. Keth. I, 25 a bot.; Nidd. IX, 11 Var. in Hai Gaon, v. דּוֹרְקְטִי.
, Yoma 10 a Ms. M., v. תרייקי
, Targ. Ps. XXXV, 3 ed. Lag. a. oth., for h. text סְגרֹ, read: טְרוֹק יָתִי וזמן וכ' guard me, and meet &c. [Ed. Bxt. a. oth. only טרוק.]
, Ber. 37 b, v. טְרִיקְטָא

sense.definition: whatever can be eaten raw, applied to kitchen vegetables, esp. endive &c. Lev. R. s. 3 אגודה אחת של טרוקסימא (some ed. … מון) a bunch of vegetables.
sense.notes: Y. Pes. IV, 31 b, sq. Y. Sabb. VII, 10 a טריקס' ed. Krot. (corr. acc.).—Y. Pes. II, 29 c top (expl. עולשין); Y. Kil. I, 27 a top (some ed. מין …, pl.)—Tosef. Ter. IV, 5 טרקסמן ed. Zuck. (Var. טְרָכְסְמִין, pl.) Tosef. Makhsh. III, 10 טרכ', contrad. to יֶרֶק.

Ber. 35 b היו … דרך ט' וכ' (Ms. M. טרסק'; Ms. F. טריבסמון, corr. acc.) used to bring their fruits home (from the field to the barn) by the way of the kitchen-garden (in sight of the house) in order to make them subject to tithes; Gitt. 81 a; Yalk. Deut. 938.
, v. טָרִיז
, v. טוּרְ'

sense.definition: to run about, be busy, to take pains, prepare.
sense.notes: Ab. Zar. 3 a מי שט' וכ' he who has made preparations on Friday has food for the Sabbath (he who does good in this world can expect reward in the hereafter). Keth. 10 a; Kidd. 45 b חזקה אין … טוֹרֵחַ וכ' the presumption is that one will not go to the trouble of preparing a (wedding) feast and let it go to ruin, i.e. one must have weighty reasons for a divorce immediately after marriage; Yeb. 107 a. Ber. 58 a, v. טוֹרַח; a. fr.—[Y. M. Kat. I, 80 a bot. דבר שאינו ט', v. טָרֵיחַ.]

sense.definition: to put to trouble, put a task on.
sense.notes: Taan. 24 a אתה הִטְרַחְתָּ וכ' thou hast put thy Creator to the trouble of &c. Snh. 8 a מַטְרִיחִין אותי they (the wicked) put me to &c. Lev. R. s. 27 לא הִטְרַחְתִּי עליכם I did not tax you too heavily; a. fr.
Snh. 22 b; Erub. 64 b, a. e., v. טָרַד.
Yalk. Ex. 244 ה' עליו he begged him instantly.

Targ. Koh. II, 11. Ib. IX, 9; a. fr.—B. Kam. 11 a בדנפשיה ט' he takes pains with what belongs to himself (for his own benefit). Ḥull. 83 a דאורח ארעא למִטְרַח וכ' in the bridegroom’s family they generally take more trouble in preparing the wedding feast &c.; a. fr. [Sot. 7 b ומטרח, v. טְרִי.]— Part. pass. טָרִיחַ, f. טְרִיחָא giving trouble, troublesome. Ned. 25 a מילתא דלא ט' an easily intelligible expression. Ḥull. 51 a, a next w.—B. Mets. 112 b ט' להו מילתא (Ms. M. ליה) it is too troublesome for them (for him); a. e.—[Sabb. 82 a, v. טְחַר.]—B. Kam. 80 b Ar., v. תְּרַח.

sense.definition: to make ready for moving, to load (cmp. טָעַן II) Targ. Job XXXVII, 11 (h. text יטריח).

sense.notes: Meg. 22 b לא מַטְרַח ציבורא Ms. M. (ed. לא בעי למִיטְרַח, read למַטְרַח, v. Rashi, a. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) he would not trouble the congregation (to rise before him); Yalk. Lev. 669; a. fr.
Lev. R. s. 16 א' עליה he insisted upon his telling him.—Y. Peah I, 16 b bot. אין מַטְרְחַת עלוי if you strain the chord too much.
Targ. Y. Num. XIX, 2 אִיטְרְחָא (not אַט').
Taan. 24 b מי איכא דמִיטְּרַה וכ' is it so hard a labor to the Lord?
, v. טוֹרַח
Ḥull. 51 a ט' טְרִיחַ לההוא גברא what trouble has been taken by that man (myself)!—[Oth. version: ט' טַרְיֵיה וכ' weariness (of travel) made me shaky.]
, v. טוּרְחָא

Tem. 24 a דקא טרח טי' וכ' because he would undertake a labor unfit for him (on the Holy Day). B. Mets. 93 b לט' יתירתא with reference to special painstaking. Shebu. 45 a bot. טי' ליה מלתא, v. טְרַח I. M. Kat. 13 a מועד משום ט' ולא ט' Ms. M. (ed. only משום ט') in the festive week it is forbidden only for being a labor to some extent; a. fr.
f.

sense.definition: same. Y. Ber. II, 5 a bot. טַרְחוּתָם מרובה the trouble of climbing them down is very great.
sense.notes: Pesik. Bayom, p. 193 a ט' הדרכים the trouble of travelling. Cant. R. to VIII, 6 שהגשמים … סימן טיר' for there are those rains which betoken trouble &c.—Pesik. Shek. p. 20 b; Pesik. R. s. 16 end; Ex. R. s. 34 אין הק"בה בא בט' וכ' the Lord comes not with burdensome laws to be imposed upon &c.

Lev. R. s. 1 משה עסוק בט' וכ' Moses occupied himself with arranging the living of Israel (ordaining dietary laws). Gen. R. s. 94 ט' נפש אחת provision for one soul. Pesik. R. s. 3 (ref. to מתה עלי, Gen. XLVIII, 7) עלי היתה טַרְחוּתָהּ mine was the care for her.

Targ. Koh. II, 10; a. e.—Sabb. 10 a טריח' למיסר וכ' (Ar. כְּרִיהוּתָא) is it such a trouble to tie on a belt?—Pesik. Haḥod. p. 50 a, a. e. עיקר ט' מטרא the real discomfort of the winter season is the rain; a. e.
, Lev. R. s. 7 ר' יוסי בן ט', read, as Yalk. Ps. 766: פִּיטְרָס.
, v. טִיטַרְטוֹן, a. טְרָטִין.
Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. VI, 1 משיְטַרְטֵט ed. Zuck. (Var. משיְרַטֵּט) until the leather for the strap-mattress is plaited; (cmp. Kel. XVI, 4).

sense.definition: (cacophem. perversions of תִּיאַטְרָאוֹת; cmp. meanings of טרט in טָרוּט, טִרְטֵט, a. of טרי, a. similar perversions in אִצְטַדְיָא &c.) theatres, shows.
sense.notes: Lam. R. to III, 5 ומכניסין את הגמל לבתי ט' they bring a camel on their stage (ib. also תַּרְטְיָאוֹת a. תִּיאַטְרוֹן). Yalk. II Sam. 158; Midr. Till. to Ps. XVIII טַרְטִירָאוֹת (ed. Bub. טרטיא'). Keth. 5 a; Sabb. 150 a (Ms. O. טַרְטַסְיָי', early eds. טַרְטְרָאוֹת); a. e. [Various forms in eds. a. Mss.: טַרְטִיסָאוֹת, טַרְטִיּוֹת &c.]—[Ab. Zar. 42 a דרכים וט' ed., Ms. M. סרטיאות, v. סְרַטְיָא a. אִסְרַטְיָא.]
, Ex. R. s. 36, read: סְטַרְטְיוֹטִין or סְרַטְיוֹטִין.

sense.definition: (τριτημόριον, S.) triens, one third of an as, a coin and a weight (about three ounces).
sense.notes: Snh. VIII, 2 ט' בשר (Bab. ed. 70 a ת'; Ms. F. ט', in Gemarah טרדימר; Y. Mish. טרת', Gemarah 26 a טרט') a triens (worth?) of meat. Ib. 70 a (ת') ט' זה וכ' I do not know what this ṭ ar ṭ emar means, but judging from R. José doubling the standard for wine, it may be inferred that ṭ. is half a Manah; Y. l. c. ט' חצי ליטרא ṭ. is half a Litra. (V. Zuckerm. Talm. Münzen p. 8).

sense.definition: (denom. of טוּרְטִינִי) to balance, i.e. to ride with one foot on each side of the animal.
sense.notes: Nidd. 14 a דמְטַרְטֵין when he rides like a man on horseback, דלא מט' when he rides like a woman.
, Sifré Num. 86 לשאר הט', read הֶדְיוֹטִין, v. Yalk. Num. 732, end.
ṭ ar ṭ ur in Dozy Dict. des noms des vêtem., p. 262 sq., Lat. turritum capitis ornamentum &c.) t’ratin, a head cover. Kel. XXIX, 1; Tosef. ib. B. Bath. VII, 5 טְרָטוֹן ed. Zuck. (Var. טרסי).
, Koh. R. to VII, 11 ואתי מן ט' ואמר ליה טליא (emended in later eds. טרסיס) a corrupt passage to be restored by collation with Y. Ber. III, 6 c bot.; perhaps: ואתי חד טליא ואמר ליה.
, v. טַרְטְיָאוֹת

sense.definition: (reduplic. of טרף) to cut out edges, to pink.
sense.notes: scallop (a leather garment). Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. VI, 1 משיְטַרְטֵף ed. Vien. (ed. Zuck. a. oth. משישטרטף, ed. Zolk. משישוטף) (cmp. Kel. XVI, 4 משיחסום וכ' &c.).

sense.definition: (transpos. of craticulum, v. P. Sm. 1516) [ net-work, esp.] a small gridiron.
sense.notes: Targ. Prov. XXVI, 21 (h. text פחם).
, Midr. Till. to Ps. XCIII, 3 היה מטרטר, v. מִיטָטוֹר
Ḥull. 45 b טַרְיֵיה לרישיה shook his head constantly; [Ar.: he bumped his head, shocked his brain]. Ib. 51 a, v. טְרַח II.

sense.definition: to throw, cast; to squirt, drip.
sense.notes: Tam. 32 b ט' באפיה sprinkled his face (with that water). Sabb. 108 b מהו למִטְרָא וכ' Ar. (ed. למימשי, Ms. O. למישרא, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 8) is it permitted to drop some of this water into the eye?—Lev. R. s. 25 יהי טָרֵי וכ' (not טרו) shall cast one fig in his face; Koh. R. to II, 20 יהא טריה (read: יהא טרי חד). Taan. 24 a bot. טַרְיוּהוּ מן גודא וכ' Ms. M. 2 (ed. חבוטו) throw him down from the elevation; a. fr.

sense.definition: Trnsf. שקיל וטרי [ to take up and throw back a ball &c.,] to hear and reply, to argue; to negotiate (corresp. to h. נשא ונתן).
sense.notes: Targ. Ruth IV, 7. Targ. Cant. III, 8 יטַרְיָן (not וטירן; ed. Lag. וטָארָן).—B. Mets. 64 a דלא ש' וט' בהדיה with whom he was not accustomed to deal. Sot. 7 b למישקל ולמִיטְרָא וכ' Ar. (ed. ומטרח, corr. acc.) to argue with &c.; a. fr.—V. טָרוּן.
f., v. טָרִיתָא
, pr. n., v. טָדִי
—[In later literature שקלא וטַרְיָא argument, v. טְרִי.]

sense.definition: (טְרִי) dripping; מֵי ט' a sort of ink, prob. from wine-lees (v. Löw Graph. Requisiten, p. 158, p. 161).
sense.notes: Gitt. 19 a; Sabb. 104 b (early eds. מיטריא in one w.; Rashi: ‘juice of a certain fruit’, oth. opin. ‘rain water’).
, Ber. 56 a Ms. M., v. טוּרְזַיָּא; [cmp., however, טַרְיָיתָא.]
pr. n. pl., v. טְרָיָיא
Targ. Y. Ex. II, 5, constr. טָרִיב בשרא.
Naz. l. c.; Y. ib. I, 51 b top; Tosef. ib. I, 2 דרגון ed. Zuck. (Var. דיגון, corr. acc.); v. דִּיגוֹן.
p. 22, v. טוֹגָא.—Ib. p. 23 מכסה כמין ט', prob. to be read: טְרִיבוֹן (τρίβων) coarse cloak
, v. טְרִיגוֹן
, v. טְרַד, a. טְרוּזָא.

sense.definition: , Gen. R. s. 79; Yalk. Gen. 133 טטרו, read טֵרְטִין; emend the entire passage as follows: קו"ף ק' מילייא סמ"ך ס"ס ט"ית טרטין the Kuf (of קשיטה, Gen. XXXIV, 19) means one hundred millia, the Sammekh— ses, the Teth— tertin, i.e. one hundred millia Sestertium (v. Sm. Ant. s. v. Sestertius), v. דְּיָקִינְתִּין.

sense.notes: , Y. Taan. II, 66 a top, v. טְרָיָינוֹס
, Tosef. Ab. Zar. II, 7 Var., v. אִצְטָרִין

sense.definition: (supposed to be a Persian word, expl. by R. Ḥãnanel by Arabic banîke) gusset, gore.
sense.notes: Sabb. 98 b שפי … עד דט' Ar. (read כי ט', v. Koh. Ar. Compl. s. v., ed. כי טורין) they planed the boards (so as to be gradually decreasing in thickness) like a gusset; Yalk. Ex. 370 כי טורין.
, v. טְרוּזָא
Y. M. Kat. I, beg., 80 a דבר שאינו ט' (Y. Shebi. II, end, 34 b טורח).
, v. טְרח
, v. טַרְחוּתָא
, Bets. 29 a top Ar., v. תִּרְטָא
, v. טוּרְטִינִי
Cant. R. to IV, 1; I, 15 (Gen. R. s. 33 ביבי; Lev. R. s. 31 ברכיה, Yalk. Gen. 59 ביבי).

sense.definition: (?) Traya, Turya; אִישׁ ט' surname of Abba Hoshaya.
sense.notes: Y. B. Kam. X, end, 7 c. Gen. R. s. 58, beg.; a. fr. (V. Neub. Géogr. p. 267).
read:
Y. B. Bath. X, 17 c, v. אוֹגְדוֹיִיקוֹנְטָא.

Ab. Zar. 52 b דינרא ט' והדריינא שיפא Ms. M. (ed. הדרייאנא טוריינא) the Trajanic and Hadrianic denars which were rubbed off; Bekh. 50 a bot. הדריינא טירייאנא שייאפא; ib. top ה' טרינא שייפא (Tosaf. טריינא).

sense.definition: (variously corrupted, the j sound being rendered by ג or כ) pr. n. m. Trajanus, the Roman emperor.
sense.notes: Taan. 18 b (טר' a. טור'); Treat. S’maḥoth ch. VIII טרגיא'; Sifra Emor Par. 8, ch. IX מריינוס (corr. acc.); Y. Taan. II, 66 a top טיריון. Y. Succ. V, 55 b top טרוגיונוס; Lam. R. to I, 16; ib. to IV, 19, a. e. טרכינוס. Ib. to III, 2; 4; a. e. (v. Joel, Blicke in die Religionsgesch. I, p. 17, sq.).—טְרָיָינִי (genitive of Trajanus) Trajan’s ( followers). Ib. to I, 17 טרכיני, v. אִסְפַּסְיָינִי.
Targ. Y. Deut. XI, 6 (h. text יקום).

sense.definition: (טרך, cmp. טרח a. טְרַק I) troublesome, provoking.
sense.notes: Targ. Prov. XIX, 7 (ed. Wil. טָרֵךְ; ed. Lag. טַרְכָן). V. טַרְכָנוּתָא.
, Esth. R. to III, 1, read: טְרִיבוּנוֹס, v. ארטיגוס
, v. טְרַקְסִין
, Y. Sabb. III, 6 a, מיסחי … בטרים בר יטסם ed., Ar. ed. Koh. בטרים בטרים, oth. ed. בט' טירים read: במי טבריא ביו"ט bathing … in the waters of Tiberias on a Holy Day.

sense.definition: (τρῖμμα) a drink or brew prepared of pounded groats and spices, a spiced drink.
sense.notes: Ber. 38 a תמרי … מהן ט' you are permitted to make trimma of dates &c., v. חֲשִׁילְתָּא; Tosef. Maas. Sh. II, 2 ed. Zuck. (some ed. תרומה, corr. acc.).
, read: טְרִימִיטְרָא.
, Gen. R. s. 88, v. טִירוֹנְיָא

sense.definition: (τρίμετρος) trimeter, a verse (or tune) of three iambic meters.
sense.notes: Y. R. Hash. IV, 59 c bot. (defining הֲרָעָה) [read:] כאהן ט' like the trimeter (short-long, short-long &c.), contrad. to תלת דקיקן three small (short) notes.

sense.definition: (tremis) Tremis, a Roman coin, one third of an Aureus.
sense.notes: Lam. R. to I, 1 רבתי (חד מאת' 8). Y. Gitt. III, 47 b סרימיסין (read: טְרִימִיסִין tremissis), v. גּוֹרְדְּיָינִי.
, v. טְרָיָי'
, v. טריסיס
, Tosef. Erub XI (VIII), 17 Var., v. סָרִיג

sense.definition: (incorrect טריסית) m. tressis, a coin worth three ases.
sense.notes: Shebu. VI, 3 טריסית (Y. ed. קטריסי', a corrupt. of quadrussis, four ases). Ib. 40 a top. B. Mets. 46 a ין …, a. ית … Tosef. Maas. Sh. IV, 2; 13; a. e.

sense.definition: , Pesik. R. s. 15 בט', a gloss to בר סימאי, corrupted from בש"ר סימ'; v. Pesik. Haḥod.
sense.notes: , p. 55 b. [Neub. Géogr., citing fr. Ms. Bodl. בטרסוס, refers to Tarsus.]
, v. טְרִיסִין
, v. טְרֵיפְתָּא.—[B. Kam. 16 b, v. next w.]
B. Kam. 16 b למימרא דט' לאו וכ' (some ed. דטריפא, Ms. M. דטָרַף, ref. to the preceding טרף ואכל) does that mean to say that tearing is not his (the lion’s) habit?

sense.definition: being carried away by waves, being cast ashore.
sense.notes: Y. Yeb. XVI, 15 d top נותנין … כדי ט' the court allows a reasonable time sufficient for the discovery of an eventual escape of the husband by being cast ashore.

sense.definition: (denom. of טֶרֶף) covering with leaves, night cover in open air.
sense.notes: Yalk. Gen. 119, v. רְטִיבָה.

sense.definition: an animal torn by a beast of prey.
sense.notes: Midr. Till. to Ps. VII, v. טֶרֶף.

sense.definition: (ritual law) an animal afflicted with a ( fatal) organic disease, the discovery of which, after slaughtering, makes it forbidden, t’refah, (of persons, m.) one having a fatal organic disease (the killing of whom would not be considered murder before the law).
sense.notes: Ḥull. 42 a ט' אינה חיה a t’refa animal cannot survive (a year); a. fr.—Snh. 78 a ההורג את הט' if one kills a person afflicted with a fatal organic disease; וט' שהרג and if such a person committed a murder. Ib. עידי ט' witnesses afflicted &c.; a. fr.

Lev. R. s. 13 (ref. to החיה, Lev. XI, 2) החיה מטְרֵיפָתָהּ וכ' that which can recover from its disease, you may eat.— Pl. טְרֵיפוֹת, טְרֵפוֹת. Ḥull. III, 1; a. fr.—Esp. cases of t’refah, ritual law concerning t’refah. Ib. 48 b; a. fr.

sense.definition: (denom. of Tripolis) Tripolitans, residents of Tripolis on the Phoenician coast.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. II Gen. X, 17 (h. text חוי).
Y. Bicc. II, beg. 64 c
Pesik. B’shall., p. 93 a כל הדא ט' להן לך whither will all this irregular life lead thee?
Ḥull. 94 b.— Pl. טְרֵיפָן, טְרֵיפָתָא. Targ. Y. Lev. XI, 1; Targ. Y. Num. XIX, 3 (some ed. טְרִיפָן, v. Ḥull. 42 a י"ח טרפות).
Targ. Lam. III, 7.

sense.definition: (tracta) a long piece of dough pulled out in making pastry ( tracta or tractum).
sense.notes: Y. Ḥall. I, 57 d ר' יוחנן אמר טריק' חייבת וכ' R. J. says, tracta is subject to Ḥ allah; Ber. 37 b כי אתא … אמר ר' יוחנן טרקנין חייבת וכ' Ms. M. (corr. acc.; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 6; ed. טרוקנין פטורין) when R. … came to Babylonia from Palestine, he related in behalf of R. J. &c. Y. Pes. III, 30 a טרקטה הורי וכ' as to tracta (on Passover) R. … permitted to make only one at a time, but two &c.
, v. טְרוֹקְטִי

sense.definition: (טְרַק I to sting) a sort of wasps.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Deut. VII, 20 (a gloss to אורעייתא, h text צרעה).
, v. טְרִיקְלינָא
, v. טְרַקְלִילָא

Y. Ḥag. II, 77 a bot. הט' מוצע לכם the banqueting couch is spread for you (your reward in the hereafter is prepared).—2) dining room, reception room. Y. R. Hash. IV, 59 b bot. אפ' מט' לקיטון even if they adjourned from the tricl. to the sleeping room. Y. Keth. IV, 28 d; Y. Snh. XI, end, 30 c [read:] בעיא הדא אומנתא ט' וקיטין חופה וקיטון וכ' the following construction is required (in order to make the reception of the bride in the triclinium a legal consummation of marriage) a tricl. and a marriage chamber, and that chamber communicating with the tricl.—Ab. IV, 16, v. פְּרוֹזְדּוֹר.—Tosef. Sabb. XVI (XVII), 18 ט' שהסיקה … בה in a banqueting room (triclinium hibernum) which has been heated a day before …, you may entertain company on the Sabbath. Tosef. Bets. II, 10 ט' שהסיקוהו וכ'; a. e.—3) (τρίκλινος = ὅρριον, S.) granary. Y. Sot. V, 20 b bot. איטלק עלוי חד ט' וכ' he was fined to fill a granary of forty by forty &c.
Targ. II Esth. VII, 8 טרקלו' (corr. acc.)—Lev. R. s. 16 בטְרִיקְלִינֵיה (some ed. בתורק', corr. acc.) in his reception room.— Pl. טְרִיקְלִינִין, טְרַקְ'. Targ. Y. I Num. XXXI, 50.
, v. טְרוֹקְ'
, v. טְרַקְסִין

sense.definition: (נטר, cmp. אִטְּרִי) preserve, pickle, esp. salted or pickled fish.
sense.notes: Meg. 6 a טמוני זו ט' ‘stored things’ (Deut. XXXIII, 19) refers to tarith (as a valuable article of commerce); Sifré Deut. 354; Num. R. s. 13.—Ab. Zar. II, 6 ט' טרופה brine containing hashed tarith (when you cannot recognize the clean and unclean fish). Ib. ט' שאינה טרופה in which the fish can be recognized. Ned. VI, 4 he who vows abstinence from ‘fish’ מותר בט' טרופה is permitted to partake of hashed t. Ber. 44 a
ch.

sense.definition: same. Y. Ned. VI, 39 d top זבין לי טרי וכ' (not ליטרי) sell me tari, and he sells him tsa ḥ ãna (v. צַחֲנָא).
sense.notes: Ib. תמן … לט' וכ' (not ליט') there they call taritha tsa ḥ ãna

sense.definition: (cmp. אִטְּרִי) a sort of pastry, fritters &c. Ber. 37 b, v. הִנְדְּקָא a. גְּבִיל.
(טרך, cmp. טְרַק II), pl. טְרָכִים, constr.
sense.notes: טַרְכֵי binders, preservers (cmp. Syr. טרק a. derivatives P. Sm. 1528). Tosef. Sot. XV, 9, v. טְרַכְסִיד.
, v. טָרֵיךְ

sense.definition: Trachona, Trachonitis, town and district east of the Jordan.
sense.notes: Targ. O. Deut. III, 4; 13; 14 (Y. טַרְגּוֹנָא; h. text ארגב). Targ. Y. II Num. XXXIV, 15 טְרֵכוֹן זמרא; Sifré Deut. 51 טרכונא דנימרא; Yalk. ib. 874 ט' דזימר' (not טרנינא); Tosef. Shebi. IV, 11 ט' דבתחום בצרה ed. Zuck. (Var. טרכתא, incorr.); Y. Shebi. VI, 36 c ט' דמתחם לבוצרה (v. Hildesh. Beitr. p. 55, sq.).
, v. טַרְכָנוּתָא
, v. טַרְכֵּשׁ
, v. טְרָיָינוֹס
, v. טָרֵיךְ
Targ. Prov. XXVI, 28 Ar. a. Lev. (Var. טַרְכּוּנְתָּא; ed. תַּרְכִּוּנְתָּא; Ms. סרכונא).

sense.definition: (a comp. of טֶרֶךְ a. סִיד) binding cement.
sense.notes: Tosef. Sot. XV, 9 if one put sand in the lime, הרי זה ט' ואסור ed. (ed. Zuck. טרכיו סיד הוא, Var. טַרְכֵי סיד) it is cement and therefore forbidden; B. Bath. 60 b הרי זה ט' (Ms. O. טַרְכְּסָאוֹ the binding of it (the lime), cmp. טְרַקְסִין); Sabb. 80 b (Ms. M. תר'). [Treat. S’maḥ. VIII טרכסי', in a corrupt passage, prob. to be read: כרכים.]
, v. טְרוֹקְסִ'

sense.definition: (enlargement of טרך or טרק, v. טָרֵיךְ, a. טְרַק I) [ a wine-stirrer,] a board on which drinks for the table are mixed, side-board (abacus, mensa delphica), a plain board attached to the wall with hinges, to be put up and down (cmp. דְּלִפְקִי, Kel. XXV, 1).
sense.notes: Tosef. Kel. B. Bath. III, 3 ט' חלק (R. S. to Kel. XXV, 1 טרכוס וחלק) a plain tray (without rims). Ib. I, 12 ט' שעשה וכ' a side-board under which they placed a piece of wood, formed like a spear (as an improvised support) for eating at it. Tosef. Sabb. XIV (XV), 2 תרקוש ed. Zuck. (Var. ט', by cler. error מרקוש).
Y. Taan. IV, 68 d top מעברתא דט' the ford of T.

sense.definition: , Midr. Till. to Ps. XIII, 5 באיזה ט' וכ'; ed. Bub.
sense.notes: תלמוסא, Ms. Vien. טל'; Yalk. Ps. 660 תלמידא, prob. to be read: באיזו טוֹלְמִירְיָא וכ' (τοληρία) with what hardihood do you speak such words (of bad omen)?
, v. טוּרְמִי
, v. טְרוֹמִיטָא
, v. טוּרְמִנְטִין
, Snh. 14 a Ms. M., v. טוּרְמִיסִין
Lev. R. s. 37 טַרְסִין וכ' Ar. (Var. a. ed. פשפשין) they searched every ship &c.—[B. Kam. 98 a, v. טְרַשׁ I.]
m., pl. טְרָסִין, v. טֶרֶשׁ
gent. of Tarsus.— Pl. טַרְסָאֵי. Targ. Esth. II, 21 (ed. Lag. טִירְ'), v. טַרְסִי II.
pr. n. pl., v. טַרְסִיס

sense.definition: weaver of metallic thread, artistic weaver, differ. fr. גַּרְדִּי.
sense.notes: — Pl. טַרְסִיִּים. Ab. Zar. 17 b Ar. a. Ms. Pes. (ed. תרס', v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 40). Succ. 51 b וט' בפ"ע וכ' (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 400) artistic weavers apart and common weavers apart; Tosef. ib. IV, 6.—Sabb. 47 a מטה של ט' the weavers’ horizontal loom or frame for embroidery (differ. in Rashi).
57 b מטלית של ט' the bronzers’ apron.

gent. of Tarsus, Tarsian.— Pl. טַרְסִיִּים, טוּרְ'. Meg. 7 a בגתן … שני ט' היו והיו מספרים בלשון טרסי Ms. M. (only בגתן … שני טרשיים היו) Bigthan and Teresh were two Tarsians and conversed in the Tarsian language; ib. 13 b שני ט' … טורסי (Ms. M. … תרסיים תרסי). Ib. 26 a בה"כ של ט' Ms. M. (ed. טור'; Tosef. ib. III (II), 6 אלכסנדרים) the synagogue of the Tarsians in Jerusalem (Rashi: of the bronze-workers, v. preced.). Y. Shek. II, 47 a בה"כ של ט' (Yeb. 96 b טבריא).
, read: סְרַטְיָאוֹת.

Y. Gitt. VII, beg. 48 c; Y. Ter. I, 40 b (perh. proper noun).— Pl. טַרְסַיָּא, טַרְסַיָּיה. Y. Kil. IX, end, 32 d.—Lev. R. s. 35, end כנישתא דט' וכ' the synagogue of the weavers in Lydda (or bronze-workers, or Tarsians), v. טַרְסִי II.
Targ. Y. I Gen. X, 4 טַרְסַס ed. Amst. (oth. eds. טרסיס, v. אַלַּס); Targ. I Chr. I, 7 טרסוס ed. Lag.—2) (prob.) Tartessus, in Spain. Targ. Ps. XLVIII, 8. Ib. LXXII, 10. [V. טריסיס.]

sense.definition: (τρισκελής, τρισκέλλων, sub. כסא) a chair on three legs, esp. a camp-chair.
sense.notes: Num. R. s. 12; Tanḥ. Naso 19; (Tanḥ. T’rumah 9; Gen. R. s. 68 תְּרוֹנוֹס). Sabb. 138 a כסא ט' (Ms. O. כסא וט').

sense.definition: (a corrupt. of κάρταλλος, v. קרסטל) basket.
sense.notes: Lev. R. s. 19; (Midr. Sam. ch. V קרסטל). Sabb. 5 a. Ib. 53 a תולין ט' לבהמה you may hang a basket with fodder around the neck of an animal.—V. next w.

sense.definition: (κάρταλον, v. preced.) a basket (fiscellus) containing fodder, used for muzzling.
sense.notes: Sabb. 53 a bot.; (Tosef. ib. IV (V) 5 קרסטלין, Var. קרטלין). B. Mets. 90 a (Ms. M. קרסטילין, oth. Mss. קרסטלין, קסרטל, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note).
, v. טְרוֹקְסִימוֹן
, v. טַרְפְּעִיקָא

Lev. R. s. 26 טוֹרֵף ואוכל tears in order to satisfy his appetite. Koh. R. to X, 11 הארי ט' the lion goes out for prey. Sot. 47 b טוֹרְפֵי טֶרֶף those robbing (the poor). Zeb. 53 b חלקו של טוֹרֵף the territory of the tearer (wolf = Benjamin, Gen. XLIX, 27). B. Kam. 116 b לטוֹרְפָהּ to plunder it; a. fr.

sense.definition: to cast with force, knock, strike against; to throw away, reject, eject.
sense.notes: Ḥull. III, 3 טְרָפָהּ בכותל he cast or knocked the bird against the wall. Pesik. R. s. 11; Num. R. s. 2 מגרשה אני טוֹרְפָהּ אני I will divorce her, I will cast her out (cmp. טָרַד).—Ber. 5 b טוֹרְפִין לו וכ' his prayer is thrown in his face (refused). Y. Yeb. XVI, 15 d top טְרָפַנִי, v. טָרַד.
Yoma IV, 1 ט' בקלפי he took the ballot out with haste.—Esp. to seize for a debt. B. Mets. 15 a ובא ב"ח וטְרָפָהּ and a creditor of the previous owner came and seized it, v. טִירְפָּא.

sense.definition: to chop, hash, to beat, mix.
sense.notes: Sabb. XIX, 2 ט' יין ושמן beat wine and oil; a. e.—Part. pass. טָרוּף, f. טְרוּפָה. Ib. 38 a בשר ט' chopped meat. Ab. Zar. II, 6, v. טָרִית. Y. Nidd. IV, 51 a (of a foetus). Sabb. VIII, 5 (80 b) ביצה ט' an egg beaten and mixed with oil; a. fr. V. טָרוּף.
Kil. IX, 1. Y. Orl. III, 63 a; Y. Keth. VI, end, 31 a צמר בכור שטְרָפוֹ wool of a first-born that has been hackled (and mixed up with, other wool).
Makhsh. II, 4 הטוֹרֵף את גגו (Var. המטהר) if one scrubs his roof; Tosef. ib. I, 8.

sense.definition: to make טְרֵפָה, to inflict an organic defect.
sense.notes: Ḥull. 85 b, sq. צא טְרוֹף go and maim the animal (before slaughtering it).
Ib. 9 a, a. e. במה נִטְרְפָה from what cause it became t’refah

sense.definition: to be in disorder, a) (with דעה, or לב) to be confused, bewildered, not fully conscious.
sense.notes: Y. Sabb. II, 5 b bot. נִטְרְפָה דעתו של אבא my father’s mind is unclear; Snh. 68 a. Ib. 43 a כדי שתִּטָּרֵף דעתו (not שתטרוף) that his (the culprit’s) consciousness may be benumbed; Num. R. s. 10.—Ib. נ' לבו his mind becomes confused (from drinking); a. fr.—b) (with שעה, of political disturbances) to be troubled. Snh. 11 a; Sot. 48 b; Tosef. ib. XIII, 5 נטרפה (ה)שעה the political condition was too much troubled (persecutions prevailing). Y. Dem. V, 24 d bot.; a. e.
Succ. III, 9 כל העם מטָרְפִין בלולביהן ed. Y. (Mish. ed. Pes. מט'את לול'; ed. מנעועין) all the people shook their branches constantly (during the recitation at Hallel, contrad. to נענע).
—Part. pass. מְטוֹרָף. Num. R. s. 10 לבו מ' וכ' his mind is disturbed and he talks improper things, v. supra.

sense.definition: to reject one’s petition, to refuse.
sense.notes: Part. pass. מְטוֹרָף. Ber. V, 5 שהוא מ' that he (the patient for whom prayer is said) is rejected (bound to die), opp. מקובל accepted.

sense.definition: to disfigure, to make ungainly by spots, incisions &c., v. טָרוּף).
sense.notes: Part. pass. as ab. Koh. R. to X, 11 the serpent is asked מפני מה גופך מט' why has thy body been disfigured (v. Gen. III, 1

sense.definition: to cast about (a ship on high sea), v. Hithpa.—Part.
to become t’refah, to be afflicted with a fatal organic disease.
sense.notes: Num. R. s. 12, end; Cant. R. to VI, 4; Pesik. Vayhi p. 10 a, a. e. לא הִטְרִיפוּ the animals were found to be free from an organic disease.—[

sense.definition: (denom. of טֶרֶף) a) to cover with foliage.
sense.notes: Yalk. Gen. 119, v. רָטַב.—b) to sprout with moisture, be sappy. Gen. R. s. 69 ה' מצות וכ' (Yalk. Jud. 38 הפריח) sprouted with good deeds &c., v. רָטַב.—[

נִיטָּרֵף to be tossed about, to be in a storm near the shore. Taan. III, 7 (19 a) על הספינה המִיטָּרֶפֶת וכ' for a ship which is seen from the coast to be tossed about; ib. 14 a המְטוֹרֶפֶת (v. supra; Ar. ed. Koh. נִטְרֶפֶת Nif.). Tosef. Sabb. XIII (XIV), 11 נִיטָּרְפָה ספינה וכ' the ship has been thrown back several times (was prevented from landing by the breakers).

B. Mets. 14 a אתי … וטַרְפָהּ מיניה (not וטרפא) the creditor came and took it from him (by legal seizure); ib. וקא טָרֵיף ליה מיניה (Ms. H. וטַרְפָהּ מיניה).—ט' לקוחות to seize property sold by the debtor, v. לְקוּחוֹת. Ib. 19 a; a. fr.
Y. Snh. X, 29 a וטָרֵיף לון לארעא and let them fall down. Lam. R. to I, 5 ויִטְרוֹף גרמיה and let him throw himself down. Ib. to IV, 2 טְרוֹף קולתיך וכ' cast down thy pitcher before me; a. fr.

Ber. 28 a ט' אבבא knocked at the door. Snh. 97 a.—Ib. 67 b ט' ליה בטבלא he struck the tabla before him; a. v. fr.—Trnsf. to carp at, to contest the validity of a decision. Y. Snh. I, beg. 18 a בעי מִיטְרוֹף wanted to protest (against R. Isaac’s decision because he acted as a single judge).—5) to declare t’refah. Ḥull. 10 b. Ib. 48 b סבר … למִיטְרְפָהּ Mar … wanted to declare it t’refah; a. fr.— Part. pass. טָרִיף a) struck down (in the agony of death). Targ. Jud. III, 25; IV, 22 (h. text נֹפֵל). Lam. R. to IV, 5 טְרִיפִין בקיקלא (not טריפון) lying on dunghills.—b) thrown away. Y. Snh. X, 29 a top הא טריפין לך they are thrown down before thee (cmp. טְרוּן).—c) (denom. of טרפא, v. טָרוּף) spotted, full of incisions; planed. Ned. 25 a; Shebu. 29 b, v. טָרוּף.—[Y. Shebi. I, end, 33 c א"ר יודן כד טריפן לעוביה, read with R. S. to Shebi. I, 8: א"ר יודן בר טרפון or טריפון, לעוביה being a corrupt tautography of ליעז' ב"י = ליעזר בן יעקב.]
Targ. II Kings VIII, 12 (h. text רטש). Targ. Nah. II, 8 (h. text תפף).
Targ. Prov. XXIII, 28 מְטָרֵף.
Part. pass. מְטַרַף. Targ. Y. I Ex. XIV, 3 (ed. Amst. מִטַּ' Ithpa.). Targ. Y. II Num. XII, 12 מְטַרָפָא.—Trnsf. to agitate, trouble, v. infra.

sense.definition: to be knocked about, dashed; to be tossed about; to be in spasms.
sense.notes: Targ. Is. XIII, 16. Ib. LI, 20; a. e.—Lev. R. s. 12 beg. כהד' אילפא דמִיטָּרְפָא וכ' like the ship that is tossed about in the breakers &c. Snh. 95 a אתו יונה אי' קמיה a dove came down and rolled before him in spasms.—Trnsf. to be agitated, troubled. Targ. Gen. XLI, 8 (some ed. מְטַר' Part. pass. Pa., v. supra). Targ. Ps. LXXVII, 5; a. fr.—Y. Taan. I, 64 b bot. למה אִיטָּרְפוּן … להכא why did the rabbis (you) take the trouble of coming hither.

sense.definition: to be spotted, full, of incisions &c., v. supra a. טָרוּף.

sense.notes: Ḥull. 57 b במידי דמִיטָּרְפָה בה in the same limb through the mutilation of which the animal became t’refah. Ib. 48 a דלאו מיניה מיטָּרְפָא where the cause of its being t’refah lies not in the mutilated limb itself.
m., v. טַרְפָא

Sot. 47 b, v. טָרַף.—Gen. R. s. 99 (ref. to מטרף, Gen. XLIX, 9) מטַרְפּוֹ של יוסף from making Joseph a prey, i.e. saving Joseph; מטַרְפָּהּ של תמר saving Tamar. Yalk. Ps. 637; Midr. Till. to Ps. VII, ed. Bub. יושב על טַרְפּוֹ (oth. ed. טְרֵפָתוֹ) sits over his prey.
Snh. 108 b, v. next w.
Sifra Metsora, beg. ובראשה ט' with green foliage on its top, v. next w.; Y. Sot. II, 18 a top וראשה ט' (corr. acc., or read as Tosef. Neg. VIII, 2 טרוף).

sense.definition: preced.) plucked, fresh; (homilet., v. preced.) nourishment.
sense.notes: Snh. 108 b (ref. to Gen. VIII, 1

sense.definition: מאי משמע דהאי ט' לישנא דמזוני הוא what evidence is there that taraf has the meaning of food? Answ.
sense.notes: ref. to הטריפני (Prov. XXX, 8); Erub. 18 b (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note).

Targ. Gen. VIII, 11. Targ. Is. XXXIV, 4; a. fr.—Ḥull. 47 b ט' דאסא leaf of a myrtle; a. fr.—Nidd. 20 a ט' מציעתא fem. (Rashi: מציעא), v. infra.—Trnsf. ט' דנחירי wing of the nose. Ber. 55 b.— Pl. טַרְפַיָּא, טַרְפֵי. Targ. Gen. III, 7; a. fr.—Succ. 37 b נתרי ט' leaves may fall off. Sabb. 129 a חמרא בר הלתא ט' Rashi (ed. בת) wine of a vine that has changed foliage three times, i.e. wine in its third year. Nidd. l. c. טַרְפָן fem., v. דָּרָא I.

Ber. 59 a top, and it looks כט' דטריף like an irregular piece that has been torn off (from the star); Rashi: like a battered piece that has been mended by hammering; (Ms. F. ומתחזי דמיטרפא מיטרף you can see that it has been torn off, Vers. in Rashi: כדטרפא מטרף, prob. to be read כטרפא דמְטַרַף).
(טְרַף) טַרְפַת rapping. Targ. Jud. V, 11 (in a passage missing in ed. Lag.).
, Gen. R. s. 10 בקעת בי ט', v. נְטוֹפָא
, v. טִירְ'
, v. טְרֵיפָ'

sense.definition: Tarfon, a Tannai (v. Fr. Darkhé Mish., p. 101 sq.).
sense.notes: Pes. X, 6; a. v. fr.—V. טְרִיפוֹן.
, v. טְרַפִּיזִיטֵיס
, read: טְרַפִּיזִין.

sense.definition: (טפח, with ר inserted; cmp. טְפִיחַ I) [ pitcher, cmp. אָכוּז,] mouth of the womb.
sense.notes: Ḥull. 55 b = אֵם = שַׁלְפּוּחִית. Ib. 56 b
, Targ. Y. Lev. XI, 19, v. עַרְפְּדָא.
— Pl. טְרַפִּיזִין. Gen. R. s. 64, end (‘Rashi’: טְרַפִּיזוֹת).—V. טְרַפִּיזִין.
Y. B. Mets. IV, beg. 9 c טרפוניטיס (corr. acc.). Num. R. s. 4 טְרַפְסִיטֵיס (cmp. τράπεσα for τράπεζα, S.).
Gen. R. s. 11 Ar., v. דִּיסְקוֹס I.
, v. טרפידא
, v. טַרְפְּשָׁא
Targ. O. Lev. XI, 14; Deut. XIV, 13 (h. text איה).
Targ. Y. Lev. XI, 14 דַּיְּתָא ט' (not דחיא); cmp. דַּיָּה.
הִטַּרְפֵּס to climb, v. טָפַס.

sense.definition: , Ithpa. אִטַּרְפֵּס (v. preced., cmp. טְפַז) to leap, take exercise.
sense.notes: Y. Kidd. II, 62 c bot. בעייא הוינא מִטַּרְפְּסָא אזלה מט' וכ' I expected to have exercise in going to and coming from the bath.
, v. טְרפִּיזִיטֵיס

sense.definition: (corresp. to τροπαϊκος = Victoriatus) Victoriatus = Quinarius, half a denar (v. Zuck. Talm. Münz. p. 30).
sense.notes: Yoma 35 b. Gitt. 45 b; Keth. 64 a מאי ט' (not טרפעיקין) how much is a T.? Sifré Deut. 294; Yalk. ib. 938.— Pl. טַרְפְּעִיקִין. Keth. V, 7; Tosef. ib. V, 7 (missing in ed. Zuck., Var. טרפקעי; oth. ed. טַרְפְּעִיקִים).
, v. preced.

sense.definition: (טרף, with formative ש, as in טַרְכֵּשׁ; v. P. Sm. 1527 s. v. טרפשתא) a rag-like, irregularly shaped organ, membrane &c. Ḥull.
sense.notes: 49 b ט' דליבא pericardium with the fat attached to it.— Pl. טַרְפְּשִׁין shreds. Ib. 46 a (in Hebr. dict.) נדלדלה כבד ומעורה בט' if the liver is detached and disarranged in shreds.
B. Kam. 115 b לא טְרָקוֹ nobody stirred, or mixed it.
Sabb. 110 a ולטְרוֹקִינְהוּ בהדי הדדי let him mix them together.
Taan. 25 a, v. אִסְקוּטְלָא I.
טָרֵק to sting, bite. Sabb. 109 b דטָרְקֵיה חיויא whom a serpent has stung. Ib. 110 a, v. חִיוֵי; a. fr.—[Yoma 77 a, v. מַטְרְקָא.]

sense.definition: (cmp. טְרַד II) to bolt, tie, gird; to guard.
sense.notes: Targ. Ps. XXXV, 3, v. טרוקיתקא.—Ber. 28 a טְרוֹקוּ גלי; Snh. 113 a דטַרְקֵיה, v. גַּלָּא. B. Mets. 86 a וטַרְקֵיה לבבא וכ' and bolted the door before him. Erub. 102 a דין לא נִטְרוֹק this must not bolt, i.e. with this bolt as it is you dare not bolt or unbolt. Part. pass. טָרִיק locked up. Targ. Job XXVI, 13 (h. text בָּרִחַ).

sense.definition: (preced.; cmp. Syr. טרק, P. Sm. 1528) a castle, palace.
sense.notes: Targ. Prov. XXV, 24 וביתא ט' though the house be a palace (h. text ובית חבר).
Targ. Koh. X, 11 לט' ולנזקא (ed. Amst. a. oth. לטַרְאָקָא) for disturbance and injury.
, v. טָרְקְלָרִין
, Esth. R. beg. בימי ט', read: בימי היְוָונִים.
, v. טַרְכֵּשׁ
, v. טְרִיקְטָא
, Yoma 10 a Ar., v. תרייקי

sense.definition: s. v. בלס: תַּרְקְיָא; cmp. anthracias, ἀνθράκιον) name of a gem.
sense.notes: Targ. O. Ex. XXVIII, 19 (Y. ערקין, corr. acc.); ib. XXXIX, 12. Targ. Y. Num. II, 18.
, read: טְרִיקְלִין.

sense.definition: (comp. of טְרַק II a. קלילא) the runner’s strapping, leggin, greave.
sense.notes: Targ. Esth. V, 9 אִסְטַרְקְלִילֵיה his leggin.— Pl. טְרַקְלִילִין. Targ. I Sam. XVIII, 6 (ed. Lag. טְרִיקְלִ'; Kimḥi Vers. טרקלין). [טרקלילין, Tosef. Sabb. XVI (XVII), 18; Tosef. Bets. II, 10 Ar., v. טְרִיקְלִין.]
, v. טְרִיקְלִ'. [V. preced. w.]
Y’lamd. to Num. XX, 8 (quot. in Ar.) ט' אם יהיה ביד אדם if a man possesses a torcularium; Yalk. ib. 763 (our w. omitted); Ex. R. s. 25, beg. טרקארין, טרקאירין (read: טָרְקְלָארִין).
, v. טְרִיְקטָא

sense.definition: (enlargement of טְרַק II, cmp. טְרַכְסִיד) lath- and plaster-wall, partition in the interior of houses.
sense.notes: Tosef. Ohol. V, 5 כלים שבט' R. S. to Ohol. IV, 1 (ed. רסטקאות, Var. רטסק') vessels lying in niches or closets of partition walls.

sense.definition: same, esp. אַמָּה ט' the two cedar-covered partitions, with a vacant space between, which separated the Holy of Holies from the Holy and occupied the space of one cubit, the text (I Kings VI, 16) leaving it undecided from which of the two sacred areas that cubit’s space was deducted.
sense.notes: In the second Temple that partition was replaced by two curtains with a space between. Midd. IV, 7 אמה ט' one cubit for the partition. Yoma 51 b אבל … אמה ט' וכ' but in the second Temple, where there was no partition wall, … they made two curtains. B. Bath. 3 a; a. fr.—Y. Kil. VIII, 31 c bot. (among doubtful things) ואמה ט' (add to the above six things) the ammah traks ĭ n. מהו ואמה 'ט why is it called a. tr.? (Answ., taking our w. for τάραξιν, acc. of τάραξις, confusion) טריכסון מהו מבפנים מבחוץ (ἐτάραξεν, cmp. בריכסון) it created confusion: what is it? inside? outside?; Y. Yoma V, 42 b bot. טירקסון.
, v. טְרוֹקְסִימוֹן
B. Kam. 98 a מחייה וטַרְשֵׁיה … (Var. טרסיה, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 300) he struck upon the coin with the hammer and battered it (so that the stamp was effaced).

sense.definition: (denom. of טֶרֶשׁ) to harden, make brittle.
sense.notes: Ḥull. 46 b בקרירי לא דמְטָרְשֵׁי you must not put the lungs in cold water, because it makes the coat of the lungs brittle (so as to crack when you blow them up; [Ar. ed. Koh. בחמימי לא דמט' not in hot water because ‘it makes strong’]; v. כְּוַץ.

sense.definition: (cmp. טְרַק II) to lock up, obstruct; (neut. v.) to be stopped up, (trnsf.) to be deaf, silent.
sense.notes: Tanḥ. Vayishl. 8 מהולתך טַרְשָׁא וכ', v. חֲרַשׁ; Y’lamd. to Lev. XXVII, end and to Num. XXI, 1 (quot. in Ar.).—Lam. R. to I, 17 [read:] ט' סלקית וט' נחתית (not טמשא) silent do I go up (to Jerusalem) and silent do I go down.

sense.definition: , pl. טְרָשִׁים, טְרָשִׁין (טרש I) rugged, stony ground; crags, clefts; quarry … B. Bath. 103 a ט' שאמרו the crags of which they speak (נקעים a. סלעים ib.
sense.notes: Mish. VII, 1). Y. Kil. I, 27 b bot. Arakh. 14 b; Yalk. Lev. 677 טְרָסִין. Gen. R. s. 23 נעשו ט' became craggy (unarable). Lev. R. s. 36 ט' גדולים large stony clods, v. בָּלַשׁ. Sot. 34 b. Y. B. Bath. IV, 14 c bot. הט' המוקצין וכ' the rocks which are cut from it (the quarry).

sense.definition: (טְרַשׁ II) [ deafness,] (sub. רִבִּית) deaf or silent usury, tarsha, a sale on time at a price higher than the seller would take if he sold for cash, e.g. one sells beer in Tishri (when it is cheap), to be paid for in Nisan (when beer is higher) at the Nisan price.
sense.notes: B. Mets. 65 a ט' שרי tarsha is permitted (is no usury). Ib. ט' דידי my (R. Papa’s) tarsha (sale of date beer on time &c., v. supra). Ib. ט' דידי ודאי וכ' my (R. Ḥama’s) tarsha (selling goods to be carried at his risk to the dearer market, the money to be paid on returning) &c. Y. ib. V, 10 c bot. אין זו רביתא אלא ט' (not הטרשא) this is not direct usury, but it is tarsha.— Pl. טַרְשֵׁי. Bab. ib. 68 a ט' פפונאי, expl. כט' דרב פפא like the sales of R. Papa, v. supra.
, v. טַרְסִי
, v. טוּשׁ
, v. טִישְׁ'

] (= תַּשְׁתְּ', שקי; cmp. טַצְיְּקָא) troughs, or bucket arrangement for pumping water for the boiler. Nidd. 68 a אטו … ט' חסרת וכ' Ar. (ed. omit אטו) doest thou want boilers? dost thou want buckets? dost thou want slaves? [Rashi: bathing chairs; Tosaf. to Nidd. 66 b, a. v. אם, identifies our w. with טכטכא; Saadia: combs.]
, v. טוּשׁ I
. Targ. Ps. XXVII, 5. Targ. Prov II, 1; a. e.

sense.definition: to be hidden, lie in wait.
sense.notes: Targ. Ps. LVI, 7 יִטְשׁוּן בכמנא (ed. Lag. י' כמנא; h. text יצפינו, K’ri יצפונו). Targ. Prov. I, 11; a. e.—Taan. 24 a טָשׁוּ מיניה (הוו) they hid themselves before him. Ib. 29 a טשא מינייהו hid himself before the Romans. Ab. Zar. 70 a כי היכי דטְשִׁינָא אנא אִיטְּשֵׁי וכ' as well as I hide myself here, an Israelite may have hidden himself &c.; a. e.

sense.definition: to hide one’s self, to be hidden.
sense.notes: Targ. Prov. XXVIII, 28. Ib. XXVII, 5 מִטַּשְׁיָא hidden. Targ. Ps. LXXXIII, 4 מִתְטְשִׁין (some ed. מִטַּטְשִׁין).—Ab. Zar. 70 a, v. supra.
Targ. Prov. XXV, 2. Ib. XXVI, 15.

sense.definition: (preced.) that which is reserved, future compensation.
sense.notes: Targ. Ps. XVII, 14. Targ. Job. XX, 26.
